96 mJeeceer meejoevevo

ieÙes Les~ otmejs celeevegmeej Ùes heeBÛeeW mebvÙeemeer Skeâ meeLe efouueer ieÙes Les Deewj JeneB GvnW helee Ûeuee efkeâ mJeeceer meeqÛÛeoevevo veece OeejCe keâjkesâ mJeeceerpeer MÙeeceue oeme veecekeâ Skeâ meppeve kesâ Iej "njs ngS nQ~ mJeeceerpeer kesâ meeLe cegueekeâele keâjves kesâ yeeo mJeeceer meejoevevo meevÙeeue ceneMeÙe keâes meeLe ueskeâj FšeJee Ûeues ieÙes~ mJeeceer efMeJeevevo ves 22 HeâjJejer 1891 kesâ Deheves Skeâ he$e ceW efueKee Lee, ‘‘Mejled Deewj meevÙeeue – oesveeW FšeJee ceW nQ~ iebieeOej, nefj leLee jeKeeue efouueer ceW nQ~ ueielee nw Jes ueesie hebpeeye peeÙeWies~’’ Deye mJeeceerpeer kesâ meeLe efJeÛÚso nes peeves kesâ heeBÛe Je<e& yeeo ner meejoevevo Gvekesâ meeLe uevove ceW efceueWies~

FšeJee ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ mJeemLÙe ceW LeesÌ[e megOeej nesves hej, Jes leLee meevÙeeue ceneMeÙe ceLegje, Je=voeJeve, ØeÙeeie Deeefo leerLeeX keâe oMe&ve keâjles ngS Devlele: DeØewue ceW JeejeCemeer hengBÛes~ meejoevevo ves hegve: meeOeve-Yepeve ceW [tye peeves keâe efve§eÙe keâjkesâ Yesuethegje kesâ yeeyet meerleejece kesâ GÅeeve-YeJeve ceW DeeßeÙe efueÙee~ Gme meceÙe Gme GÅeeve ceW ke=âheevevo lees Les ner, Fmekesâ Deefleefjòeâ kegâÚ efoveeW kesâ Yeerlej ner "ekegâj kesâ ke=âheeØeehle YeeF& Yetheefle Yeer JeneB Dee hengBÛes Deewj yeerceej heÌ[ ieÙes~ Skeâ efove Gmeer GÅeeve ceW ceesleer Ùee oerveveeLe (GHe&â oervet) veecekeâ Skeâ JeÙemkeâ Oecee&Leea ves mJeeceer meejoevevo mes YeWš keâer~ Gme efove efYe#ee ceW meòet efceuee Lee~ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves yeerceej Yetheefle keâes meòet efKeueeles ngS oerveveeLe kesâ meeLe yeeleW keâer Leer~ Fmekesâ yeeo mes oerveveeLe Øeefleefove meejoevevo kesâ heeme Deeves-peeves ueies~ kegâÚ efove yeeo mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ ogiee&yeeÌ[er kesâ efvekeâš eqmLele DeVeoe oòe kesâ GÅeeve-YeJeve ceW Ûeues peeves hej oerveveeLe Gvekesâ meeLe efvelÙemebie keâjles jns~ oerveveeLe JebMeer oòe kesâ cekeâeve ceW jnles ngS efYe#ee ceeBiekeâj Keeles Les~ hejvleg efpeme efove Jes Deheves neLe mes Yeespeve yeveeles, Gme efove meejoevevo peer keâes efvecev$eCe oskeâj efKeueeÙee keâjles Les~ meevÙeeue ceneMeÙe leLee YeeF& Yetheefle kesâ keâuekeâòee Ûeues peeves hej oerveveeLe Yeer DeVeoe oòe kesâ GÅeeve-YeJeve ceW Dee ieÙes Deewj meejoevevo peer kesâ meeLe efveJeeme keâjves ueies~16

mJeeceer DeYesoevevo petve kesâ ceOÙe ceW ØeÙeeie mes JeejeCemeer DeeÙes Les~ jLeÙee$ee kesâ efove mJeeceer meejoevevo, mJeeceer DeYesoevevo Deewj oerveveeLe ‘hebÛekeâesmeer’ heefj›eâcee kesâ efueS efvekeâuekeâj leermejs efove DehejeÖ ceW ueewš DeeÙes Les~ Jen 22 keâesme keâer heefj›eâcee Leer~ efmej hej metÙe& keâe leehe Deewj heeBJeeW ceW jemles keâer ieceea! leerveeW ves Gme efove keâeHeâer keâ° G"eÙee Lee Deewj Skeâ Skeâ keâj leerveeW ves ner yegKeej mes efyemlej hekeâÌ[ efueÙee Lee~ otmejs efkeâmeer Deew<eefOe kesâ DeYeeJe ceW Jes ueesie efyeuJehe$e keâe jme heerÙee keâjles Les~ ›eâceMe: Jes ueesie mJemLe nes G"s~ Fmekesâ yeeo mJeeceer DeYesoevevo Jejenveiej ce" ueewš ieÙes~

cegceg#eg oerveveeLe keâe JewjeiÙe leLee Deele&YeeJe osKekeâj mJeeceer meejoevevo GvnW mebvÙeeme

16. oerveveeLe-efJe<eÙekeâ Ùes meejs leLÙe yeÇÿeÛeejer ØekeâeMeÛevõ Éeje GvneR keâer [eÙejer mes meb«eefnle ngS nQ~

osves keâes jepeer ngS~ Skeâ MegYe efove osKekeâj GvneWves oerveveeLe keâes mebvÙeeme-›ele17 ceW oeref#ele efkeâÙee Deewj GvnW mJeeceer meeqÛÛeoevevo veece efoÙee~ oerveveeLe Yeer jeceke=â<Ce mebIe ceW meeqcceefuele nes ieÙes~ mebIe ceW Skeâ mJeeceer DeÉwleevevo keâes ÚesÌ[keâj DeeÙeg ceW DevÙe keâesF& Yeer meeqÛÛeoevevo mes pÙes‰ ve Lee~ oerIe&peerJeer oerveveeLe mebIe ceW ‘yetÌ{s yeeyee’ kesâ veece mes heefjefÛele ngS~

OÙeeve-OeejCee leLee MeeŒeÛeÛee& ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ efove yeÌ[s Deevevo ceW yeerle jns Les~ hejvleg YeÙeevekeâ Ketveer DeeBJe keâe jesie FmeceW yeeOekeâ efmeæ ngDee~ oerveveeLe kesâ mesJeeÙelve mes heerÌ[e keâe eEkeâefÛeled GheMece nes peeves hej GvneWves keâuekeâòes ueewš peeves keâe efve§eÙe efkeâÙee~ oerveveeLe ves Gvekesâ efueS jsueieeÌ[er kesâ efškeâš keâer JÙeJemLee keâj oer~ peeves kesâ hetJe& mJeeceer meejoevevo ves oerveveeLe keâer ØeeLe&vee keâes mJeerkeâej keâjles ngS Dehevee "ekegâj keâe efÛe$e oerveveeLe keâes os efoÙee~ Fme Øekeâej ueieYeie Ún cenerves JeejeCemeer ceW lehemÙee Deeefo keâjves kesâ yeeo 1891 F&. kesâ efmelecyej ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo Jejenveiej ce" ueewšs~ Gve efoveeW ce" kesâ Skeâ efveJeemeer yeÇÿeÛeejer keâeueerke=â<Ce (yeeo ceW mJeeceer efJejpeevevo) keâer mce=eflekeâLee ceW lelkeâeueerve mJeeceer meejoevevo keâe Skeâ Jemlegefve‰ efÛe$eCe Øeehle neslee nw~ GvneWves efueKee nw, ‘‘Mejled cenejepe Fmeer Øekeâej keâ"esjleehetJe&keâ ceeOegkeâjer keâjkesâ JeejeCemeer ceW meeOeve-Yepeve keâjles ngS ueieYeie Ún ceeme Ketveer DeeBJe mes keâ° Yeesieves kesâ yeeo Jejenveiej ce" ueewšs Les~ Gve efoveeW Gvekeâe Mejerj yeÌ[e ner ogye&ue Deewj DeeqmLe-Ûece& cee$e ner jn ieÙee Lee~ ... ›eâceMe: Jes mJemLe nes G"s Deewj leevehetje ueskeâj Jes ØeeÙe: ner Deheves ceOegj keâC" mes Yepeve ieeles, keâesF& DevÙe leyeuee yepeelee, yeekeâer ueesie megveles Deewj keâYeer keâYeer meeLe ceW ieeles~’’18 Gvekeâer yeeleW ceOegj leLee JewjeiÙehetCe& nesleeR~ Gvekeâer yeeleeW mes F&Õej kesâ Thej efveYe&jlee keâe YeeJe JÙeòeâ neslee jnlee Lee~ GvnW ØeeÙe: Ùen Yepeve ieeles megvee peelee Lee, ‘ceQ iegueece, ceQ iegueece, ceQ iegueece, lesje’ Deeefo~

Øe›epÙee kesâ meeLe meeLe OÙeeve-OeejCee keâjles ngS mJeeceer meejoevevo pees keâ"esj lehemÙee mecheVe keâjkesâ ce" ceW ueewšs Les, Gmekesâ Ghemebnej kesâ ¤he ceW GvnW DeeOÙeeeqlcekeâ GheueeqyOe kesâ Deefleefjòeâ kegâÚ cetuÙeJeeve DevegYeJe Yeer Øeehle ngS Les~ ÙeLee, GvneWves yeleeÙee Lee, ‘‘efveŠmecyeue heneÌ[ ceW Ietceles Ietceles oes ÛeerpeW cesjs osKeves ceW DeeÙeeR – kegâÚ ueesieeW keâes ceQves osKee efkeâ kegâÚ efove keâ° G"ekeâj jnves kesâ yeeo Gvekeâe ceve Flevee Úesše nes peelee nw efkeâ Jes DeeOes hewmes Deewj ÙeneB lekeâ efkeâ ÛeJeVeer kesâ efueS Yeer PeieÌ[e keâjles nQ~ ... ceve keâes Jes ueesie efyeukegâue mebkeâerCe&

  1. Fme mebvÙeeme-oeve keâer Øeef›eâÙee DelÙevle mebef#ehle Leer~ efvee|o° efove mJeeceer meejoevevo ves #escesÕej Ieeš hej peekeâj ceeqvoj kesâ meeceves ßeerjeceke=â<Ce kesâ Skeâ efÛe$e keâer mLeehevee keâer Deewj Skeâ Deemeve ueieekeâj yew" ieÙes~ oerveveeLe kesâ efveJe&Œe neskeâj iebieemveeve keâjkesâ Gvekesâ heeme Deeves hej GvneWves Skeâ efyeuJehe$e hej Deeuelee mes Øew<ecev$e efueKekeâj Gmes oerveveeLe keâes os efoÙee~ cenejepe kesâ efveoxMeevegmeej oerveveeLe ves Jen efyeuJehe$e ßeerjeceke=â<Ce kesâ ÛejCeeW ceW Dee|hele keâjkesâ ØeCeece efkeâÙee Deewj leoghejevle mJeeceer meejoevevo keâes Yeer ØeCeece keâjkesâ GvneWves JeŒe OeejCe keâj efueS~
  2. Deleerlesj mce=efle (yeBieuee «ebLe), mJeeceer ßeæevevo, le=leerÙe meb., he==. 36

98 mJeeceer meejoevevo

heMeg kesâ meceeve keâj [eueles nQ~ ... Deewj yeekeâer kegâÚ Deuhe ueesieeW keâe ceve, Fme Øekeâej keâ° G"ekeâj jnves hej hetjer leewj mes Goej nes peelee nw~ efkeâmeer Yeer Jemleg hej Gvekeâer cecelee veneR jn peeleer, ÙeneB lekeâ efkeâ Mejerj hej Yeer cecelee veneR jn peeleer; cene-JewjeiÙe kesâ YeeJe keâe GoÙe neslee nw Deewj YeieJeeve kesâ Thej Skeâ lejn keâer ØeieeÌ{ efveYe&jlee Dee peeleer nw~’’ efÉleerÙele:, mJeeceer meejoevevo ye=nòej meeOeg-meceepe kesâ mecheke&â ceW Deekeâj mecePe ieÙes efkeâ ßeerjeceke=â<Ce leLee Gvekesâ DelÙegÛÛe YeeJeeoMe& keâe keäÙee cenòJe nw~ $e+<eerkesâMe mes GvneWves Øeceoeoeme efce$e keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘keäÙee keântB, ieg®osJe kesâ oMe&ve keâjkesâ nceejs ves$e Kejeye nes ieÙes nQ~ Ssmeer Ûeerpe DevÙe$e keâneR Yeer veneR efceueleer Deewj efceueves keâer DeeMee Yeer veneR nw~’’ efHeâj GvneWves yeuejece yeesme keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘yeenj keâe YeeJe osKeves hej, Jes keäÙee Les – Ùen LeesÌ[e-yengle mecePee pee mekeâlee nw~ hejvleg GvnW hetjer leewj mes mecePeves kesâ efueS Gvekeâer ke=âhee kesâ Deefleefjòeâ otmeje keâesF& GheeÙe veneR nw~’’ le=leerÙele:, YeÙeevekeâ mebkeâš kesâ cegKe ceW heÌ[keâj, ce=lÙegYeÙe keâer Ûegveewleer kesâ meeceves mJeeceer meejoevevo keâer Devlee|veefnle Meefòeâ ves mHegâefjle neskeâj Skeâ Deesj Gvekeâer Deelceßeæe keâes Deewj Yeer iecYeerj yevee efoÙee Lee leLee otmejer Deesj ieg®Meefòeâ ceW Gvekesâ efJeÕeeme keâes Deewj Yeer ÂÌ{lej keâj efoÙee Lee~ ßeæe leLee efJeÛeej kesâ megvoj efceueve ves Gvekesâ meeOeveheLe keâes megiece keâj efoÙee Lee~ Fme Øemebie ceW Ùen yeele Yeer mcejCe jKeveer nesieer efkeâ mJeeceer meejoevevo, mJeeceer legjerÙeevevo, mJeeceer Ùeesieevevo Deeefo mebvÙeeefmeÙeeW keâes osKekeâj ner ye=nòej meeOeg-meceepe ßeerjeceke=â<Ce Éeje ØeJee|lele YeeJeeoMe& kesâ meeLe heefjefÛele ngDee Lee~

peÙejeceyeešer ceW ceeB kesâ Iej hej peieæe$eer-hetpee nesvesJeeueer Leer~ Dekeäletyej ceW meejoevevo peer ves hetpee keâer meece«eer ueskeâj Ùee$ee keâer~ Gvekesâ meeLe meevÙeeue ceneMeÙe, keâeueerke=â<Ce (yeeo ceW mJeeceer efJejpeevevo), ieesueehe-ceeB leLee Ùeesieerve-ceeB Yeer ieÙes~ Fve ueesieeW keâes meceerhe heekeâj ceeB kesâ Deevevo keâe ef"keâevee ve jne; Jes Ùener veneR "erkeâ keâj hee jner LeeR efkeâ Fve ueesieeW keâer kewâmes osKeYeeue keâjW Deewj keäÙee efKeueeSB! Gvekesâ ceele=mvesn kesâ hueeJeve mes meYeer efJeYeesj nes ieÙes~ hejce Deevevo kesâ meeLe hetpee kesâ kegâÚ efove yeerle ieÙes~ Fmekesâ yeeo meYeer DeefleefLeÙeeW keâes ceuesefjÙee keâe yegKeej nes ieÙee~ mevleeveeW keâes veerjesie keâjves kesâ efueS ceeB keâer mesJee leLee JÙeekegâuelee keâe JeCe&ve nce henues ner keâj Ûegkesâ nQ~ peÙejeceyeešer ceW Deewj "njves hej ceeB kesâ keâ° ceW Je=efæ nesieer – Ssmee meesÛekeâj meejoevevo leLee DevÙe ueesie ceeB keâes mecePee-yegPeekeâj keâuekeâòes ueewš DeeÙes~

FOej 1892 F&. ceW HeâjJejer kesâ ØeejcYe ceW ce" Jejenveiej mes Deeueceyeepeej kesâ Skeâ efkeâjeÙes kesâ cekeâeve ceW mLeeveevleefjle nes ieÙee Lee~ cekeâeve yeenj leLee Yeerlej mes DeeueerMeeve Lee~ hetJe& keâer Deesj ieueer ceW Fmekeâe cegKÙe Éej Lee~ cegKÙe Éej mes ØeJesMe keâjves hej Gòej leLee oef#eCe keâer Deesj oes Úesšs oeueeve Ùee yejeceos Les~ meeceves Deebieve Lee~ ueewškeâj mJeeceer meejoevevo leLee yeÇÿeÛeejer keâeueerke=â<Ce ves Gmeer keâcejs ceW DeeßeÙe efueÙee, pees yeeo ceW "ekegâjIej kesâ ¤he ceW heefjefÛele ngDee Lee~ ceuesefjÙee kesâ Øekeâeshe mes oesveeW ner efyemlej hekeâÌ[s Les~ [e@keäšj efJeefheve Iees<e keâer efÛeefkeâlmee nesleer jner~ mJeeceer meejoevevo ØeeÙe: ner keâcyeue DeesÌ{keâj heÌ[s jnles Les~ Deew<eefOe leLee heLÙe keâer LeesÌ[er-yengle ner JÙeJemLee nes heeleer Leer~ JÙeeefOe keâe keâ° Jes ÛegheÛeehe menve efkeâÙee keâjles Les~

censvõveeLe oòe ves Fme keâeue kesâ Skeâ efove kesâ DevegYeJe keâe JeCe&ve efkeâÙee nw~ Gme efove Jes Deeueceyeepeej ce" ieÙes Les~ mebOÙee nes jner Leer~ nJee ceW "C[ keâe DeeYeeme Lee~ censvõ peekeâj meejoevevo kesâ heeme yew"s~ keâeHeâer efoveeW yeeo censvõ keâe Deevee ngDee Lee~ mJeeceer meejoevevo keâes G"keâj GvnW ÛeeÙe yeveekeâj osves keâer FÛÚe ngF&~ censvõveeLe kesâ mecemle G»e-DeeheefòeÙeeW keâes DemJeerkeâej keâjkesâ Jes oerJeej kesâ menejs veerÛes ieÙes Deewj Ûetune peueeves kesâ yeeo heeveer iejce keâjkesâ Thej ues DeeÙes~ ÛeeÙe yeveekeâj censvõ keâes osves kesâ yeeo GvneWves mJeÙeb Yeer Skeâ keâhe ÛeeÙe heer~ censvõveeLe keâes Ssmee ueie jne Lee ceevees meejoevevo peer Skeâ owJeer YeeJe mes heefjhetCe& nes G"s Les, pees Gvekeâer yeeleÛeerle, cegKeceC[ue kesâ YeeJe leLee ieues kesâ mJej mes DeefYeJÙeòeâ nes jne Lee~19

Fmeer meceÙe mes oerIe&keâeue lekeâ mJeeceer meejoevevo keâes Meejerefjkeâ DemJemLelee kesâ keâejCe keâ° G"evee heÌ[e Lee~ 4 DeØewue 1892 kesâ efove GvneWves Øeceoeoeme efce$e keâes efueKee, ‘‘JeejeCemeer mes Ketveer DeeBJe kesâ meeLe ÙeneB Deeves kesâ yeeo mes ner Mejerj yeÌ[e DemJemLe nes jne nw~ Skeâ-ve-Skeâ yeerceejer ueieer ner jnleer nw~ Ketveer DeeBJe "erkeâ nes ieÙee nw, hejvleg 4-5 cenerveeW mes ceuesefjÙee keâe keâ° Yeesie jne ntB~ Fme meceÙe še@efvekeâ heer jne ntB~’’ efHeâj Ún cenerves yeeo 26 Deòetâyej keâes GvneWves Øeceoeoeme yeeyet keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘cesje mJeemLÙe leYeer mes "erkeâ veneR nw~ Deye lekeâ Gmeer ceuesefjÙee yegKeej mes Yeesie jne ntB~ Deepe Yeer LeesÌ[e yegKeej DeeÙee nw~’’ efÛeefkeâlmee keâer megefJeOee kesâ efueS yeerÛe yeerÛe ceW Jes keâuekeâòes peekeâj yeuejece-YeJeve ceW efveJeeme keâjles Les~

Fmeer yeerÛe 1892 F&. kesâ ßeerjeceke=â<Ce-pevceeslmeJe keâe meceejesn efkeâÙee ieÙee~ mJeeceer efMeJeevevo ves JeejeCemeer mes ueewškeâj oef#eCesÕej ceW nesvesJeeues pevceeslmeJe ceW Yeeie efueÙee Lee~ 6 ceF& 1892 keâes Skeâ he$e ceW GvneWves efueKee Lee, ‘‘ßeerieg®osJe keâe pevceeslmeJe Fme yeej DelÙevle meceejesnhetJe&keâ mecheeefole ngDee~ keâuekeâòes kesâ ueieYeie 1500 megefMeef#ele ueesieeW ves Deekeâj efJeMes<e GlmeenhetJe&keâ FmeceW Yeeie efueÙee Deewj GvneR ceW mes 5-6 šesefueÙeeW ves nefjkeâerle&ve efkeâÙee~ Skeâ šesueer ves Gvekesâ hegveerle Ûeefj$e keâe hee" keâjkesâ ueieYeie meYeer ueesieeW keâes cegiOe keâj efueÙee~ efpeme keâes"er ceW Jes efveJeeme keâjles Les Deewj efpeme mLeeve hej GvneWves lehemÙee Deeefo keâer Leer, Gme Gme mLeeve hej yengle-mes ueesieeW ves DeleerJe Deevevo kesâ meeLe nefjkeâerle&ve leLee mee°ebie ØeCeece efkeâÙee~ Deepekeâue yebieeue kesâ Deb«espeer efMeef#ele ueesie pees Fme Øekeâej Yeòeâ nes

100 mJeeceer meejoevevo

jns nQ, Ùen F&Õej keâer efJeMes<e ke=âhee ner nw~’’20

hejJeleea Je<e& kesâ ßeerjeceke=â<Ce-pevceeslmeJe keâe Skeâ mebef#ehle efJeJejCe osles ngS 28 HeâjJejer 1893 keâes mJeeceer efMeJeevevo ves Øeceoeoeme yeeyet keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘ceneslmeJe hejmeeW mecheVe nes ieÙee~ 5-7 npeej ueesieeW keâe meceeiece ngDee Lee~ meYeer kesâ cegKe hej Glmeen, Yeefòeâ leLee Deevevo kesâ ue#eCe Âef°ieesÛej ngS Les~’’ keânvee ve nesiee efkeâ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves Yeer Fve GlmeJeeW ceW GlmeenhetJe&keâ Yeeie efueÙee Lee~

meceÙe efceueves hej Jes efJeefYeVe mLeeveeW mes pegšekeâj efJeefYeVe F&meeF& Oece&«evLe heÌ{e keâjles Les~ ueielee nw efkeâ Fmeer keâeue ceW GvneWves Fve meye «evLeeW keâe DeOÙeÙeve keâjkesâ Skeâ mecemÙee keâe meceeOeeve efkeâÙee Lee~ ßeerjeceke=â<Ce ves osKee Lee efkeâ F&meecemeern keâer veekeâ LeesÌ[er Ûehešer nw~ yeeo ceW meejoevevo peer ves keâne Lee, ‘‘F&mee cemeern kesâ Ûesnjs keâe leerve Øekeâej mes JeCe&ve efceuelee nw~ ÙentefoÙeeW kesâ efpeme celeevegmeej Gvekeâer veekeâ LeesÌ[er Ûehešer nw, "ekegâj ves Jewmee ner osKee Lee~’’21

Fve efoveeW yengle mes ueesieeW keâes mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ DeeÛeej-efJeÛeej ceW Skeâ lejn kesâ Dee#eshe leLee nleeMee keâe YeeJe oerKe heÌ[e Lee~ keâYeer Gvekesâ cegKe mes megveeF& heÌ[lee, ‘‘Slough of despondency – efvejeMee keâe oueoue’’ – efkeâleveer YeÙebkeâj Jemleg nw! ‘‘Castle of doubt – mebMeÙe keâe efkeâuee’’ – efkeâleveer YeÙeevekeâ Ûeerpe nw! Skeâ efove Jes yeeFefyeue mes F&mee keâer JeeCeer heÌ{keâj megvee jns Les, ‘‘Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest – ’’ heÌ{vee meceehle nesles ner Jes jes heÌ[s~ ‘‘kegâÚ Yeer lees veneR ngDee, osnOeejCe efJe[cyevee cee$e nw’’ – Fme lejn keâer yeeleW ØeeÙe: ner Gvekesâ cegKe mes megveves keâes efceueleeR~ ØelÙe#eoMeea censvõveeLe keâer uesKeveer mes Skeâ efove keâer Iešvee keâe efJemle=le efJeJejCe Øeehle neslee nw~ Gme efove jele ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo ves kegâÚ Yeer Yeespeve veneR efkeâÙee~ iejceer keâe ceewmece Lee~ Skeâ ÛešeF& ueskeâj Jes yeÌ[s keâcejs kesâ yejeceos ceW uesš ieÙes~ jele kesâ iÙeejn yepes kesâ ueieYeie Jes heef§eceer efKeÌ[keâer keâer Deesj cegKe efkeâÙes OÙeeve ceW yew"s~ jele Deewj Yeer ienjer nesleer pee jner Leer~ ÛeeBoveer kesâ Deeueeskeâ mes keâceje Deeueesefkeâle Lee~ menmee megveves ceW DeeÙee efkeâ mJeeceer meejoevevo iegveiegveeles ngS kegâÚ iee jns nQ~ ›eâceMe: Gvekesâ ieues keâe megj ÛeÌ{lee ieÙee~ Jes iee jns Les –

(YeeJeeLe&) –

  1. pevceeslmeJe kesâ yeeo mJeeceer efMeJeevevo keâeceejhegkegâj ieÙes Les~ JeneB Jes Skeâ ceen mes Yeer DeefOekeâ keâeue lekeâ ØeÛeC[ ceuesefjÙee mes heerefÌ[le jns~ JeneB mes ce" ueewšves hej GvneWves Øeceoeoeme efce$e keâes Ùen he$e efueKee Lee~

keäÙeeW ØeYeg ÙetB ner JÙeLe& peieled ceW peerJeve cesje yeerlee peeS;

Gvekesâ ùoÙe keâer JÙeekegâuelee JÙeòeâ neskeâj Skeâ JesoveeceÙe heefjJesMe keâer me=ef° keâj jner Leer~ ieeÙekeâ kesâ oesveeW ves$eeW mes Deßeg ØeJeeefnle nesves ueies~ Gme meceÙe Jes YeeJe ceW efJeYeesj Les, efoMee-keâeue keâe GvnW peje-mee Yeer yeesOe veneR jn ieÙee Lee~22

›eâceMe: Gvekeâer Fme efvejeMee kesâ cesIe ÚBš ieÙes Deewj efJeÕeeme keâer jefJejeqMceÙeeW mes Gvekesâ efÉOee-mevosn otj nes ieÙes~ meeOeve-peerJeve keâer Øeieefle keâoeefÛeled ner kesâJeue TOJe&ieeceer nesleer nw~ osKeves ceW Deelee nw efkeâ meeOekeâ keâes keâYeer Deevevo, lees keâYeer efvejevevo keâe Yeer DevegYeJe neslee nw~ Fmekesâ Deefleefjòeâ meejoevevo Deeefo meeOekeâeW keâer OeejCe-#ecelee DeefOekeâ nesves kesâ HeâuemJe¤he Gvekeâe ue#Ùe Yeer DelÙegÛÛe neslee nw, Fme keâejCe GvnW menpe ner le=eqhle veneR efceueleer~ Jewmes Gvekesâ nenekeâej keâer DeefYeJÙeefòeâ kesâ yeerÛe Yeer, meYeer ueesie Gvekesâ lehe:mveele JÙeefòeâlJe kesâ ceeOegÙe& keâe DevegYeJe efkeâÙee keâjles Les, efJeMes<ekeâj Jes ueesie og:Ke-keâ° Ùee JÙeeefOe ceW heÌ[ves hej Gvekeâer menevegYeteflehetCe& mesJee heekeâj OevÙe nes ieÙes Les~

oef#eCeer Yeejle keâe Dehevee YeüceCe meceehle keâjkesâ mJeeceer DeYesoevevo ce" ceW DeeÙes ngS Les~ kegâÚ efoveeW yeeo ner Gvekesâ heeBJe ceW efieveerJece& keâe IeeJe osKeves ceW DeeÙee~ Ùen Skeâ meb›eâecekeâ jesie Lee~ meYeer ueesie YeÙeYeerle Les~ mJeeceer DeYesoevevo ves Deheves DevegYeJe keâe JeCe&ve keâjles ngS efueKee nw, ‘‘cesje meeje Mejerj Hetâue ieÙee Deewj ceQves efyeukegâue ner efyemlej hekeâÌ[ efueÙee Lee~ [e@keäšj keâes metÛevee oer ieÙeer Deewj GvneWves heeBJe ceW Skeâ Skeâ keâj meele yeej MeuÙeef›eâÙee keâer~ Ûeej cenerveeW lekeâ ceQ Fmeer Øekeâej efyemlej hej heÌ[e jne~ Gme meceÙe Mejled kesâ DeLekeâ heefjßece leLee ÙelvehetCe& mesJee keâer yeele YegueeF& veneR pee mekeâleer~ Deenej-efveõe lÙeeiekeâj Gmeves cesjer mesJee keâer~ efvejbpeve kegâÚ efoveeW kesâ efueS yeenj ieÙee Lee~ ueewšves kesâ yeeo Jen cesjer Megßet<ee ceW ueie ieÙee~ Deheves ieg®YeeFÙeeW kesâ efve‰ehetCe& Øesce keâer yeele ceQ keâYeer Yetue veneR mekeâlee~ leerve ceen efyemlej hej heÌ[s jnves kesâ yeeo Oeerjs Oeerjs cesjs mJeemLÙe ceW megOeej nesves ueiee~ Ûeueves keâer Meefòeâ lees Skeâ lejn mes Leer ner veneR~ Øeefleefove Mejled kesâ keâvOes keâe meneje ueskeâj Skeâ Úesšs efMeMeg kesâ meceeve Skeâ Skeâ keâoce jKekeâj Ûeuelee Lee~ Mejled ves efvee|Jekeâej efÛeòe mes ieYe&OeeefjCeer ceeB kesâ meceeve cesjer mesJee keâer Leer~ ›eâceMe: cesjer Ûeueves-efHeâjves keâer Meefòeâ ueewš DeeÙeer~’’23

  1. ßeerceled efJeJeskeâevevo mJeeceerpeerj peerJevesj IešveeJeueer (yeBieuee «ebLe),KeC[ 2,ÛeewLee meb.,he=.9-10
  2. Deeceej peerJevekeâLee (yeBieuee «ebLe), he==. 210

102 mJeeceer meejoevevo

FvneR efoveeW yeuejece yeesme kesâ kegâueieg®-JebMe kesâ Heâkeâerj (Ùe%esÕej YeóeÛeeÙe&) #eÙejesie mes Dee›eâevle ngS Les~ jesie ceW lespeer mes Je=efæ nes peeves kesâ keâejCe Heâkeâerj yeÌ[s ogye&ue nes heÌ[s Les~ Gvekeâer DeeÙeg Gme meceÙe kesâJeue 30-32 jner nesieer~ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves ce=lÙegheLe kesâ Ùee$eer Heâkeâerj keâer DeLekeâ mesJee keâer Leer~

mJeeceer meejoevevo Éeje jesefieÙeeW keâer heefjÛeÙee& ves mebIe ceW efkeâcJeovleer keâe ¤he OeejCe keâj efueÙee nw~ Gvekesâ meeefVeOÙe-cee$e mes ner jesieer keâes yeue leLee meneje efceue peelee~ Fve meye keâLeeDeeW keâe meb#eshe ceW GuuesKe efkeâÙee peelee nw~ vejsvõveeLe kesâ Iej ceW efkeâmeer keâes ÛesÛekeâ ngDee Lee~ kegâÚ efove jesieer keâer mesJee keâjves kesâ yeeo Iej kesâ ueesie Lekeâ ieÙes nQ – Ssmee %eele nesves hej MejÛÛevõ Fme keâeÙe& ceW De«emej ngS~ GvneWves jele jele Yej peeiekeâj jesieer keâer mesJee keâer~

ieg®YeeFÙeeW ceW mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo keâer mesJee keâjvee Skeâ yeÌ[er keâef"ve yeele Leer~ 1904 F&. ceW mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo keâeHeâer keâeue lekeâ šeÙeHeâeÙe[-pJej mes «emle jns~ yegKeej Glej peeves kesâ yeeo Yeer yeeuekeâ-mJeYeeJe cenejepe24 mveeve keâjvee Ùee iebiee kesâ efkeâveejs šnueves peevee veneR Ûeenles Les~ Fve jesieer keâes meBYeeueves kesâ DevegYeJe keâe JeCe&ve keâjles ngS mJeeceer meejoevevo ves keâne Lee, ‘‘cenejepe kesâ hesš keâer lJeÛee keâer efmeueJeš ceW hemeerves mes meÌ[keâj yeoyetoej IeeJe nes ieÙee Lee~ cenejepe kewâmes Yeer mveeve keâjves keâe veece lekeâ veneR uesles Les~ Skeâ efove oes yeeušer heeveer ueeves kesâ yeeo ceQ cenejepe keâes mecePeekeâj ues DeeÙee~ heeveer osKeles ner cenejepe keân G"s

– legce mecePeles veneR Mejled, mveeve keâjles ner efHeâj yegKeej nes peeÙeiee~ ceQves yengle mecePeeÙee, hejvleg DeeefKejkeâej cegPes Gvekeâe neLe hekeâÌ[keâj ues Deevee heÌ[e~ Gme lJeÛee keâer efmeueJeš keâes ceQves yeÌ[er meeJeOeeveer kesâ meeLe meeyegve leLee heeveer mes Oees efoÙee – leye cenejepe yeÌ[s KegMe ngS~ Fmeer Øekeâej Skeâ Skeâ efove kesâ Devlej hej mveeve keâjeves hej cenejepe keâe IeeJe "erkeâ nes ieÙee~ hejvleg iebiee kesâ efkeâveejs peeves keâes keânves hej Jes yeesueles, ‘Mejled, legce mecePeles veneR, ieeÌ[er hej ÛeÌ{les ner neš& Hesâue nes peeÙeiee~’’ ‘‘"erkeâ nw ÛeÌ{keâj ner osKe uees ve, kewâmes neš& Hesâue neslee nw’’ – keânkeâj peye ceQves Gvekeâe neLe hekeâÌ[keâj ieeÌ[er hej yew"eÙee, leye Yeer cenejepe keâns pee jns Les, ‘‘Mejled, legce mecePe veneR jns nes, ieeÌ[er Ûeueles ner neš& Hesâue keâj peeÙeiee’~’’ keânvee ve nesiee efkeâ Fmeer Øekeâej mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ DeLekeâ heÇÙeeme mes Jes hetjer leewj mes mJemLe nes G"s Les~

ieewjer-ceeB iebiee kesâ efkeâveejs Skeâ Kegues keâcejs ceW lehemÙee keâj jner LeeR~ Gmeer meceÙe Jes ÛesÛekeâ mes Dee›eâevle ngFË~ jesie kesâ Øekeâeshe mes Jes yesnesMe heÌ[er jnleer LeeR~ meceeÛeej heeves kesâ yeeo mJeeceer meejoevevo ves mesJee keâjkesâ GvnW veerjesie efkeâÙee Lee~

ßeerceeB kesâ Skeâ mecyevOeer ÛesÛekeâ mes heerefÌ[le Les~ Gme meceÙe mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ neLe

24. meeOeg-yeÇÿeÛeejerieCe mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo keâes ‘cenejepe’ kesâ ¤he ceW mecyeesefOele efkeâÙee keâjles Les~ yeeo ceW meYeer ueesie Gvekesâ Fmeer veece keâe GheÙeesie keâjves ueies~

ceW Yeer Skeâ IeeJe Lee~ GvneWves IeeJe hej heóer yeeBOekeâj jesieer keâer mesJee keâer Leer~ yeejn-Ûeewon efove mesJee-šnue kesâ yeeo GvneWves jesieer keâes mJemLe keâj efkeâÙee Lee~

mJeeceer efÛeoevevo (ieesmeeFË) oerIe&keâeue mes GodyeesOeve ceW keâeueepJej mes keâ° Yeesie jns Les~ meye ueesieeW ves DeeMee ÚesÌ[ oer Leer~ ieesmeeFË cenejepe Yeer Deheveer neuele mecePekeâj mebkeâuhe keâj yew"s efkeâ Jes kesâJeue nefjveece keâjWies Deewj veeefjÙeue keâe heeveer heerÙeWies~ Fmekesâ efmeJeeÙe Jes Deewj keâesF& Yeer efÛeefkeâlmee mJeerkeâej veneR keâjWies~ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves lejn lejn mes mecePeekeâj Devle ceW GvnW FvpeskeäMeve ueieJeeves kesâ efueS jepeer keâj efueÙee~ kegâÚ efoveeW kesâ Yeerlej ner Jes "erkeâ nes G"s~

Deheveer ùoÙeJeòee leLee Demeerce OewÙe& kesâ yeue hej mJeeceer meejoevevo jesieer keâe ceve peerle uesles Les~ jesieer keâes JeMe ceW ueeves kesâ efueS, Gmekesâ meejs n"keâj ceevekeâj Yeer Gmes meBYeeueves keâe keâewMeue Gvekeâer ØelÙeglheVe-ceefle keâe heefjÛeeÙekeâ Lee~ Gvekeâer mesJee-Megßet<ee keâer keâneveer DevÙe meYeer ueesieeW kesâ efueS efÛej ØesjCeemheo yeveer ngF& nw~

yeBieuee meved 1300 kesâ ceeIe ceW meejoevevo peer keâes peueJeeÙeg heefjJele&ve nsleg Ùee$ee keâjves keâe Skeâ DeJemej efceuee Lee~ heg$eer keâer ce=lÙeg mes MeeskeâeefYeYetle yeuejece keâer ie=efnCeer ke=â<CeYeeefJeveer leLee Gvekeâer ceelee kesâ meeLe ßeerceeB Yeer efyenej ceW eqmLele kewâueJeej ieÙeeR~ ieesueeheceeB, mJeeceer Ùeesieevevo, mJeeceer ef$eiegCeeleerleevevo, mJeeceer meejoevevo leLee mJeeceer Ùeesieevevo kesâ efhelee veJeerveÛevõ ÛeewOejer Yeer Gvekesâ meeLe nes efueS~ JeneB Jes ueesie oes cenerves jns~ JeneB ßeerceeB ves osKee – ‘JevÙe efnjveeW kesâ PegC[ oueyeæ neskeâj ef$eYegpeekeâej Ûeues pee jns nw Deewj mebkeâš keâe DeeYeeme heeles ner ceevees hebKe Hewâueekeâj #eCe Yej ceW nJee nes peeles nQ~’’ Fme ceveesjce heefjJesMe leLee meghesÙe peue mes meejoevevo keâe hegjevee mJeemLÙe ueewš DeeÙee~ DeØewue ceW Jes Deeueceyeepeej ce" ueewšs~

oef#eCesÕej keâer hebÛeJešer ceW GvneWves hegve: keâ"esj lehemÙee DeejcYe keâj oer~ Fme efJe<eÙe ceW GvneR kesâ cegKe mes megvee ieÙee Lee, ‘‘Gme meceÙe «eece mes efYe#ee ceeBiekeâj meerOee ues Deelee~ Skeâ efceóer kesâ efmekeâesjs ceW Gmes Gyeeuekeâj efove kesâ Devle ceW kesâJeue Skeâ yeej Deenej keâjlee~ Yeespeve hekeâ peeves hej Gme efmekeâesjs ceW ner ßeer"ekegâj keâes DeVe keâe Yeesie ueieekeâj Øemeeo heelee~ Fmekesâ yeeo hee$e keâes Oeeskeâj Skeâ Je=#e mes ueškeâekeâj jKe oslee~ Deieues efove efHeâj Gmeer ceW Yeespeve hekeâelee~ Fme Øekeâej yengle efoveeW lekeâ ceQves Gme Skeâ ner hee$e mes keâece ÛeueeÙee Lee~25

Fmekesâ yeeo Jes Skeâ yeej Deewj leerLe&-heefj›eâcee kesâ efueS efvekeâue heÌ[s~ Fme yeej keâer Ùee$ee ceW GvneWves jepehegleevee, iegpejele, keâeef"ÙeeJeeÌ[ Deeefo ØeosMeeW keâe oerIe&keâeue lekeâ YeüceCe efkeâÙee Lee~ Gvekesâ meeLe keâesF& mebieer Les Ùee veneR – Fme efJe<eÙe ceW kegâÚ Yeer %eele veneR nw~ Fme yeej

25. mJeeceer meejoevevo, yeÇÿeÛeejer ØekeâeMeÛevõ, he==. 91-2

104 mJeeceer meejoevevo

Jes peÙehegj, heg<keâj, Deeyet, Éejkeâe, ØeYeeme, petveeieÌ{, veeLeÉeje, efÛeleewÌ[ieÌ{ Deeefo mLeeveeW keâe YeüceCe keâjkesâ Deeueceyeepeej ueewšs Les~

FOej GòejeKeC[ ceW og<keâj lehemÙee hetjer keâjves kesâ yeeo Jejenveiej hengBÛeles ner Jes Skeâ keâef"ve mecemÙee ceW heÌ[ ieÙes Deewj GvneWves DelÙevle meenme leLee OewÙe& kesâ meeLe Fme mecemÙee keâe cegkeâeyeuee efkeâÙee~ Fmekesâ HeâuemJe¤he Gvekesâ Ûeefj$e ceW Skeâ veJeerve Oeeje pegÌ[ ieÙeer Leer~ MejÛÛevõ kesâ mebmeej-yevOeve efJeeqÛÚVe keâjves kesâ kegâÚ keâeue yeeo ner ogYee&iÙeJeMe (Gvekesâ efhelee) efiejerMeÛevõ keâer Deee|Lekeâ DeJeveefle DeejcYe nes ieÙeer Leer~ efiejerMeÛevõ keâer hejceefØeÙe yegDee keâe osnevle nes ieÙee Lee~ Fmekesâ yeeo FcheerefjÙeue [^efiemš ne@ue mes Gvekesâ Yeeieeroej leLee ØeOeeve meneÙekeâ [e@. veerueceeOeJe mesve ves Deheves efnmmes keâer hetBpeer efvekeâeue uesves keâer FÛÚe JÙeòeâ keâer~ leYeer veiejheeefuekeâe ves meÌ[keâ yeveeves kesâ efueS efiejerMe Éeje megoerIe& heefjßece keâer Heâmeue Gvekesâ efØeÙe cekeâeve keâes Kejero efueÙee~ Gmeer Oeve mes efiejerMeÛevõ ves [e@. mesve keâer osveoejer efcešeÙeer Deewj 32/33 keâe@uespe mš^erš kesâ oJeeKeeves keâe cekeâeve Yeer yesÛe efoÙee Deewj efjheve keâe@uespe kesâ hetJeea Úesj kesâ heeme keâe Skeâ cekeâeve efkeâjeÙes hej ueskeâj efveJeeme keâjves ueies~ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves Jejenveiej ueewšves kesâ yeeo Deheves ceelee-efhelee mes YeWš keâer~ Gvekeâe ØescehetCe& JÙeJenej osKekeâj Gvekesâ meies-mecyeeqvOeÙeeW keâes ueiee efkeâ GvnW henues kesâ ner MejÛÛevõ efceue ieÙes nQ~ hejvleg Fve keâF& Je<eeX kesâ oewjeve MejÛÛevõ kesâ ceve ceW pees Deecetue-Ûetue heefjJele&ve DeeÙee Lee, Gmekesâ efJe<eÙe ceW Jes ueesie kegâÚ Yeer veneR peeve mekesâ Les~ ßeerjeceke=â<Ce keâer Ghecee keâe ØeÙeesie keâjles ngS keânW, lees mebmeej ceevees heeveer Deewj ceve otOe nw~ Ssmes ner oesveeW keâes efceuee osves hej otOe heeveer ceW efceuekeâj Skeâekeâej nes peelee nw; hejvleg otOe keâe oner peceeves kesâ yeeo Ùeefo Gmemes cekeäKeve efvekeâeuekeâj heeveer ceW jKee peeÙe, lees Jen lewjlee jnlee nw~ MejÛÛevõ ves efvepe&ve ceW meeOeve-Yepeve keâjkesâ %eeve-Yeefòeâ ¤he cekeäKeve efvekeâeue efueÙee Lee~ GvneWves Deheveer heeefjJeeefjkeâ mecemÙeeSB osKeeR Deewj megveeR~ Fmekesâ yeeo nce osKeWies efkeâ Jes Deheves heefjJeej kesâ ueesieeW keâer mecemÙeeDeeW kesâ meceeOeeve ceW meneÙelee Yeer keâjWies, hejvleg Fmes Jes DeodYegle efvee|uehlelee kesâ meeLe keâjWies~ nce osKeles nQ efkeâ MejÛÛevõ kesâ Fve mecemle keâeÙeeX keâer ØesjCee ‘ceeÙee’ veneR, yeequkeâ ‘oÙee’ Leer~ MejÛÛevõ kesâ heeBÛeJeW YeeF& ØekeâeMeÛevõ ves efueKee nw, ‘‘Deye mes osKeves ceW Deelee nw efkeâ efkeâmeer Yeer meebmeeefjkeâ Deeheefòe-efJeheefòe keâe meceeÛeej Mejled kesâ keâCe&ieesÛej nesles ner, Jes Ûeens efpeme Yeer DeJemLee ceW neW, oewÌ[ Deeles Deewj meYeer Øekeâej kesâ mebkeâšeW mes j#ee keâjves keâe ØeeCeheCe mes ØeÙelve keâjles~ peerJeve kesâ Devle lekeâ Gvekeâer Fme meùoÙelee ves Gvekeâe heefjlÙeeie veneR efkeâÙee Lee~’’26

efJeMeeuemkeâvOe meejoevevo ceW YeejJenve keâer DemeeOeejCe #ecelee Leer~ GvneWves pewmes ßeerceeB

26. mJeeceer meejoevevo, yeÇÿeÛeejer ØekeâeMeÛevõ, he==. 82

kesâ efhele=kegâue keâer ie=nmLeer keâe GòejoeefÙelJe Jenve efkeâÙee Lee, Jewmes ner efvee|uehle YeeJe mes GvneWves Deheves ceelee-efhelee kesâ mebmeej keâer Yeer Deeheefòe-efJeheefòe kesâ meceÙe meneÙelee keâer Leer~ meewYeeiÙe keâe yeeBOe leesÌ[ves kesâ yeeo, ogYee&iÙe keâer pees yeeÌ{ Fme heefjJeej kesâ Thej mes neskeâj iegpejer Leer, Gmekesâ yeejs ceW meesÛekeâj efJeeqmcele jn peevee heÌ[lee nw~ MejÛÛevõ kesâ yeeo ner Gvekesâ YeeF& Ûee®Ûevõ kesâ Thej heeefjJeeefjkeâ JÙeJemeeÙe keâe GòejoeefÙelJe Dee heÌ[e Lee~ Ûee® ie=nJeemeer neskeâj Yeer Goemeer Les~ 1895 F&. ceW peye Gvekeâe oJeeFÙeeW keâe JÙeJemeeÙe mebkeâš kesâ oewj mes iegpej jne Lee, Gmeer Je<e& MejÛÛevõ kesâ leermejs YeeF& megjsMeÛevõ ØeJesefMekeâe hejer#ee kesâ yeeo Skeâ YeÙeevekeâ jesie kesâ efMekeâej ngS~ meejoevevo ves Skeâ cenerves mes Yeer DeefOekeâ keâeue lekeâ megjsMeÛevõ keâer mesJeeMegßet<ee keâer Leer, hejvleg GvnW yeÛee veneR mekesâ~27

efhelee efiejerMeÛevõ kesâ DelÙevle yeerceej nes peeves hej, MejÛÛevõ ves JeejeCemeer kesâ neÌ[ej yeeie ceW Skeâ cekeâeve efkeâjeÙes hej ueskeâj GvnW leLee Deheveer ceelee keâes JeneB peueJeeÙeg-heefjJele&ve kesâ efueS Yespe efoÙee~ Gvekesâ hetJee&ßece kesâ ÛeeÛee F&ÕejÛevõ Yeer Gve ueesieeW kesâ meeLe ieÙes Les~ Ùen JÙeJemLee GvnW 1898 F&. ceW keâjveer heÌ[er Leer~ mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo kesâ ceneØeÙeeCe kesâ he§eeled meejoevevo ce" leLee efceMeve kesâ meebie"efvekeâ keâeÙeeX ceW DelÙevle JÙemle Les, leYeer JeejeCemeer mes leej DeeÙee efkeâ efiejerMeÛevõ ves 11 veJecyej 1902 keâes hejueeskeâieceve efkeâÙee nw~ Gme meceÙe Gvekeâer DeeÙeg 73 Je<e& Leer~ meejoevevo Deheves hetJee&ßece kesâ YeeF& meleerMeÛevõ keâes meeLe ueskeâj JeejeCemeer ieÙes Deewj Meeskeâmevlehle ceeB keâes ueskeâj keâuekeâòes ueewš DeeÙes~

Gmeer meceÙe mJeeceer jeceke=â<Ceevevo kesâ efhelee F&ÕejÛevõ Deheves ieeBJe FÚehegj ceW yegKeej mes Dee›eâevle Les~ yeÌ[s YeeF& efiejerMeÛevõ keâer ce=lÙeg keâe meceeÛeej heekeâj Jes yeeuekeâ kesâ meceeve GÛÛe mJej ceW jes G"s Les~ efiejerMe kesâ osneJemeeve kesâ lesjnJeW efove yeÇeÿecegntle& kesâ meceÙe F&ÕejÛevõ ves Deeqvlece meeBme ueer~ Gme meceÙe Gvekeâer DeeÙeg 66 Je<e& Leer~

Fme Øekeâej Skeâ kesâ yeeo Skeâ nesvesJeeueer ogKeo IešveeDeeW ves Deewj efJeMes<ekeâj Gvemes pegÌ[er heefjJeej keâer Deee|Lekeâ mecemÙee ves eqmLeleOeer meejoevevo keâes keâYeer keâYeer meeceefÙekeâ ¤he mes efkebâkeâle&JÙeefJecetÌ{ keâj [euee Lee~ Fme efJe<eÙe ceW ÙeneB Skeâ GoenjCe Øemlegle efkeâÙee pee mekeâlee nw~ Yeefieveer efveJesefolee keâe mJeeceer meejoevevo mes Ieefve‰ heefjÛeÙe Lee~ GvneWves 7 petve 1899 F&. kesâ efove kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘yesÛeejs meejoevevo yeÌ[s efÛeeqvlele nQ~ Iej keâer mecemÙeeSB Gve hej oyeeJe yeveeÙes ngS nQ, Gvekesâ YeeF& otmejs opex kesâ efškeâš hej nceejs meeLe Decesefjkeâe Dee jns nQ~ efHeâj ce" Yeer Skeâ yeÌ[er efpeccesoejer nw~’’ mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo, mJeeceer legjerÙeevevo Deewj efveJesefolee kesâ meeLe mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ ÛeewLes YeeF& vejsMeÛevõ FbiuewC[ ieÙes Les Deewj JeneB mes Decesefjkeâe peekeâj GvneWves GÛÛe efMe#ee Øeehle keâer Leer~ ßeerceleer yegue keâer Deee|Lekeâ meneÙelee mes ner Ùen mecYeJe nes mekeâe Lee~ vejsMeÛevõ

27. mJeeceer meejoevevo, yeÇÿeÛeejer ØekeâeMeÛevõ, he==. 82

106 mJeeceer meejoevevo

1914 F&. ceW mJeosMe ueewšs Les~

GOej Gvekesâ efhele=kegâue keâer heeefjJeeefjkeâ mecemÙee Deewj Yeer DeefOekeâ peefšue nes G"er Leer Deewj FOej mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ keâeÙe& keâe heefjceeCe Yeer yeÌ{ ieÙee Lee~ 1904 F&. ceW mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo kesâ keâeHeâer DemJemLe nes peeves kesâ yeeo mebIe kesâ ›eâceJeOe&ceeve ef›eâÙee-keâueeheeW keâe mebÛeeueve, mJeeceerpeer keâer cenemeceeefOe kesâ yeeo veJepee«ele ÙegJeeMeefòeâ keâes vesle=lJe Øeoeve keâjvee, ßeerceeB kesâ keâuekeâòee efveJeeme kesâ oewjeve Gvekeâer mesJee keâe GòejoeefÙelJe meBYeeuevee Deewj Gmekesâ Thej mes Deheves efhele=kegâue keâer mecemÙeeDeeW ves DeÛeue-Dešue meejoevevo keâes Yeer yeerÛe yeerÛe ceW efJeÛeefuele keâj [euee Lee~ 10 petve keâes GvneWves Deheves ieg®YeeF& legjerÙeevevo keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘peye mes Deehekeâe he$e cegPes efceuee, leye mes cegPes Deveskeâ keâef"veeFÙeeW leLee keâ°eW keâe meecevee keâjvee heÌ[e nw Deewj helee veneR Jes Deye Yeer meceehle ngF& nQ Ùee veneR~ cesjs meyemes Úesšs YeeF& meefnle heefjJeej ceW Ûeej ueesieeW keâer ce=lÙeg nes ieÙeer nw~ Úe$eeJeeme kesâ cekeâeve-ceeefuekeâ mes meeLe PebPeš ngDee Deewj nce ueesieeW keâes Gmes lelkeâeue yevo keâj osvee heÌ[e~ Gmekesâ efueS Skeâ veÙes mLeeve keâer Keespe Deye lekeâ efvejLe&keâ efmeæ ngF& nw Deewj cegPes ueielee nw efkeâ keâce-mes-keâce Fme meeue nceW Ùen keâeÙe& yevo ner jKevee nesiee~28 Fve meejer ÛeerpeeW ves cegPes keâeHeâer JÙemle jKee nw~ ßeerceeB mJemLe nQ Deewj ogiee&hetpee lekeâ ÙeneR "njWieeR~’’ mecemÙee kesâ keâeues cesIeeW keâe pees meceeJesMe ngDee Lee, Deheves DeOÙeJemeeÙe leLee ogpexÙe meenme kesâ yeue hej Jes ›eâceMe: Gvekesâ yeerÛe mes GòeerCe& ngS Les~ Fme efJe<eÙe ceW LeesÌ[s efJemleej mes ÛeÛee& nce yeeo ceW keâjWies~

kegâÚ Je<e& yeeo 26 ceF& 1907 keâes mJeeceer meejoevevo keâer peveveer veerueceefCe osJeer ves hejueeskeâieceve efkeâÙee~ cenejepe kesâ 27 petve keâes efueKes he$e mes %eele neslee nw efkeâ veerueceefCe osJeer ves huesie mes Dee›eâevle neskeâj Ûeewyeerme IeCšeW kesâ Yeerlej ner ØeeCelÙeeie keâj efoÙee Lee~ ce=lÙeg kesâ hetJe& GvneWves Deheves heg$e meejoevevo mes ce" kesâ efueS heeBÛe ®heÙes kesâ Deewj ßeerceeB kesâ efueS heeBÛe ®heÙes kesâ Deece Kejero osves keâe Deeqvlece DevegjesOe efkeâÙee Lee~

keâeHeâer keâeue lekeâ Fme Ûe›eâJeleea heefjJeej ceW ce=lÙeg keâer leeC[Je-ueeruee Ûeueleer jner, hejvleg ueielee nw 1921 F&. ceW Jen Deheves Ûejce meercee lekeâ pee hengBÛeer Leer~ efpeme meceÙe mJeeceer meejoevevo meesÛe jns Les efkeâ keäÙee Gvekesâ peerJeve-efoievle mes peerJeve-metÙe& ßeerceeB keâer Deeqvlece Deeueeskeâ-jsKee meÛecegÛe ner efceš Ûegkeâer nw, leYeer Gvekesâ efÉleerÙe YeeF& [e@keäšj meleerMeÛevõ ves ‘jeceke=â<Ce’ veece keâe GÛÛeejCe keâjles ngS celÙe&ueeskeâ mes efJeoe ueer~ meleerMeÛevõ meeOegyeÇÿeÛeeefjÙeeW kesâ meeLe ner, ßeerceeB keâer mesJee keâjkesâ Yeer OevÙe ngS Les~ mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ keâesceue efÛeòe keâes DeeIeele hengBÛee Lee, hejvleg Deheveer efleefle#ee kesâ yeue hej Fme ceveesJesovee keâes otj keâjles

28. mJeeceerpeer kesâ DeeoMee&vegmeej ÙegJekeâ Úe$eeW kesâ Ûeefj$e-ie"ve kesâ GösMÙe mes Ùen Úe$eeJeeme yeveeÙee ieÙee Lee~ mJeeceer meeqÛÛeoevevo (yetÌ{s yeeyee) Fmekesâ megheefjvšW[Wš efveÙegòeâ ngS Les~ keâesF& GheÙegòeâ cekeâeve ve efceueves kesâ keâejCe Fme Úe$eeJeeme keâes efHeâj Ûeeuet keâjvee mecYeJe veneR nes mekeâe Lee~

GvnW efJeuecye veneR ueiee~

osMe-efJeosMe ceW pees ueesie Yeer mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ meeefVeOÙe ceW DeeÙes Les, Jes meYeer Gvekesâ JÙeefòeâlJe keâer ceOegefjcee hej cegiOe ngS Les~ GveceW mes efkeâmeer efkeâmeer ves helee ueieekeâj Gvekesâ keâvOeeW kesâ efJehegue GòejoeefÙelJe kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW peeve efueÙee Lee Deewj GveceW mes efkeâmeer efkeâmeer ves meneÙelee keâe neLe Yeer yeÌ{eÙee Lee~ FveceW ßeerceleer Deesueer yegue efJeMes<e ¤he mes GuuesKeveerÙe nQ~ mJeeceer meejoevevo peye yee@mšve kesâ efvekeâš eqmLele kewâeqcyeÇpe ceW Gvekesâ Iej "njs Les, leye ceele=ùoÙe GoejefÛeòe ßeerceleer yegue meejoevevo keâe DeeÛeej-JÙeJenej osKekeâj Ûecelke=âle nes ieÙeer LeeR~ GvneWves hetÚkeâj meejoevevo kesâ ceelee-efhelee leLee heefjJeej keâe meeje meceeÛeej peeve efueÙee Lee Deewj ÙeLeemecYeJe Gvekeâer meneÙelee keâjves keâes De«emej ngF& LeeR~ Fve efJeosMeer ceefnuee keâer Goejlee mes ner yesuetÌ[ ce" kesâ keâF& ØeejeqcYekeâ YeJeveeW keâe efvecee&Ce nes mekeâe Lee~ ce" kesâ heefjÛeeueve kesâ efueS Yeer GvneR mes keâeHeâer Deee|Lekeâ meneÙelee Øeehle ngF& Leer~ mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo ßeerceleer yegue keâes ‘Oeerjeceelee’ Ùee efHeâj kesâJeue ‘ceeB’ keânkeâj mecyeesefOele keâjles Les~ ßeerceleer yegue ves mJeeceerpeer keâer ceelee leLee Gvekesâ YeeFÙeeW keâer Yeer Deee|Lekeâ meneÙelee keâer Leer~ mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ DevegjesOe hej Jes ßeerceeB keâer mesJee kesâ efueS Øeefleceen efveOee&efjle cee$ee ceW DeLe&oeve keâjleer jneR~ mJeeceer meejoevevo GvnW ‘oeoer-ceeB’ Ùee ‘Granny’ keâne keâjles Les~

ßeerceleer yegue Éeje efJeefJeOe Øekeâej mes meneÙelee kesâ keâejCe mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo peer ves GvnW 12 ceeÛe& 1900 keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘Deeheves cesjs leLee cesjs mJepeveeW kesâ efueS ceeB mes DeefOekeâ keâeÙe& efkeâÙee nw~’’ mJeeceerpeer ßeerceleer yegue keâer Oeerj-eqmLej yegeqæ kesâ efueS GvnW yeÌ[er ßeæe keâer Âef° mes osKeles Les, Gvekesâ meJe&«eemeer ceele=mvesn kesâ efueS ke=âle%eleehetJe&keâ Gvekeâe mecceeve keâjles Les Deewj ßeerjeceke=â<Ce YeeJeeoMe& kesâ Øeefle Gvekeâer efve‰e leLee he=‰hees<ekeâlee kesâ efueS Gvekeâe $e+Ce mJeerkeâej keâjles Les~ hejvleg GvnW efueKes Deveskeâ he$eeW ceW mJeeceerpeer ves Deheveer DeeOÙeeeqlcekeâ Dele=eqhle keâe GuuesKe efkeâÙee Lee; FmeceW mevosn nw efkeâ Gme Dele=eqhle keâe mJe¤he leLee Gmemes GlheVe ceeveefmekeâ heerÌ[e keâes Oeerjeceelee mecePe mekeâer LeeR Ùee veneR~ Fme keâejCe Oeerjeceelee keâer mvesnmegueYe efPeÌ[keâer leLee megOeejves kesâ ØeÙeeme keâes keâeHeâer kegâÚ ceevekeâj Yeer mJeeceerpeer Gvekesâ meejs celeeW keâe meceLe&ve veneR keâj mekesâ Les~ 1 ceF& 1900 keâes GvneWves Skeâ megoerIe& he$e efueKe mJeeceerpeer keâes jeceke=â<Ce mebIe keâer mecemle Jew<eefÙekeâ efÛevleeDeeW mes hetjer leewj mes cegefòeâ osves keâe ØemleeJe efkeâÙee Lee~ Ùen ØemleeJe ve lees JeemleefJekeâ JemlegeqmLeefle hej DeeOeeefjle Lee Deewj ve ner mebIe kesâ mebÛeeuekeâeW ceW mes efkeâmeer kesâ Éeje mecee|Lele Lee~ Fme uecyes he$e ceW ßeerceleer yegue ves mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ efhele=kegâue kesâ heefjJeej keâes Deheveer Deee|Lekeâ meneÙelee kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW mJeeceerpeer keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘Whatever Saradananda does for me is strictly carried out on a basis of accounts, while I appreciate the personal love and service which he adds by his

108 mJeeceer meejoevevo

care, thus blessing the little I can do — and what I have done for his family, has but left him freer for the work in general, just what I have desired to do for you.'’ Jewmes Ùen Yeer mcejCeerÙe nw efkeâ ßeerceleer yegue

keâer Ùen meneÙelee Yeer Fme efJeMeeue heefjJeej kesâ efueS DeheÙee&hle ner Leer~

Deheves efhele=kegâue kesâ heefjJeej keâer meneÙelee keâjves kesâ ceeceues ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo keâe Âef°keâesCe Deueie ner Lee~ Deheves ieg®YeeF& mJeeceer legjerÙeevevo keâes efueKes Skeâ he$e ceW nce GvnW Gvekesâ efhele=$e+Ce leLee ceele=$e+Ce kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW meÛesle keâjles osKeles nQ, Fmemes ueielee nw efkeâ Jes mJeÙeb Yeer Fve $e+CeeW kesâ MeesOeve ceW Dee«ener Les~ hej meeceef«ekeâ Âef° mes osKeves hej ueielee nw efkeâ Jes keâYeer mecheVe Deewj mecØeefle efJeheefòe ceW heÌ[s Skeâ heefjJeej keâer meneÙelee keâjves keâes ner De«emej ngS Les~ mebvÙeemeer keâer Deveemeòeâ efJeÛeejhetCe& Âef° ner Gvekesâ meejs DeeÛejCeeW keâer efveÙeecekeâ Leer~

Skeâ cegceg#eg ÙegJekeâ mebmeej-yevOeve mes cegòeâ nesves keâe ØeÙeeme keâj jne Lee~ Gmekeâer ceelee ves Gmes pekeâÌ[ jKee Lee~ ÙeneB lekeâ efkeâ ÙegJekeâ kesâ oerIe&keâeue lekeâ yeerceej jnves kesâ yeeo peueJeeÙegheefjJele&ve kesâ efueS DevÙe$e peeves keâer FÛÚe JÙeòeâ keâjves hej ceeB ves Gmekeâe efJejesOe efkeâÙee~ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves Gme efJeYeüevle ÙegJekeâ keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘legce efpeleves Yeer efove Gvekesâ heeme jnkeâj Gvekeâer meneÙelee keâe ØeÙeeme keâjesies, Gleves efoveeW lekeâ Jes mJeÙeb Deheveer meneÙelee keâjves Ùee legcnejer yenve kesâ heeme peeves keâe keâesF& ØeÙeeme veneR keâjWieer~ DeleSJe cesjs celeevegmeej legce Deheveer ceelee keâes mhe° ¤he mes keân osvee efkeâ legcnW Dehevee mJeemLÙe megOeejves kesâ efueS JeejeCemeer peekeâj JeneB 2-3 cenerves efveJeeme keâjvee nesiee~ Gme oewjeve Jes legcnejer yenve kesâ heeme peekeâj jnW~ Fme hej Gvekesâ mencele ve nesves hej legce Gvekeâer yeele efyevee megves Ûeues Deevee~’’29 efHeâj Skeâ mebvÙeemeer ßeerceeB keâer Devegceefle ueskeâj Deheves hetJee&ßece kesâ mecyeeqvOeÙeeW keâer meneÙelee keâjves peekeâj mJeÙeb ner meebmeeefjkeâ peefšuelee ceW HeBâmeves pee jns Les~ Fmes osKekeâj mJeeceer meejoevevo ves GvnW meeJeOeeve keâjves kesâ efueS efueKee, ‘‘DeleSJe meeOeg, Deye mes meeJeOeeve nes peeDees~’’30 cenejepe ves GvnW meebmeeefjkeâ peefšuelee mes cegòeâ nesves keâe ceeie& Yeer yeleuee efoÙee Lee~ Deewj Gvekesâ Deheves efJe<eÙe ceW osKee ieÙee Lee efkeâ mebmeej keâer Deefie> kesâ heeme peekeâj Yeer mJeeceer meejoevevo keâes Gmekeâer DeeBÛe veneR ueieer Leer; Gvekesâ meeOeve-ØeebieCe ceW JewjeiÙe keâer JeeÙeg ØeJeeefnle nes jner Leer~ Deveemeefòeâ keâer Deefie>hejer#ee mes Jes memecceeve GòeerCe& ngS Les~

mJeeceer meejoevevo Fme Øekeâej efMe#eCe-ØeefMe#eCe, hee"-ÛeÛee&, meeOeve-Yepeve, leerLe&YeüceCe, jesefieÙeeW keâer mesJee, Øe›epÙee Deeefo kesâ yeerÛe mes neskeâj De«emej nes jns Les~ efpeme nleeMee ves GvnW kegâÚ keâeue kesâ efueS DeeÛÚVe efkeâÙee Lee, Gmemes G"keâj Gvekesâ yeefue‰ mejue

Hegâuue Meleoue : ØeÛeejkeâ

Øe›epÙee, pehe-OÙeeve, ce" kesâ keâeÙe&, jesefieÙeeW keâer mesJee Deeefo ceW meerefcele mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ peerJeveJe=òe ceW menmee efJeÅegled keâer Ûecekeâ kesâ meceeve Skeâ veJeerve Gheeoeve ves Deee|JeYetle neskeâj GvnW Ûeefkeâle keâj [euee~ 1895 F&. kesâ efmelecyej kesâ ØeejcYe ceW mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo ves GvnW uevove mes metefÛele efkeâÙee Lee efkeâ Jes ogyeeje Decesefjkeâe pee jns nQ Deewj uevove ceW efpeve cegªer Yej ueesieeW ceW Jesoevle-efJe<eÙekeâ Glmeen keâe mebÛeej ngDee nw, Gmes efpeueeS jKeves kesâ efueS uevove ceW Skeâ mebvÙeemeer ieg®YeeF& keâer DeeJeMÙekeâlee nw~ ceeie& keâe KeÛe& leLee DeeJeMÙekeâ efveoxMe Deeefo Yeer GvneWves Yespe efoÙes Les~ Skeâ he$e ceW GvneWves efueKee Lee, ‘‘keâeÙe& Ùener nw efkeâ ceQ ÙeneB efpeve ÛesueeW Deeefo keâes ÚesÌ[ peeTBiee, GvnW efMe#ee osvee leLee Jesoevle Deeefo heÌ{evee Deewj LeesÌ[e LeesÌ[e Deb«espeer ceW DevegJeeo keâjvee leLee yeerÛe yeerÛe ceW JÙeeKÙeeve Deeefo osvee~’’ mJeeceerpeer keâer hemevo Les Mejled Ùee MeMeer~ Ûece&jesie kesâ keâejCe MeMeer keâe peevee mecYeJe veneR nes mekeâe~ ueieYeie Skeâ ner meceÙe DeYesoevevo, yeÇÿeevevo leLee jeceke=â<Ceevevo keâes efueKes keâF& he$eeW keâes Skeâ meeLe efceueekeâj heÌ{ves mes mhe° ¤he mes mecePee pee mekeâlee nw efkeâ mJeeceerpeer meejoevevo keâes FbiuewC[ yegueevee Ûeenles Les~1 kegâÚ keâeue hetJe& 11 DeØewue 1895 keâes, meejoevevo vewjeMÙe mes keâ° hee jns nQ, Ùen peevekeâj mJeeceerpeer ves GvnW Ûebiee keâjves kesâ efueS jeceke=â<Ceevevo keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘Mejled keäÙee keâj jne nw? ‘ceQ keäÙee peevetB! ceQ keäÙee peevetB!’ Ssmeer yegefæ mes leerveeW keâeue ceW Yeer kegâÚ veneR peeve mekeâesies~’’ Fmeer yeerÛe mJeeceer meejoevevo Gme efvejeMee kesâ YeeJe mes Gyej ieÙes Les, hejvleg mJeeceerpeer kesâ Dee£eve keâes mJeerkeâej keâjves ceW Jes efÉOee«emle Les Deewj ÙeneB lekeâ efkeâ LeesÌ[s Mebefkeâle Yeer nes heÌ[s Les~

efJeefYeVe ce"JeeefmeÙeeW keâes efueKes ieÙes he$e meYeer ieg®YeeF& heÌ{les Les, meejoevevo Yeer heÌ{les Les~ ØeeÙe: FvneR efoveeW Ùee Fmekesâ kegâÚ hetJe& yeÇÿeevevo keâes efueKes Skeâ he$e ceW mJeeceerpeer ves mebkesâle efoÙee nw efkeâ Gme osMe ceW GvnW keäÙee keâjvee heÌ[ jne nw~ GvneWves efueKee Lee, ‘‘mecePe uees efkeâ Fme osMe ceW nceW yeeIe-YeeuegDeeW – efJeÉeved heeoefjÙeeW kesâ cegBn mes Deheveer jesšer Úerveveer heÌ[sieer~ DeLee&led efJeÅee kesâ peesj mes Fve ueesieeW hej neJeer nesvee heÌ[siee, DevÙeLee Deeoceer Skeâ ner HetBâkeâ ceW GÌ[ peeÙesiee~ Ùes ueesie ve lees meeOeg mecePeles nQ, ve mebvÙeemeer Deewj ve lÙeeie keâe YeeJe ner

1. ÙeLee : ‘‘Deb«espeer peevevesJeeues JÙeefòeâ keâer DeeJeMÙekeâlee nw – Mejled Ùee legce Ùee meejoe~ ... legce Ûeues DeeDees Ùee Mejled keâes Yespees~’’ ‘‘Mejled keâes ceQ ®heÙes Yespe Ûegkeâe ntB leLee he$e heÌ{les ner jJeevee nes peeves keâes efueKee nw~’’ ‘‘Mejled Ùee MeMeer, Fve oesveeW ceW mes efkeâmeer Skeâ keâes Yespeves keâe yevoesyemle keâjvee~’’

mecePeles nQ~ pees yeele Ùes mecePeles nQ, Jen nw efJeÉòee keâer Meefòeâ, JÙeeKÙeeve keâer Oetce Deewj DeLekeâ ef›eâÙeeMeeruelee~’’ meejoevevo ves efJeveÙehetJe&keâ mJeeceerpeer keâes Deheveer DemeceLe&lee metefÛele keâer~ Fmekesâ Gòej ceW GvneWves 23 efomecyej 1895 keâes Decesefjkeâe mes2 Keso leLee DeefYeceeve mes Ùegòeâ Skeâ Mues<ehetCe& he$e efueKee~ Gme he$e keâes heekeâj mJeeceer meejoevevo efÉOee leLee meeceefÙekeâ Yeerefle Deeefo lÙeeiekeâj hee§eelÙe osMeeW keâer Ùee$ee kesâ efueS Øemlegle ngS~ meJe&ØeLece Jes ßeerceeB keâe DeeMeerJee&o ceeBieves peÙejeceyeešer ceW GheeqmLele ngS~ ceeB ves GvnW DeeÕeemeve osles ngS keâne, ‘‘"ekegâj legcnejer meowJe ner j#ee keâj jns nQ, yesše; YeÙe keâer keâesF& yeele veneR nw~’’ meejoevevo peer ves Deeueceyeepeej ce" kesâ Deheves ieg®YeeFÙeeW keâer MegYesÛÚe ueskeâj 26 HeâjJejer 1896 kesâ hetJe& Skeâ MegYe efove3 ØemLeeve efkeâÙee Deewj yecyeF& pee hengBÛes~ JeneB yeer.DeeF.Sme.Sve. ueeFve kesâ jsJee penepe hej meJeej neskeâj 1 DeØewue keâes Jes uevove hengBÛe ieÙes~ JeneB hej Jes mJeeceerpeer kesâ efMe<Ùe F. šer. mš[ea keâe DeeefleLÙe «enCe keâjkesâ mJeeceerpeer keâer Øeleer#ee keâjves ueies~

peeles meceÙe YetceOÙemeeiej ceW DeeÙes Øeyeue letHeâeve mes meYeer Ùeeef$eÙeeW keâe peerJeve mebkeâš ceW heÌ[ ieÙee Lee~ Ùee$eerieCe ØeeCeeW kesâ YeÙe mes [skeâ kesâ Thej oewÌ[-Oethe, keâ®Ce ›eâvove leLee YeieJeeve mes keâelej ØeeLe&vee ceW ueie ieÙes, hejvleg meejoevevo Fve meye kesâ yeerÛe DeÛebÛeue õ°e kesâ meceeve eqmLej yew"s jns~ Gvekeâer Fme efve§es°lee hej Deveskeâ ueesieeW kesâ ceve ceW veejepeieer keâe YeeJe DeeÙee Lee~ hejJeleea keâeue ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo ves yeleeÙee Lee efkeâ penepe-Yej kesâ meenyecesce jesvee-heeršvee keâj jns Les, Gme meceÙe Gvekeâe ceve leguee kesâ keâeBšs kesâ meceeve eqmLej Lee~

kegâÚ Je<e& yeeo keâer Skeâ Deewj Yeer Iešvee nw~ mJeeceer meejoevevo [e@keäšj keâebpeerueeue keâes ueskeâj yeeieyeepeej mes veeJe ceW meJeej neskeâj yesuetÌ[ Dee jns Les~ yeerÛe ceW Øeyeue letHeâeve G"e~

2. mJeeceerpeer 27 veJecyej 1895 keâes uevove mes jJeevee neskeâj ogyeeje Decesefjkeâe ieÙes Les~

3. Swami Vivekananda in the West, New Discoveries, M. L. Burke, Vol. IV, p. 558

4. efveJesefolee ueeskeâceelee (yeBieuee «ebLe), Mebkeâjer Øemeeo yemeg, KeC[ 1, he==. 118 112 mJeeceer meejoevevo

JeeÙeg keâe Jesie ›eâceMe: yeÌ{ves ueiee~ leye Yeer meejoevevo efveef§evle YeeJe mes yew"s ngkeäkesâ mes lecyeeketâ heer jns Les~ heeveer kesâ oes-Ûeej PeeWkesâ veeJe ceW Deeves kesâ yeeo efvee|Jekeâej meejoevevo keâe DeeÛejCe osKekeâj mebieer keâebpeerueeue menve veneR keâj mekesâ~ GvneWves mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ ngkeäkesâ mes lecyeeketâ keâe efÛeuece efvekeâeuekeâj veoer ceW HeWâkeâ efoÙee Deewj Gòesefpele keâC" kesâ meeLe yeesues, ‘‘Deehe lees osKelee ntB yeÌ[s DeÛÚs Deeoceer efvekeâues! FOej veeJe [tye jner nw Deewj Deehe nQ efkeâ yew"s ngS lecyeeketâ efheÙes pee jns nQ~’’ cenejepe ves eqmLej YeeJe mes Gòej efoÙee, ‘‘lecyeeketâ ve heerTB, lees keäÙee veeJe [tyeves kesâ henues ner heeveer ceW ÚueeBie ueiee otB?’’ DeeBOeer-letHeâeve kesâ yeerÛe ner veeJe yesuetÌ[ ce" kesâ Ieeš mes Dee ueieer Leer~

ÙeneB FbiuewC[ kesâ ceeie& ceW ngF& Skeâ DevÙe cenòJehetCe& Iešvee Yeer GuuesKeveerÙe nw~ mJeeceer meejoevevo jesce ceW Glejs Les~ JeneB kesâ mesCš heeršj keâe efiejpee osKeles meceÙe GveceW YeeJeevlej GheeqmLele ngDee Lee~ Jes mesCš heeršj keâer cete|le kesâ mece#e LeesÌ[er osj kesâ efueS YeeJemeceeefOe ceW [tye ieÙes Les~ Ùen Iešvee nceW "ekegâj kesâ YeeJeves$eeW Éeje osKeer ieÙeer mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ efheÚues pevce kesâ heefjÛeÙe keâe mcejCe keâje osleer nw~ heeqC[le ef#ejeso Øemeeo efJeÅeeefJeveeso ØeeÙe: ner GodyeesOeve ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ heeme DeeÙee keâjles Les~ Skeâ efove yeeleeW-ner-yeeleeW ceW GvneWves keâne, ‘‘cenejepe, mesCš heeršj kesâ meeLe Deehekeâe Deveskeâ efJe<eÙeeW ceW meeÂMÙe nw~’’ mebkesâlehetCe& Fme yeele kesâ Gòej ceW cenejepe ves LeesÌ[e-mee nBmekeâj kesâJeue Flevee ner keâne, ‘‘jesce ceW mesCš heeršj keâer cete|le osKekeâj LeesÌ[er osj kesâ efueS cesjs yee¢e%eeve keâe ueeshe nes ieÙee Lee~’’5 mesCš heeršj kesâ ßeæeYeeJe keâer Jes keâeHeâer ØeMebmee efkeâÙee keâjles Les~6

18 DeØewue 1896 keâes mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo Decesefjkeâe mes uevove Ûeues DeeÙes Les~ JeneB meejoevevo keâes heekeâj Jes hejce Deeveeqvole ngS~ ueieYeie leerve Je<eeX kesâ yeeo Gvekeâer efkeâmeer ieg®YeeF& mes cegueekeâele ngF& Leer~ mebIe kesâ YeeJeer mebie"ve keâer Âef° mes Ùen efceueve cenòJehetCe& leLee DeLe&hetCe& Lee~ mJeeceerpeer ves Deeueceyeepeej ce", mebvÙeemeer ieg®YeeFÙeeW, veJeeiele yeÇÿeÛeejer leLee mebvÙeeefmeÙeeW Deewj ie=ner YeòeâeW kesâ meejs meceeÛeej hetÚs~ Fmekesâ yeeo GvneWves DeefJeuecye ce" kesâ YeefJe<Ùe keâer heefjkeâuhevee kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW Deheveer Jele&ceeve efJeÛeejOeeje keâes efueKekeâj Deeueceyeepeej ce" Yespe efoÙee~ Deheves 27 DeØewue kesâ he$e kesâ ØeejcYe ceW GvneWves efueKee Lee, ‘‘legce ueesieeW keâer YeueeF& kesâ efueS leLee ØeYeg efpeme GösMÙe mes DeJeleerCe& ngS Les, Gmekeâer meHeâuelee kesâ efueS efueKelee ntB~ GvneWves legce ueesieeW keâe Yeej cesjs Thej meeQhee Lee Deewj legce ueesieeW kesâ Éeje peieled keâe cenekeâuÙeeCe nesiee – ÙeÅeefhe legceceW mes DeefOekeâebMe Fme yeele keâes veneR peeveles – mcejCe jKevee

efueKee Lee, ‘‘If one has got it (reverence), one has got the key to unlock the mystery of nature. Perhaps this was the key of Heaven in the hand of St. Peter.’’

ceF& cenerves ceW ØeÛeej keâe keâeÙe& hegve: DeejcYe keâjves kesâ hetJe& mJeeceerpeer ves eEhekeâveerpe «eerve (Pinkney’s Green) «eece keâer kegâceejer cetuej kesâ Iej ceW meejoevevo kesâ meeLe kegâÚ efove Skeâ meeLe efveJeeme efkeâÙee Lee~ Deheves ieg®YeeF& kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW mJeeceerpeer keâe DeefYecele leLee YeefJe<Ùe kesâ yeejs ceW heefjkeâuhevee Gvekesâ oes he$eeW ceW JÙeòeâ ngF& nw~ 20 DeØewue (1896) keâes GvneWves nsue yenveeW keâes efueKee, ‘‘otmejs mebvÙeemeer ÙeneB nQ, ceQ mecePelee ntB efkeâ Jes Skeâ Glke=â° JÙeefòeâ nQ Deewj DeÛÚs efJeÉeved mebvÙeemeer Yeer nQ~ Fme meceÙe nce hegmlekeâeW7 kesâ mecheeove ceW ueies nQ~’’ ceF& cenerves kesâ Skeâ DevÙe he$e ceW GvneWves efueKee, ‘‘nce (uevove ceW efkeâjeÙes kesâ) Fme cekeâeve ceW Skeâ Úesšs meerefcele heefjJeej kesâ ¤he ceW nQ; nceejs meeLe Yeejle mes DeeÙes ngS Skeâ mebvÙeemeer Yeer nQ~ ‘yesÛeeje efnvot’ keânves keâe pees leelheÙe& nw, Jen FvnW osKeves mes mhe° nes peelee nw~ ceevees meoe ner OÙeevemLe nQ, DelÙevle veceü leLee ceOegj mJeYeeJe kesâ nQ~ cegPeceW pewmee Skeâ DeocÙe meenme leLee Ieesj keâce&lelhejlee efJeÅeceeve nw, FveceW Gmekeâe meJe&Lee DeYeeJe nw~ Gme lejn mes keâece veneR Ûeue mekeâlee~ ceQ FveceW kegâÚ keâce&Meeruelee ueeves keâe ØeÙeeme keâ¤Biee~’’

mJeeceerpeer GvnW hee§eelÙe ØeÛeej-keâeÙe& kesâ efueS GheÙegòeâ ØeefMe#eCe osles jns; hee§eelÙe Deoye-keâeÙeoeW kesâ meeLe heefjefÛele nesves ceW Gvekeâer meneÙelee keâer Deewj Gme osMe kesâ ueesieeW keâer jerefle-veerefle, DeeMee-Deekeâeb#ee leLee mebmke=âefle kesâ JewefMe°Ÿe keâes Gvekesâ meeceves mhe° keâj efoÙee~ mJeeceerpeer peneB keâneR Yeer keâ#ee uesves Ùee meeJe&peefvekeâ JÙeeKÙeeve kesâ efueS peeles, JeneB Deewj Yeespeve kesâ efvecev$eCe Deeefo ceW Yeer meejoevevo keâes meeLe ues peeles~ Deuhe DeJeefOe kesâ oewjeve Yeer mJeeceerpeer ves ÙeLeemeeOÙe ØeÙeeme efkeâÙee, hejvleg Fmekesâ Éeje mJeeceer meejoevevo keâer efÉOee leLee mebkeâesÛe otj veneR ngDee~ ueielee nw ‘Gvekesâ Yeerlej LeesÌ[er keâce&Meeruelee ØeJesMe keâjeves keâe’ mJeeceerpeer keâe ØeÙeeme meHeâue veneR ngDee~ Jewmes mJeeceerpeer kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW DevegmevOee$eer cesjer uegF& yeke&â keâe cele nw efkeâ meejoevevo kesâ menpe mJeYeeJe ves ner Decesefjkeâe ceW ØeÛeejkeâ kesâ ¤he ceW meHeâuelee heeves ceW Gvekeâer meneÙelee keâer Leer~8

24 petve keâes mJeeceerpeer ves Deeueceyeepeej ce" ceW mJeeceer jeceke=â<Ceevevo keâes metefÛele efkeâÙee efkeâ FbiuewC[ keâe ‘keâeÙe& heefjhekeäJe nes jne nw’~ Jes mJeÙeb ner uevove ceW GheeqmLele Les, peneB meejoevevo kesâ efueS ÙeLes° keâeÙe& veneR Lee~ Dele: Jes Deheves efJeÕemle õgle-uesKekeâ ieg[efJeve

7. Jes mJeeceerpeer kesâ Ùeesie-efJe<eÙekeâ Yee<eCeeW kesâ hegmlekeâekeâej ØekeâeMeve kesâ efueS mecheeove keâe keâeÙe& keâj jns Les~

8. ‘But it (his nature) did well in America, where nothing disturbed him and where his presence tended to bring peace. His photographs of that period show the serenity, purity and selflessness of one who sees only the hand of God in every circumstance. And there were to be circumstances in America that would require that steady vision.’ (New Discoveries, Vol. IV, p. 316)

114 mJeeceer meejoevevo

jefÛele ‘meÛÛes cenelcee’ uesKe kesâ ØekeâeefMele nesves kesâ yeeo yeÇeÿemeceepe leLee DevÙe Yeer efkeâmeer efkeâmeer yegefæpeerefJeÙeeW keâer ceC[ueer mes ØeefleJeeo keâe mJej GeqlLele ngDee Lee~ Fmeer keâejCe GvneWves mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo mes Øeehle ßeerjeceke=â<Ce-peerJeveer keâes ÙeLeeJeled cegefõle keâje efoÙee Lee, hejvleg meeLe ner Ùen Yeer efueKee Lee, ‘‘Yet even his (Swami Vivekananda’s) unvarnished description of his master discloses here and there are the clear traces of what I call the Dialogic-Process, and the irrepressible miraculising tendencies of devoted disciples. And I am really glad that it does so, if only it helps to teach us that no historian can even pretend to do more than to show us what a man or a fact seemed to be to him or to the authorities whom he has to follow, and not what he or it actually was.’’ Demleg, mJeeceerpeer ves ve

13. Complete works of Swami Vivekananda, Vol. IV, p. 280

14. ßeer ßeermeejoevevo-Øemebie, he=. 129; mJeeceer efJejpeevevo kesâ Skeâ ØeMve kesâ Gòej ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo ves Deheves 10 ceeÛe& 1914 keâes metefÛele efkeâÙee Lee efkeâ ßeerjeceke=â<Ce-peerJeveer GvneWves mJeÙeb ner efueKeer Leer~ 116 mJeeceer meejoevevo

kesâJeue meejoevevo keâer jÛevee keâe Devegceesove efkeâÙee, Deefheleg heeqC[le cewkeämecetuej ves Yeer Gmes hemevo efkeâÙee Lee~

2 pegueeF& keâes meejoevevo leLee ieg[efJeve kesâ vÙegÙeeke&â hengBÛeves kesâ hetJe& ner Deeueceyeepeej ce" kesâ DeIeesef<ele DeOÙe#e mJeeceer jeceke=â<Ceevevo ves vÙegÙeeke&â ceW mJeeceerpeer kesâ DevegjeefieÙeeW keâes Skeâ kesâyeue (mecegõer leej)15 kesâ Gòej ceW Skeâ he$e efueKee Lee~ GmeceW mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW GvneWves efueKee Lee, ‘‘The new Swami, if it be the desire of his leader at a future date to transfer him to your quarters, is sure to gain your heart in no time, not ofcourse by those dazzling faculties which specially mark out Vivekananda as a power among nations, but by his sweet and amiable character, diffusing peace and love wherever he goes. In him you will find a man who is void of all the vanities of the world. He is sure to carry out the onerous duty laid upon him with great credit.’’16 Deeies Ûeuekeâj nce osKeWies efkeâ mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ mecyevOe ceW mJeeceer jeceke=â<Ceevevo keâer Ùen YeefJe<ÙeJeeCeer De#ejMe: ¤heeefÙele ngF& Leer~

mJeeceerpeer keâer DevegheeqmLeefle ceW Decesefjkeâe ceW Gvekesâ Éeje DeejyOe keâeÙe& keâe meeje GòejoeefÙelJe mJeeceerpeer ves ßeerceleer Deesueer yegue kesâ keâvOeeW hej meeQhe efoÙee Lee~17 ßeerceleer yegue Deheveer eqmLej yegefæ keâer meneÙelee mes ÛegheÛeehe efpeme Øekeâej o#elee kesâ meeLe mecemle keâeÙeeX keâe mecheeove efkeâÙee keâjleer LeeR, Gme hej mJeeceerpeer efJeeqmcele jn ieÙes Les~ FmeerefueS Fme efJe<eÙe ceW Jes ßeerceleer yegue kesâ Deefleefjòeâ DevÙe efkeâmeer kesâ yeejs ceW veneR meesÛe mekesâ~ ieg[efJeve mJeeceerpeer kesâ efØeÙe hee$e Les Deewj ßeerceleer yegue Yeer Gvekeâer efJeMes<e mvesnYeepeve LeeR~ mJeeceerpeer keâer ceveesiele FÛÚe keâes mecePekeâj ieg[efJeve ves henues mes ner ßeerceleer yegue keâes efueKekeâj meejoevevo kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW metefÛele keâj efoÙee Lee~ meejoevevo kesâ yeejs ceW GvneWves efueKee Lee, ‘‘He is an able Sanskrit scholar, speaks quite as good English as Swami Vivekananda, and has a very intimate knowledge of the Vedanta as our Swami, although in a combative sense probably he is not so strong ... He will, I have not the least doubt, succeed in endearing himself to his class.’’18

15. mJeeceer ef$eiegCeeleerleevevo kesâ veece mJeeceerpeer ves 1896 F&. kesâ ceeÛe& ceW efueKee Lee, ‘‘ceneslmeJe kesâ Gheue#Ùe ceW ceQves Skeâ kesâyeue (mecegõer leej) Yespee Lee, osKelee ntB Gmekeâer keâesF& metÛevee legceves veneR efueKeer nw~’’ 12 HeâjJejer 1896 keâes vÙegÙeeke&â kesâ Jesoevle-DevegjeefieÙeeW ves Ùen kesâyeue Yespee Lee~

17. mJeeceerpeer ves 8 Deòetâyej 1896 keâes ßeerceleer yegue kesâ veece Deheves he$e ceW efueKee Lee, ‘It is needless fear for me to state that you have my implicit confidence in all works in the

U. S. and that (I) entrust everything there to you.' (New Discoveries, Vol. IV, p. 338)

18. New Discoveries, Vol. IV, p. 314

ßeerceleer yegue ves keâes DevÙe met$eeW mes Yeer veJeerve mebvÙeemeer kesâ yeejs ceW meceeÛeej efceue jns Les~ Deewj Gvekesâ yeejs ceW efceuevesJeeues meejs meceeÛeej ØeMebmeemetÛekeâ ner Les~ Yeòeâ pee@ve Heâekeäme ves uevove ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ meeLe cesuepeesue keâjves kesâ yeeo 21 petve keâes ßeerceleer yegue keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘I like Saradananda very much. He is exceedingly kind

and thoughtful of other people, very quiet and reserved usually, though not without humour.’’19 mJeeceer meejoevevo mes efceueves kesâ hetJe& ner ßeerceleer yegue leLee Decesefjkeâer YeòeâceC[ueer kesâ kegâÚ ueesie Gvekesâ ceneved iegCeeW keâe heefjÛeÙe heekeâj Deeveeqvole ngS Les Deewj Dee«enhetJe&keâ Gvekesâ Deeieceve keâer Øeleer#ee keâj jns Les~

mJeeceer meejoevevo ves Greenacre Conference of Comparative Religion («eerveskeâj kesâ legueveelcekeâ-Oece& meccesueve) Éeje Deeceefv$ele neskeâj «eerveSkeâj ceW Jesoevle hej JÙeeKÙeeve leLee keâ#eeSB uesvee DeejcYe keâj efoÙee~ mehleen ceW Skeâ efove kesâ Devlej hej Jes jepeÙeesie hej keâ#ee uesles Les~ jepeÙeesie kesâ yeeo GvneWves YeefòeâÙeesie leLee keâce&Ùeesie hej Yeer keâ#eeSB ueeR~ Fmekesâ Deefleefjòeâ jepeÙeesie keâe DeYÙeeme keâjves keâes Glmeener meeOekeâeW kesâ efueS Gvekeâer Øeweqkeäškeâue keâ#ee Yeer Ûeueleer jner~ Ùes keâ#eeSB oes cenerveeW lekeâ ÛeueeR~ ÙeneB hej Jes mJeeceerpeer kesâ meceeve ner Skeâ yeÌ[s osJeoej-Je=#e kesâ veerÛes Úe$eeW kesâ meeLe yew"keâj keâ#ee efueÙee keâjles Les~ Je=#e kesâ veerÛes Meerleue ÚeÙee, ÛeejeW Deesj Keguee cewoeve Deewj efvekeâš ner mejesJej

118 mJeeceer meejoevevo

keâe megvoj ÂMÙe jne keâjlee Lee~ meejoevevo keâer jepeÙeesie-keâ#ee kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW ßeerceleer Jeeu[es Éeje ØeMve G"eves hej mJeeceerpeer ves GvnW DeeÕemle keâjles ngS 8 Dekeäletyej (1896) keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘meejoevevo kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW keâesF& [j veneR nw – Jele&ceeve Yeejle kesâ meJe&ßes‰ Ùeesieer ves Gme hej DeeMeerJee&o keâer Je<ee& keâer nw~’’ Deewj JeneB hej mJeeceer meejoevevo keâer ueeskeâefØeÙelee kesâ keâejCe keâer JÙeeKÙee keâjles ngS ØelÙe#eoMeea Sveer efyemesvš ves efueKee Lee, ‘‘... atonce learned and modest, he recommended his teachings by his life.’’21

mJeeceerpeer kesâ efveoxMe hej ieg[efJeve ves 7 Deòetâyej keâes FbiuewC[ kesâ efueS ØemLeeve efkeâÙee~ Deewj FOej mJeeceer meejoevevo ves veJeerve GÅece kesâ meeLe ØeÛeejkeâeÙe& ceW ceveesefveÙeesie efkeâÙee~24 Deòetâyej kesâ Deeqvlece mehleen ceW GvneWves ‘yeÇgkeâefueve FefLekeâue SmeesefmeSMeve’ kesâ leòJeeJeOeeve ceW DeeÙeesefpele meYee kesâ mece#e ‘Jesoevle : efmeæevle Deewj JÙeJenej’ efJe<eÙe hej Yee<eCe efoÙee~25 mJeeceerpeer keâer efMe<Ùee kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ ves Gvekeâe Ùener JÙeeKÙeeve meJe&ØeLece megvee Lee~ Fme hej efJemceÙe-efJecegiOe neskeâj GvneWves 4 veJecyej (1896) kesâ efove ßeerceleer yegue keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘I was amazed at his grasp of English and much pleased with his presentation of the Vedanta. meejoevevo kesâ Oeerj, efJeveceü leLee mvesnhetCe& mJeYeeJe ves ßeerceleer yegue ceW ceve ceW ienje mLeeve yevee efueÙee Lee~ mvesnceÙeer ßeerceleer yegue keâes meejoevevo Granny Ùee oeoer-ceeB keânkeâj mecyeesefOele keâjles Les~ ßeerceleer yegue keâer DeeÙeg Gme meceÙe heÛeeme leLee meejoevevo keâer ueieYeie Fkeâleerme Je<e& Leer~ ÙeneB efveJeeme keâjles meceÙe ner mJeeceer meejoevevo keâe ßeerceleer yegue keâer heg$eer ßeerceleer Jeeienwve (DeesefueÙee) leLee Gvekeâer heg$eer S[efJevee Deewj ßeerceleer yegue keâer efce$e ßeerceleer efJeime kesâ meeLe Ieefve‰ heefjÛeÙe ngDee~

122 mJeeceer meejoevevo

mes hetÚkeâj ßeerjeceke=â<Ce kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW YeueerYeeBefle peeve efueÙee Lee Deewj MeerIeÇ ner Jes Gvekeâer Skeâ Devegjeieer Yeòeâ kesâ ¤he ceW meceeÂle nesves ueieeR~ ßeerjeceke=â<Ce mJeÙeb ner kewâmes otj-ojepe kesâ mLeeveeW ceW Yeer Deheveer ceefncee Hewâuee Ûegkesâ nQ, Ùen osKekeâj ØeÛeejkeâ mJeeceer meejoevevo DeJeekedâ jn ieÙes~

mJeeceer DeYesoevevo 9 Deiemle keâes vÙegÙeeke&â Deekeâj kegâceejer efHeâefuehme kesâ efveJeeme hej "njs Les~ Jes vÙegÙeeke&â Deewj efHeâj cee@Cš keäuesÙej ceW Deekeâj Deheves ieg®YeeF& meejoevevo mes efceues~ 1897 kesâ Deòetâyej kesâ Devle ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo kewâeqcyeÇpe DeeÙes Deewj JeneB keâ#ee DeejcYe keâer~ ÙeneB ßeerceleer yegue Gvekesâ ØeÛeejkeâeÙe& ceW ØeOeeve meneefÙekeâe ngFË~ ßeerjeceke=â<Ce-ceC[ueer ceW ßeerceleer yegue keâer mece=efæ Deewj veJeerve YeeJeeoMe& kesâ ¤heeÙeve leLee Øemeej ceW Gvekeâer ›eâceJeOe&ceeve Yetefcekeâe keâes osKekeâj mJeeceer meejoevevo MeerIeÇ ner Fme efve<keâ<e& hej hengBÛes efkeâ ßeerceleer yegue mecYeJele: peievceelee Éeje efveOee&efjle "ekegâj kesâ jmeooejeW ceW mes DeeOeer jmeooej nQ~32 FOej jeceke=â<Ce-efJeJeskeâevevo-DeeoMe& kesâ efueS efveJesefole-ØeeCe Yeefieveer efveJesefolee keâer Ssmeer OeejCee ngF& Leer efkeâ ßeerceleer yegue mJeÙeb ßeerjeceke=â<Ce Éeje efÛeefÖle nQ~33 Fve cenerÙemeer ceefnuee ves mJeeceer meejoevevo keâer Ssmeer ßeæe leLee efJeÕeeme Øeehle keâj efueÙee Lee efkeâ Gvekesâ Deheves keâcejs keâer oerJeej hej šBies ngS efÛe$eeW ceW Skeâ ßeerceeB keâe Lee Deewj otmeje ßeerceleer yegue keâe~ otmejer Deesj ßeerceleer yegue keâer Yeer meejoevevo kesâ Thej DeieeOe DeemLee Leer~ Fme yeele keâes mecePeves kesâ yeeo ßeerceleer yegue kesâ meeLe meejoevevo keâe heefjÛeÙe nesves kesâ ueieYeie Je<e& Yej yeeo mJeeceerpeer ves Deeueceyeepeej ce" ceW mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘ßeerceleer yegue ves DeefOekeâ Oeve Øeoeve efkeâÙee nw~ Mejled hej Gvekeâe DeefOekeâ efJeÕeeme nw~ Mejled keâer meueen ueskeâj mecemle ce"eW keâer JÙeJemLee keâjvee DeLeJee pees Ûeenes keâjvee~’’34 Deee|Lekeâ mecheke&â kesâ Deefleefjòeâ Yeer ßeerceleer yegue kesâ meeLe Gvekeâe ßeerjeceke=â<Ce-kesâeqvõkeâ pees Skeâ Deeeqlcekeâ mecheke&â efJekeâefmele ngDee Lee, Jen efJeMes<e ue#eCeerÙe nw~

efvece>efueefKele Iešvee mes nce mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ Thej ßeerceleer yegue kesâ efJeÕeeme leLee

32. ßeerjeceke=â<Ce-ueerueeØemebie, KeC[ 2, meb. 1963, he=. 471~ 1899 F&. kesâ veJecyej ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo ves ßeerceleer yegue keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘I need not say ‘May Sri Ramakrishna bless you’; for the way that has been opened to you to help Mother, Swamiji and us all, and to (uphold) the honour of the cause in the West, by helping the Swami in his accounts of the public money – shows that you have been chosen by Sri R and made the cornerstone and stay of His work. I bless you Granny dear with all my heart.’’ ( New Discoveries., Vol. 5, p. 73)

33. ßeerceleer yegue kesâ veece 22 veJecyej 1899 keâes efueKes efveJesefolee kesâ he$e keâe Skeâ DebMe :

‘‘And you, perhaps the Western worker who was deliberately foreseen and fore told by Sri Ramakrishna ...’’

34. cejer mes 11 Deòetâyej 1897 keâes efueKes mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo keâe he$e

efveYe&jlee keâer cee$ee kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW eEkeâefÛeled OeejCee keâj mekeâles nQ~ Skeâ yeej efkeâmeer keâejCeJeMe mJeeceerpeer leLee ßeerceleer yegue kesâ yeerÛe kegâÚ ieueleHeânceer nes ieÙeer Leer~ ßeerceleer yegue ves mJeeceerpeer kesâ veece efueKee ngDee Dehevee he$e Deewj mJeÙeb keâes efueKes mJeeceerpeer kesâ he$e kesâ meeLe hetjer Iešvee keâe efJemle=le efJeJejCe mJeeceer meejoevevo keâes efueKe Yespee~ eqmLeleOeer meejoevevo ves 13 efmelecyej 1900 keâes ßeerceleer yegue kesâ veece Skeâ ceOegj he$e kesâ ceeOÙece mes Dehevee megefJeÛeeefjle cele Øekeâš efkeâÙee~ GvneWves efueKee, ‘‘It seems there is, between yourself and the Swami, some misunderstanding just at present and I am wondering how there can be such a thing between you two, who know each other's life by the light and grace which Sri Ramakrishna has bestowed on each ... I am glad to know that you have worked out a plan for a sense of freedom from both sides, but my dear Granny, you know I am always averse to plans which do not run smoothly instilling peace and light and love on both sides, rather than doubts and disappointments and misunderstanding and misinterpretation of each other's motive of action. Whenever there is the latter, there you can well rest assured of some defect in our plans.’’ Demleg~ mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ Deevleefjkeâ ØeÙeeme mes mJeeceerpeer leLee Oeerjeceelee kesâ yeerÛe pees ieueleHeânceer keâe letHeâeve G"e Lee, Jen Meevle nes ieÙee~

Deheves ieg®osJe kesâ meceeve ner mJeeceer meejoevevo Yeer efÛejkeâeue lekeâ efMe#eeLeea yeves jns~ heef§ece keâer ÛekeâeÛeeQOe-Yejer mebmke=âefle keâes osKekeâj Jes efoiYeüefcele veneR ngS~ GvneWves JeneB kesâ Deveskeâ mecYeüevle heefjJeejeW kesâ meeLe Ieefve‰ ¤he mes efceue-peguekeâj Skeâ Deesj peneB Gvekesâ meebmke=âeflekeâ peerJeve kesâ Yeues-yegjs he#eeW keâes YeueerYeeBefle peeve efueÙee Lee, JeneR otmejer Deesj GveceW mes keâF& ueesieeW keâes Jes YeejleJe<e& kesâ keâeÙe& nsleg Deeke=â° keâjves ceW Yeer meceLe& ngS Les~ hejvleg Gme heefjJesMe kesâ yeerÛe jnkeâj Yeer, GvneWves Deheves DeeOÙeeeqlcekeâ peerJeve keâes heefjheg° efkeâÙee Lee~ ßeerceleer yegue leLee DevÙe keâF& heefjJeejeW keâer ceefnueeDeeW kesâ meeLe mebmeie& ves Gvekeâer Âef° keâes mJeÛÚ leLee Gvekesâ DeeOÙeeeqlcekeâ peerJeve keâes efJekeâeme kesâ Devegketâue yeveeÙee Lee Deewj Gvekesâ hejJeleea keâce&peerJeve keâes Yeer ØeYeeefJele efkeâÙee Lee~ mJeeceer meejoevevo Éeje efueefKele Skeâ he$e ceW Fmekeâer mhe° mJeerke=âefle osKeves keâes efceueleer nw~ heeBÛe Je<e& yeeo GvneWves yeeieyeepeej DebÛeue keâer Menjer-ceefnueeDeeW kesâ efueS Skeâ efMe#ee-Øekeâuhe DeejcYe efkeâÙee Lee~ Fme Øemebie ceW GvneWves ßeerceleer yegue keâes efueKee Lee35, ‘‘I have undertaken the women's work through your persuasion dear Granny. You remember our talks in Cambridge. There is no other reason for our undertaking

35. ßeerceleer yegue kesâ veece efueefKele 20 HeâjJejer 1903 F&. keâe he$e

124 mJeeceer meejoevevo

and that is the special good that has come to me through women here as well as women in America! They have been my polestar in life and through them I have been taught to revere the Mother Divine! May She be ever blessed.’’36 mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ hejJeleea peerJeve keâe meeje heLe mJeosMeer

leLee efJeosMeer veeefjÙeeW kesâ Øeefle ßeæe leLee veejer-ceefncee keâer mJeerke=âefle kesâ heoefÛeÖeW mes JÙeehle nw~

ßeerceleer yegue kesâ meeLe meueen keâjkesâ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves Deheves Jesoevle-ØeÛeej keâe keâeÙe& mebieef"le efkeâÙee Lee~ Fmekesâ HeâuemJe¤he Jesoevle keâeHeâer ueeskeâefØeÙe nes G"e Lee Deewj mJeÛÚvo ieefle mes Øemeeefjle nes jne Lee~ "erkeâ Gmeer meceÙe ßeerceleer yegue keâes mJeeceerpeer keâe 19 Deiemle (1897) keâe he$e Øeehle ngDee~ Gme he$e ceW mJeeceerpeer ves efueKee Lee, ‘‘meejoevevo Ùeefo Deevee Ûeens lees Dee peeÙe; cesje mJeemLÙe Fme meceÙe efyeieÌ[ Ûegkeâe nw~’’ ßeerceleer yegue Ùee mJeeceer meejoevevo Ùee Decesefjkeâe kesâ Jesoevle-DevegjeefieÙeeW ceW mes keâesF& Yeer mJeeceerpeer kesâ Ssmes efveCe&Ùe kesâ efueS Øemlegle ve Les~ Jesoevle-ØeÛeejkeâ kesâ ¤he ceW, heef§ece ceW mJeeceerpeer Éeje DeejyOe keâeÙe& kesâ efveJee&nkeâ kesâ ¤he ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo keâer meHeâuelee Gme meceÙe Ûejce meercee hej Leer~37 mJeeceer meejoevevo leLee mJeeceer DeYesoevevo kesâ DeLekeâ heefjßece mes Decesefjkeâe kesâ keâF& DebÛeueeW ceW Jesoevle-ØeÛeej ves Gme osMe kesâ ueesieeW ceW ØeYetle Dee«en leLee Göerhevee keâer me=ef°

  1. Fmekesâ meeLe ner mJeeceer meejoevevo Éeje ueieYeie Gmeer meceÙe efueefKele Skeâ efveyevOe keâe Ùen DebMe Yeer mcejCeerÙe nw – ‘‘Yeejle kesâ efoJÙeõ°e $e+ef<eÙeeW ves veejer ceW peieled-Glheefòe keâe efJeMes<e ØekeâeMe ØelÙe#e ¤he mes DevegYeJe efkeâÙee Deewj FmeerefueS GvneWves cegòeâkeâc" mes Iees<eCee keâer efkeâ veejer yegefæ¤hee nw, Meefòeâ¤hee nw, peieppeveveer keâer £eefoveer, me=peveer Deewj heeueveer MeefòeâÙeeW keâer peerleer-peeieleer Øeeflecee nw ~ ... GvneWves Ùen efmej Pegkeâekeâj mJeerkeâej efkeâÙee efkeâ hejceelcee kesâ mee#eeled oMe&ve SJeb hetle mheMe& mes veejer Yeer heg®<e keâer lejn DeleereqvõÙe efoJÙe-Âef° mecheVe neskeâj $e+ef<elJe-ueeYe keâjleer nw ~ ...
