  2. ‘FeqC[Ùeve efcejj’ he$e kesâ 6 ceeÛe& (1897) kesâ Debkeâ ceW ØekeâeefMele Skeâ meceeÛeej kesâ DeeOeej hej Mebkeâjer Øemeeo yemeg ves Dehevee cele JÙeòeâ keâjles ngS efueKee nw, ‘‘Decesefjkeâe ceW meejoevevo kesâ peerJeve leLee ØeÛeej ves efpeve meJeexÛÛe mlej kesâ ueesieeW keâes ØeYeeefJele efkeâÙee Lee; Gmes efJeefueÙece pescme, Dees. ueeJepeÙe, peesefMeÙee jeFme, meer.meer.SJejsš, pes.F. ueeT, jwÛesue kesâCš šsuej Deeefo efJeKÙeele oeMe&efvekeâ efJeÉeveeW kesâ ØeMebmeehetCe& GuuesKe mes mecePee pee mekeâlee nw~ meejoevevo peer kesâ Yeejle ueewšves kesâ yeeo lekeâ Sbiuees-FeqC[Ùeve meceeÛeej-he$e Gvekesâ efJe<eÙe ceW DeeojmetÛekeâ YeeJe JÙeòeâ efkeâÙes efyevee veneR jn mekesâ Les~ ‘ceõeme cesue’ ves Deheves 13 peveJejer 1898 kesâ Debkeâ ceW Gvekeâe mebef#ehle peerJeveheefjÛeÙe osles ngS efueKee Lee, ‘‘Judging from the reports which have appeared of his lectures in America, he has become an efficient and telling public speaker.’’ (efJeJeskeâevevo Dees mecekeâeueerve YeejleJe<e&, KeC[ 4, he==. 72)

keâer Leer, yeequkeâ keâne pee mekeâlee nw efkeâ Gve Gve mLeeveeW ceW Jesoevle-Deevoesueve ves meekeâej ¤he uesvee DeejcYe keâj efoÙee Lee~

efJeefYeVe ueesieeW ceW Ùen meceeÛeej Øemeeefjle nesves hej efYeVe efYeVe Øekeâej keâer Øeefleef›eâÙeeSB osKeves keâes efceueeR~ hejvleg eqmLejyegeqæ meejoevevo ceW Gvekeâe mJeYeeJeefmeæ Deveemeòeâ leLee efvejhes#e YeeJe ner osKeves ceW DeeÙee~38 Gvekesâ efueS lees Skeâcee$e leLee ØecegKe yeele Ùen Leer efkeâ Gvekesâ veslee mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo keäÙee Ûeenles nQ~ otmejeW keâer yeeleeW hej OÙeeve ve oskeâj GvneWves meerOes mJeeceerpeer keâe ner efveoxMe peeveves kesâ efueS lelkeâeue GvnW he$e efueKee~39 efHeâj mJeeceerpeer keâe efveoxMe heÇehle nesles ner GvneWves efyevee efkeâmeer efÉOee kesâ YeejleJe<e& ueewšves keâer lewÙeejer DeejcYe keâj oer~ Gvekesâ meeLe ßeerceleer yegue leLee cewkeäueeG[ Yeer Ûeueves keâes Øemlegle ngFË~ efce$e-yeevOeJeeW leLee Devegjeieer YeòeâeW mes efJeoe ueskeâj mJeeceer meejoevevo vÙegÙeeke&â mes šeFšwefvekeâ penepe40 ceW meJeej neskeâj 12 peveJejer 1898 keâes FbiuewC[ keâer Deesj jJeevee nes ieÙes~ mJeeceer meejoevevo Éeje efyeKesjs ngS Jesoevle kesâ yeerpe Decesefjkeâe kesâ keâF& DebÛeueeW ceW efyeKejs jns, efpevneWves hejJeleea keâeue ceW LeesÌ[er-meer osKeYeeue mes ner Debkegâefjle neskeâj Jesoevle-Deevoesueve keâes meyeue keâj efoÙee Lee~

mJeeceer meejoevevo, ßeerceleer yegue leLee kegâ. cewkeäueeG[ 20 peveJejer keâes ueerJejhegue hengBÛes~ uevove ceW Jes ueesie efce[uewC[ «ewC[ nesšue ceW "njs~ ßeerceleer mš[ea, ieeumeJeoea Deeefo hegjeves YeòeâeW kesâ meeLe YeWš keâjves kesâ yeeo mJeeceer meejoevevo ves Gve ueesieeW mes efJeoe ueer~ uevove mes Ûeuekeâj Jes ueesie 21 peveJejer keâer Meece keâes hesefjme hengBÛes~ meejoevevo keâes OeejCee ngF& efkeâ Ùen Skeâ peve-DejCÙe nw Deewj ÙeneB efmej keâes "erkeâ jKevee keâef"ve nw~ kegâue efceueekeâj Jen Skeâ efJeMeeue mJehe> kesâ meceeve ueiee~ Deieues efove mebOÙee kesâ meceÙe Jes ‘uee Jesueer hesefjme’ veeškeâ ceW Skeâ DevOeer Œeer keâer Yetefcekeâe ceW meeje yeve&ne[& keâe DeefYeveÙe osKekeâj cegiOe ngS~

38. ßeerceleer yegue kesâ veece 18/10/97 keâes efueKee ieÙee he$e Fmekeâe Skeâ ØeceeCe nw~ GvneWves efueKee Lee, ‘‘I do not know how my going over India will end. I hear that Swami Abhedananda has also written to Swami Vivekananda to know whether he really means I should return. Anyway I have made up my mind to stay till the end of

November, and I am holding neutral as regards my going and coming, but this is certain that I will have to do earnest work wherever I might be, here or there.’’

39. Ùen he$e lees veneR, hejvleg Skeâ DevÙe he$e nceW Øeehle ngDee nw~ ßeerceleer yegue kesâ efveJeeme mes 22 veJecyej kesâ efove mJeeceer meejoevevo ves Fmes meevÙeeue ceneMeÙe keâes efueKee nw~ GvneWves efueKee nw, ‘‘vejsve ves cesjs Yeejle ueewšves kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW ßeerceleer yegue keâes Skeâ he$e efueKee~ lelhe§eeled Gmekeâer FÛÚe keâes YeueerYeeBefle peeves-mecePes efyevee Yeejle ueewšvee cetKe&lee mecePekeâj ceQves GvnW Skeâ he$e efueKee~ leye Yeer cegPes Gvekeâe keâesF& Gòej cegPes veneR efceuee~’’ 11 efomecyej keâes GvneWves yeõerMeen keâes efueKee, ‘‘I do

not know either whether he (Swamiji) wishes me to stay over in America or go back to India.’’

40. mJeeceer DeYesoevevo ves 25 peveJejer keâes mJeeceer jeceke=â<Ceevevo keâes efueKee, ‘‘Mejled Lee~ yeerÛe yeerÛe ceW cegueekeâele nesleer Leer~ Jen Yeer "ekegâj keâes menve veneR ngDee~’’

126 mJeeceer meejoevevo

23 peveJejer keâes Jes veesšj[wce kewâLes[^ue leLee jsvesmeeB jbiecebÛe osKeves kesâ yeeo jele kesâ Dee" yepes keâer š^sve mes vesheume kesâ efueS jJeevee ngS~ 25 leejerKe keâes Yeesj ceW jesce hengBÛekeâj Jes ueesie keâeeqCšvesCšue nesšue ceW "njs Deewj mesCš heeršme& yewefmeefuekeâe leLee neefvekeäÙeguece kesâ heJe&le-efMeKej mes ceveesjce Øeeke=âeflekeâ o=MÙeeW keâe DeJeueeskeâve efkeâÙee~ Fmekesâ yeeo GvneWves mesCš mesyeseqmšÙeve keâer meceeefOe osKeer~ jele keâes GvneWves jbiecebÛe hej ßes‰ DeefYeves$eer efMeveesje Sefueveesje [tmeer keâe DeefYeveÙe osKee~ Deieues efove meeCše mkeâesuee osKevee ngDee~ efmemšeFve YepeveeueÙe ceW ceeFkesâue Sbpesuees kesâ Glke=â° efÛe$e, efJeMes<ekeâj cetmee keâer efJeMeeue cete|le osKekeâj meejoevevo cegiOe nes ieÙes~ 26 leejerKe keâes megyen keâueesefmeÙece osKeves kesâ yeeo 1 yepekeâj 35 efceveš keâer š^sve mes jJeevee neskeâj, Ûeej IeCšs yeeo Jes ueesie vesheume hengBÛes~

27 leejerKe keâes ØeeleŠkeâeue Gve ueesieeW ves Jewefškeâve keâe ie>vLeeieej leLee efÛe$e-iewuejer keâe heefjoMe&ve efkeâÙee~ Fmekesâ yeeo Jes ueesie mesCš heeršj kesâ efiejpes ceW ieÙes~ meejoevevo ves Deheveer [eÙejer ceW efueKee, ‘‘St. Peter for the last time.’’ 28 leejerKe keâes Gve ueesieeW ves efJemetefJeÙeme keâe pJeeueecegKeer osKee~ Deieues efove š^sve ceW meJeej neskeâj mebOÙee kesâ meceÙe Jes ueesie efyeÇeqC[meer hengBÛes~ hesefvevmeguej penepe GvnW ueskeâj JeneB mes 30 peveJejer keâes jJeevee ngDee Deewj 8 HeâjJejer keâes yecyeF& hengBÛee~ DeeueeeEmeiee hes®ceue ves mJeeceer meejoevevo leLee efJeosefMeveer DeefleefLeÙeeW keâe mJeeiele efkeâÙee~ mecceeveveerÙe DeefleefLeÙeeW keâes meeLe ueskeâj mJeeceer meejoevevo 14 leejerKe keâes megyen neJeÌÌ[e hengBÛes~ GvneWves heeÙee efkeâ kegâÚ meeOeg-yeÇÿeÛeeefjÙeeW keâes meeLe efueS mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo mJeÙeb ner JeneB GheeqmLele nQ~

meejoevevo hee§eelÙe osMeeW ceW ueieYeie oes Je<e& ØeÛeej-keâeÙe& megmecheVe keâjkesâ Jeeheme ueewšs Les~ Deye GvneWves veJeerve ce" kesâ mebie"ve-efJe<eÙekeâ keâeÙeeX ceW ceveesefveÙeesie efkeâÙee~ hejvleg Gve efoveeW ce" ceW yeÌ[e ner DeLee&YeeJe Lee~ Skeâ Je<e& yeeo mJeeceerpeer keâer FÛÚevegmeej mJeeceer meejoevevo leLee mJeeceer legjerÙeevevo ves Oece&ØeÛeej leLee DeLe&meb«en kesâ efveefceòe iegpejele keâer Deesj peeves keâe efve§eÙe efkeâÙee~ keâuekeâòes peekeâj ßeerceeB keâes ØeCeece keâjves kesâ yeeo oesveeW mebvÙeeefmeÙeeW ves 7 HeâjJejer (1899) keâes ØemLeeve efkeâÙee~ meJe&ØeLece Jes ueesie keâevehegj ieÙes~ JeneB heeqC[le he=LJeerveeLe ves GvnW efvejeMe efkeâÙee~ keâevehegj mes Jes Deeieje Deewj JeneB mes peÙehegj ieÙes~

peÙehegj ceW oes efove efveJeeme keâjkesâ Gve ueesieeW ves ieesheerveeLe peer leLee ieuelee-leerLe& keâe oMe&ve efkeâÙee~ efHeâj JeneB mes Deecesj peekeâj GvneWves ÙeMeesjsÕejer osJeer keâe oMe&ve efkeâÙee~ peÙehegj ceW GvneWves KesleÌ[er kesâ jepee Depeerle eEmen kesâ meeLe YeWš keâer~ jepee ves Skeâ jele oesveeW keâes efveceefv$ele keâjkesâ Yeespeve keâjeÙee Deewj Denceoeyeeo lekeâ kesâ efueS efÉleerÙe ßesCeer kesâ oes efškeâš Kejero efoÙes~ Denceoeyeeo mes 15 HeâjJejer keâer Meece keâes Jes ueesie efueceÌ[er ieÙes Deewj 4 ceeÛe& lekeâ JeneB jepe-DeefleefLe kesâ ¤he ceW efveJeeme efkeâÙee~ 20 leejerKe keâes Gvekeâer jepee kesâ meeLe cegueekeâele ngF&~ jepee efJeefYeVe ueesieeW kesâ veece heefjÛeÙe-he$e osves keâes mencele nes ieÙes~ oerJeeve kesâ ØemleeJe hej Skeâ pevemeYee keâe Yeer DeeÙeespeve ngDee~ jepee Yeer GmeceW meeqcceefuele ngS, hejvleg ueesie keâce ner DeeÙes Les~ 26 leejerKe keâes «evLeheeue ogueerjeJe ves Deekeâj metefÛele efkeâÙee efkeâ Meece keâes Ûeej yepes pevemeYee nesieer~ Gme meYee ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo ves JÙeeKÙeeve efoÙee~ efnvoer41 Yee<ee ceW Ùener Gvekeâe henuee JÙeeKÙeeve Lee~ 1 ceeÛe& keâes oerJeeve ves GvnW metefÛele efkeâÙee efkeâ mJeeceerpeer kesâ DeefYeØesle keâeÙe& kesâ efueS jepee Skeâ npeej ®heÙes oWies~ 5 ceeÛe& keâes petveeieÌ{ peekeâj Gve ueesieeW ves JeneB kesâ oerJeeve mes YeWš keâer~ Deieues efove oerJeeve ves oes meew ®heÙes oeve keâjves keâe JeÛeve efoÙee~ 14 ceeÛe& keâes Gvekeâe ueKeerjepe kesâ meeLe mee#eelkeâej ngDee Deewj Gvemes kegâÚ DeLe& keâe JeÛeve Øeehle ngDee~

Fmekesâ yeeo oesveeW mebvÙeemeer 17 ceeÛe& keâes ieesC[eue ieÙes~ ceesJeea ceW efveJeeme kesâ oewjeve 6 DeØewue keâes GvnW efveJesefolee kesâ he$e mes Ùen MeeskeâmebJeeo efceuee efkeâ Gvekesâ efØeÙe ieg®YeeF& Ùeesieevevo ves 28 ceeÛe& keâes osnlÙeeie keâj efoÙee nw~ Gmeer jele JeneB kesâ šeGve ne@ue ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo ves efnvoer Yee<ee ceW Skeâ JÙeeKÙeeve efoÙee~ efHeâj 14 DeØewue keâes YeeJeveiej kesâ GÛÛe efJeÅeeueÙe ceW ‘Jeso keâe meej-leòJe’ efJe<eÙe hej Gvekeâe Skeâ Yee<eCe ngDee~ ‘yeÇÿeJeeefoved’ heef$ekeâe ceW ØekeâeefMele Skeâ YeeJeveiejJeemeer kesâ efjheesš& mes %eele neslee nw efkeâ mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ JÙeeKÙeeve ves meYeer ßesCeer kesâ ueesieeW keâes ØeYeeefJele efkeâÙee Lee~ hejvleg Jesoevle-ØeÛeej keâe keâeÙe& Deewj Deeies veneR yeÌ{ mekeâe~ 17 DeØewue kesâ efove oesveeW mebvÙeeefmeÙeeW keâes leej mes mJeeceerpeer keâe Skeâ efveoxMe Øeehle ngDee~ Deieues efove ner jJeevee neskeâj Jes ueesie 3 ceF& keâes keâuekeâòes hengBÛe ieÙes~ meJe&ØeLece GvneWves ßeerceeB keâer ÛejCe-Jevovee keâer Deewj Meece keâes yesuetÌ[ ce" peekeâj mJeeceerpeer kesâ mece#e Deheves keâeÙe& keâe efJemle=le efJeJejCe efoÙee~ Fme {eF& cenerveeW kesâ ØeJeeme kesâ oewjeve DeLe&meb«en kesâ Deefleefjòeâ Yeer Fve oesveeW mebvÙeeefmeÙeeW keâes jepemLeeve leLee iegpejele DebÛeue kesâ Deveskeâ ieCÙeceevÙe ueesieeW kesâ meeLe mJeeceerpeer kesâ osMeeslLeeve keâer heefjkeâuhevee hej ÛeÛee& keâjves keâe megÙeesie efceuee Lee~

kegâÚ ceen yeeo hetJeea yebieeue kesâ YeòeâeW keâe Deecev$eCe heekeâj mJeeceer meejoevevo ves 11 efomecyej 1899 keâes ce" mes ØemLeeve efkeâÙee~ {ekeâe hengBÛeves kesâ yeeo Jes peceeRoej ceesefnveer ceesnve oeme kesâ Heâjemeiebpe eqmLele cekeâeve ceW "njs~ 15 efomecyej mes 2 peveJejer (1900) kesâ oewjeve GvneWves peieVeeLe keâe@uespe leLee peerJeve yeeyet kesâ veešŸe-ceeqvoj ceW Ûeej DelÙevle ùoÙe«eener JÙeeKÙeeve efoÙes Les~ peieVeeLe keâe@uespe ceW Gvekesâ JÙeeKÙeeve keâe efJe<eÙe Lee – ‘efnvotOece& keâer meeJe&Yeewefcekeâlee’ (Catholicity of Hinduism) Deewj otmejs mLeeve kesâ leerve JÙeeKÙeeveeW kesâ efJe<eÙe Les – ‘keäÙee efJeÕeJeeefmeÙeeW kesâ efueS nceeje keâesF& ceneved ›ele nw?’ (Have we any Mission for the World), ‘ØesceOece&’ (Religion of love) leLee ‘heeefjJeeefjkeâ peerJeve ceW Yeer keäÙee Oece& mecYeJe nw?’ (Is religion possible in the

41. mecYeJele: yebieeue keâer Deece pevelee ceW ØeÛeefuele efnvoer Yee<ee keâe ner GvneWves GheÙeesie efkeâÙee Lee~

128 mJeeceer meejoevevo

faimily life) ~ Fve meye efJe<eÙeeW kesâ Deefleefjòeâ Yeer Jes Øeefle cebieue leLee MeefveJeej keâes ceesefnveer yeeyet kesâ Iej hej ‘YeieJeodieerlee’ leLee Oece&-efJe<eÙekeâ efJeefJeOe efJe<eÙeeW hej ÛeÛee& keâjles Les~42 {ekeâe ceW jnles meceÙe mJeeceer meejoevevo "ekegâj kesâ efJeMes<e Yeòeâ ogiee&ÛejCe veeie mes efceueves Gvekesâ osJeYeesie eqmLele Iej ieÙes Les~43 veeie ceneMeÙe Gve efoveeW Deheveer Deeqvlece MeÙÙee hej uesšs Les~ 27 efomecyej (1899) keâes Gvekesâ ceneØeÙeeCe keâe meceeÛeej heekeâj meejoevevo peer oewÌ[keâj Fve ceneheg®<e kesâ Øeefle Deheveer Deeqvlece ßeæe efveJesefole keâjves ieÙes Les~

megjsve mesve, yeÇpesve vevoer, Ùeesiesvõ Deeefo mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo kesâ Devegjeieer kegâÚ ÙegJekeâeW kesâ GÅeesie leLee Glmeen kesâ keâejCe mJeeceer meejoevevo yeejermeeue peeves keâes jepeer ngS~ yeejermeeue veiej megØeefmeæ osMeØesceer leLee efMe#ee›eleer DeeqÕeveer kegâceej oòe kesâ keâere|le-keâueeheeW mes cegKej Lee~ Gvekesâ meceLe&ve leLee Øeeslmeenve mes veiej kesâ ÙegJekeâieCe mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo kesâ ieg®Yeüelee mJeeceer meejoevevo keâe ÙeLeesefÛele mJeeiele keâjves keâes Glmeeefnle ngS~ mJeeceer meejoevevo 4 peveJejer (1900) keâes yeejermeeue hengBÛes Les~ Gvekesâ Deeieceve keâes efveefceòe yeveekeâj JeneB kesâ keâójhevLeer mecegoeÙe leLee ØeieefleMeerue ÙegJekeâeW kesâ yeerÛe Skeâ mebIe<e& efÚÌ[ ieÙee~ DeeqÕeveer yeeyet kesâ efJeMes<e ØeÙeeme mes ceeceuee efveÙeb$eCe ceW DeeÙee~44 DeeqÕeveer yeeyet ves mJeeceer meejoevevo keâes Deheves Iej ceW ner "njeÙee Lee~ Gvekeâer FÛÚe Leer efkeâ cenejepe GvneR kesâ ÙeneB efveJeeme keâjW~

  1. hetJe&yebies ßeerjeceke=â<Ce-efJeJeskeâevevosj YeeJeOeejej ØeÛeej, jceCeer kegâceej oòeieghle (‘GodyeesOeve’ yeBieuee ceeefmekeâ, Je<e& 52, mebKÙee 8, he=. 413)
  2. Skeâ efove GvneWves ‘efMeJemebies meoejbies’, ‘cepeuees Deeceej ceveYeüceje’ leLee ‘ieÙee iebiee ØeYeemeeefo’

– Ùes leerve Yepeve ieekeâj veeie ceneMeÙe keâes megveeÙes Les~ Yepeve megvekeâj veeie ceneMeÙe meceeefOemLe nes ieÙes Les~ veeie ceneMeÙe keâer FÛÚevegmeej Skeâ efove j#eekeâeueer keâer hetpee ngF&~ meejoevevo peer keâer meueen hej veeie ceneMeÙe kesâ efmejneves Gme Øeeflecee keâer mLeehevee keâer ieÙeer~ veece ceneMeÙe ‘ceeB’ ‘ceeB’ keâe GÛÛeejCe keâjles ngS YeeJemeceeefOe ceW [tye ieÙes Les~ oes IeCšs yeeo Gvekeâer meceeefOe štšer Leer~

44. vejsvõveeLe mesve Éeje efueefheyeæ efJeJejCe keâe Skeâ DebMe Fme Øekeâej nw – ‘‘mJeeceer meejoevevo peer ves Kegueer meYee ceW leerve JÙeeKÙeeve efoÙes Les~ hengBÛeves kesâ Deieues efove ner Gvekeâe henuee JÙeeKÙeeve ‘meveeleve efnvot Oece&-jef#eCeer meYee’ ceW nesves keâer yeele Leer~ hejvleg Jen mecYeJe veneR nes mekeâe Lee~ Oece&jef#eCeer meYee kesâ lelkeâeueerve mebÛeeuekeâ Skeâ Jekeâerue Les Deewj GvneWves mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ efJeosMe nes DeeÙes nesves kesâ keâejCe JÙeeKÙeeve kesâ efvee|o° meceÙe kesâ kegâÚ keâeue hetJe& meYee keâjves keâer Devegceefle Jeeheme ues ueer, keäÙeeWefkeâ efJeosMe mes ueewšs mebvÙeemeer kesâ Deeieceve mes ‘meveeleve efnvot Oece&-jef#eCeer meYee’ kesâ keâuegef<ele nes peeves keâe YeÙe Lee! MeeŒeefJeOeeve keâe GuuebIeve keâjkesâ mecegõÙee$ee keâj Deeves kesâ keâejCe Gvekeâe efnvot Oece& kesâ ØeÛeej ceW DeefOekeâej veneR Lee! Ùen mebJeeo heeles ner DeefÕeveer yeeyet, keâeueerMe Ûevõ Deeefo ceveeref<eieCe DelÙevle #egyOe ngS~ Úe$e-mecegoeÙe leLee Deece pevelee Yeer #egyOe nes G"er~ Gme meceÙe pees Gòespevee Deewj yesÛewveer Hewâue ieÙeer Leer, Gmekeâe JeCe&ve keâjvee DemecYeJe nw~ pevelee ves Oece&jef#eCeer meYee hej helLej yejmeevee DeejcYe keâj efoÙee~ Gmekesâ YeJeve hej lejn lejn kesâ GheõJe Meg¤ nes ieÙes~ DeefÕeveer yeeyet ves yeÌ[er keâef"veeF& mes #egyOe pevelee keâes Meevle efkeâÙee Deewj Deieues efove Deheves keâe@uespe ceW meYee nesves keâer Iees<eCee keâer~’’

FOej ÙegJee YeòeâeW keâe oeJee Lee efkeâ cenejepe GvneR ueesieeW keâer JÙeJemLee kesâ Devegmeej Skeâ DevÙe cekeâeve ceW jnW~ cenejepe kesâ neLe hekeâÌ[keâj KeeRÛeleeve Meg¤ ngF&~ DeeefKejkeâej ÙegJee YeòeâeW kesâ n" keâes ceevekeâj cenejepe ves DeeqMJeveer yeeyet kesâ Iej kesâ heeme kesâ ner Skeâ veJeefvee|cele YeJeve ceW Dee" efove efveJeeme efkeâÙee~ Jewmes efove keâe DeefOekeâebMe meceÙe Jes DeeqÕeveer yeeyet kesâ Iej hej ner efyeleeÙee keâjles Les~

DeefÕeveer yeeyet kesâ cekeâeve ceW cenejepe Øeefleefove megyen kesâ 8-9 yepes mes ueskeâj jele 10-11 yepes lekeâ mewkeâÌ[eW Glmegkeâ vej-veeefjÙeeW kesâ mece#e Oece& hej leLee keâYeer keâYeer DevÙe efJe<eÙeeW hej Yeer ÛeÛee& keâjles~ lespeesöerhle mebvÙeemeer keâer GheeqmLeefle mes veiej kesâ ÙegJekeâeW ceW Skeâ lejn keâer efJeješd nueÛeue GlheVe nes ieÙeer Leer~ ÙegJekeâeW kesâ Øeefle Gvekeâe mevosMe Lee : ‘‘Self-confidence, Self-confidence – this is what I want.’’ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves yeÇpeceesnve keâe@uespe kesâ ne@ue ceW 6 mes 8 pegueeF& lekeâ Øeefleefove Deewj Fme Øekeâej kegâue efceueekeâj leerve JÙeeKÙeeve efoÙes~ henues efove Jes ‘Catholicity and Hinduism’ efJe<eÙe hej Deb«espeer ceW yeesuess~ cenejepe kesâ Fme Deb«espeer JÙeeKÙeeve keâe meej-meb#eshe DeefÕeveer yeeyet ves Øeebpeue yeBieuee Yee<ee ceW Øemlegle efkeâÙee Lee~ hejJeleea oes efoveeW kesâ yeBieuee JÙeeKÙeeveeW kesâ efJe<eÙe Les – ‘Meefòeâ Deewj mebÙece’ leLee ‘Yeefòeâ Deewj %eeve’~45 ÙeneB mcejCeerÙe nw efkeâ ØeLece efove keâer pevemeYee kesâ DeejcYe ceW DeefÕeveer yeeyet ves Jeòeâe keâe heefjÛeÙe osles ngS keâne Lee, ‘‘mJeeceer meejoevevo peer YeieJeeve jeceke=â<Ce hejcenbmeosJe kesâ Skeâ efJeefMe° mebvÙeemeer-efMe<Ùe leLee mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo kesâ ieg®YeeF& nQ~ hejcenbmeosJe keâer ke=âhee mes efJeÕe keâes efnueevesJeeues Skeâ ner efJeJeskeâevevo pevceW neW, Ssmeer yeele veneR; Gvekeâer ke=âhee mes Ùes meYeer Skeâ Skeâ efJeJeskeâevevo nQ~ FveceW mes ØelÙeskeâ ceevees Skeâ Skeâ pJeeueecegKeer nQ~ Fve ueesieeW keâer GheeqmLeefle ner ceevees ÛewlevÙeoeefÙeveer nw~ Ùes ueesie peneB keâneR Yeer efveJeeme keâjles nQ, efpeme Yeer ceeie& mes efvekeâue peeles nQ, JeneB keâe meeje Decebieue YemceerYetle nes peelee nw~ ... Ùeefo Deehe ueesie mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo keâes osKeles, leYeer mecePe heeles efkeâ mJeeceer meejoevevo ntyent GvneR kesâ Øeefle¤he nQ~’’

veiejJeemeer megØeefmeæ Jeòeâe DeefÕeveer yeeyet keâes neLe efnuee-efnueekeâj efJeefYeVe YeeJe-YebefieceeDeeW kesâ meeLe JÙeeKÙeeve keâjles osKeves kesâ DeYÙemle Les~ hejvleg Gve ueesieeW ves osKee efkeâ mJeeceer meejoevevo JÙeeKÙeeve osles meceÙe efve§eue YeeJe mes oC[eÙeceeve nQ Deewj Gvekesâ oesveeW yeeng meerves kesâ Thej mLeeefhele nQ~ yeerÛe yeerÛe ceW Gvekeâer iejove LeesÌ[er LeesÌ[er efnueleer Leer~ Gvekesâ DevegÛÛe keâesceue keâC" mes GÛÛeefjle DeefYeveJe YeeJelejbieeW ves ßeesleeDeeW keâes ceb$ecegiOe keâj efueÙee~ 9 leLee 10 leejerKe keâes meejoevevo peer ves Jeelee&ueehe leLee efpe%eemegDeeW kesâ ØeMveeW kesâ Gòej oskeâj meyekeâes mevleg° keâj efoÙee Lee~

45. mJeeceer meejoevevo, he==. 137

130 mJeeceer meejoevevo

Deeqvlece efove ÙegJekeâieCe meYee-meefceefle keâer DeewheÛeeefjkeâlee keâes efleueebpeefue oskeâj cenejepe kesâ Devlejbie mebieueeYe kesâ efueS Glmegkeâ nes G"s Les~ cenejepe Yeer ÙegJekeâeW keâer efve‰e osKekeâj ØemeVe ngS Les~ ÙegJekeâeW ves Gvemes ßeerjeceke=â<Ce kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW kegâÚ megveeves keâe Dee«en efkeâÙee~ Gvekesâ keâeHeâer DevegveÙe-efJeveÙe kesâ yeeo cenejepe yeesues, ‘‘efpeleveer DeeÙeg yeÌ{ jner nw, Glevee ner osKe jne ntB efkeâ ceQ "ekegâj keâes efyeukegâue Yeer mecePe veneR mekeâe ntB~ mJeeceerpeer leLee veeie ceneMeÙe ves "ekegâj keâes kegâÚ kegâÚ mecePee nw~ nce ueesie lees mesJekeâ cee$e nQ; kesâJeue Gvekesâ DeeosMe keâe heeueve keâjves keâe ØeÙeeme keâj jns nQ~’’ Devle ceW cenejepe ves yeleeÙee, ‘‘"ekegâj keâe Ketye OÙeeve-efÛevleve keâjes~ Jes ner legce ueesieeW keâes "erkeâ "erkeâ mecePee oWies~ Jes legce ueesieeW kesâ mece#e DeJeMÙe Øekeâš neWies, FmeceW efyevog cee$e Yeer mevosn veneR~ efJeÕeeme keâjes~ nce ueesie YeeJeceÙe "ekegâj keâes Yeuee efkeâlevee-mee mecePe mekesâ nQ! peje-mee Yeer veneR mecePe mekesâ nQ~’’ Flevee keânles keânles cenejepe keâe keâC" DeJe®æ nes ieÙee~ Gvekeâe Mejerj efvemhevo nes ieÙee, ves$e eEkeâefÛeled efveceerefuele nes ieÙes, DeeBKeeW kesâ keâesveeW hej oes-Skeâ yetBo Deßeg Peuekeâves ueies Deewj cegKeceC[ue GodYeeefmele nes G"e~ megjsvõ kegâceej ves peeBÛe keâjkesâ osKee, lees cenejepe keâe meeBme ®keâ Ûegkeâer Leer Deewj veeÌ[er keâe helee ve Lee~ eEkeâkeâle&JÙeefJecetÌ{ neskeâj ÙegJekeâieCe ÛegheÛeehe Øeleer#ee keâjves ueies~ kegâÚ keâeue yeerleves kesâ yeeo cenejepe ves DeOe&mHegâš mJej ceW ‘jeceke=â<Ce’ ‘jeceke=â<Ce’ GÛÛeejCe efkeâÙee~ Oeerjs Oeerjs Jes mJeeYeeefJekeâ DeJemLee ceW Dee ieÙes~ hejcenbmeosJe kesâ efMe<Ùe keâer YeeJemeceeefOe osKekeâj GheeqmLele ÙegJekeâeW ves mJeÙeb keâes OevÙe ceevee~

ÙegJekeâeW keâe OÙeeve Fme yeele keâer Deesj Yeer ieÙee efkeâ Fleves keâce&-keâesueenue kesâ yeerÛe Yeer cenejepe ves Deheves megyen-Meece meeOeve-Yepeve keâe DeYÙeeme veneR ÚesÌ[e Lee~ efkeâmeer efkeâmeer efove mebOÙee kesâ meceÙe meeOevee kesâ yeeo GvneWves Yepeve Yeer ieeÙes Les~

DeefÕeveer yeeyet kesâ cegKe mes mevee-"ekegâj keâer ØeMebmee megvekeâj cenejepe Skeâ efove GvnW osKeves ieÙes Les~ mevee-"ekegâj Gve efoveeW keâeueer-ceeqvoj kesâ yeenj keâoeefÛeled ner keâYeer yeenj efvekeâuee keâjles Les~ hejvleg cenejepe kesâ hengBÛeles ner GvneWves oewÌ[les ngS Deekeâj Gvekeâe DeeeEueieve efkeâÙee~ peieocyee keâes ØeCeece keâjves kesâ yeeo cenejepe Gvekesâ meeLe Jeelee&ueehe keâjves ueies Deewj ‘hejcenbmeosJe’ kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW Gvekeâer Glmegkeâlee osKekeâj cenejepe ves kegâÚ JeekeäÙeeW ceW ner GvnW "ekegâj keâer peerJevekeâLee yelee oer~

Dee"JeW efove DeLee&led 12 peveJejer keâes npeejeW Úe$eeW leLee veiej kesâ ieCÙeceevÙe ueesieeW ves mšercejIeeš hej ‘hejcenbmeosJe keâer peÙe’ keâer OJeefve kesâ meeLe mJeeceer meejoevevo keâes efJeoeF& oer~ Deieues efove cenejepe yesuetÌ[ ce" hengBÛes~ Gvekesâ cegKe mes veeie ceneMeÙe kesâ ceneØeÙeeCe keâe meceeÛeej megvekeâj mecemle ce"Jeemeer cecee&nle ngS~

Fme Øekeâej keâer JÙeeKÙeeve-Ùee$ee kesâ Deefleefjòeâ Yeer meejoevevo peer keâes efJeefYeVe mLeeveeW hej JÙeeKÙeeve osvee leLee keâ#eeSB uesveer heÌ[leer LeeR~ GveceW mes kegâÚ keâe ÙeneB GuuesKe efkeâÙee pee mekeâlee nw~ Decesefjkeâe mes ueewšves kesâ yeeo 18 ceeÛe& 1898 keâes GvneWves Scejeu[ efLeÙesšj ceW ‘Our Mission in America’ (Decesefjkeâe ceW nceeje keâeÙe&) efJe<eÙe hej Skeâ Deb«espeer Yee<eCe efoÙee~ mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo ves Fmekeâer DeOÙe#elee keâer Leer~ Gvekesâ DevegjesOe hej meYee ceW GheeqmLele peieoerMe Ûevõ yeesme, ceesefnveer ceesnve Ûewšpeea leLee Deevevo Ûeeuet& ves Yeer Deheves mebef#ehle JeòeâJÙe efoÙes Les~ 8 DeØewue keâes yeeueer kesâ efjheve ne@ue ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo ves Úe$eeW kesâ efueS ‘Vedanta as related to student's life' (Jesoevle keâe efJeÅeeLeea-peerJeve mes mecyevOe) efJe<eÙe hej Skeâ Yee<eCe efoÙee Lee~ keâuekeâòes kesâ Deueyeš& ne@ue ceW Yeer GvneWves keâF& JÙeeKÙeeve efoÙes Les~ JeneB 1898 F&. kesâ 1 Deiemle leLee 17 efmelecyej keâes nesvesJeeues Gvekesâ JÙeeKÙeeve kesâ efJe<eÙe ›eâceMe: ‘The Prospect of Religion inside and outside India’ (Yeejle leLee efJeosMeeW ceW Oece& keâe YeefJe<Ùe) leLee ‘Problem Universal’ (meeJe&Yeewefcekeâ mecemÙee) Les~ Deewj 27 efmelecyej 1899 keâes Gvekeâe ‘Ethics of Gita’ (ieerlee keâe veerefleMeeŒe) efJe<eÙe hej JÙeeKÙeeve ngDee~ yeuejece-YeJeve ceW nesvesJeeues jeceke=â<Ce efceMeve keâer meehleeefnkeâ DeefOeJesMeveeW ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ ner meJee&efOekeâ mebKÙee ceW JÙeeKÙeeve ngS Les~46 Fve mecemle JÙeeKÙeeveeW kesâ meejebMe GodyeesOeve heef$ekeâe ceW ØekeâeefMele ngS Les~ hetJeea yebieeue mes ueewšves kesâ yeeo 4 HeâjJejer (1900) keâes GvneWves oef#eCesÕej kesâ mketâue ceW Skeâ Yee<eCe efoÙee Lee~

mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo kesâ ceneØeÙeeCe kesâ yeeo osMeJeemeer Deewj efJeMes<ekeâj ÙegJeemeceepe mJeeceerpeer kesâ Dee£eve kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW meÛesleve nes Ûegkeâe Lee~ ÙegJeeJeie& kesâ DevegjesOe hej meejoevevo peer ves efJeefYeVe mLeeveeW hej JÙeeKÙeeve efoÙes~ 1902 F&. kesâ efomecyej leLee Gmekesâ yeeo keâer peveJejer ceW ‘efJeJeskeâevevo meefceefle’ kesâ Deeceb$eCe hej GvneWves JeneB ieerlee hej heeBÛe JÙeeKÙeeve efoÙes~ 21 efmelecyej 1902 keâes meeueefkeâÙee (neJeÌ[e) ceW GvneWves yeBieuee Yee<ee ceW Skeâ Øesjkeâ Yee<eCe efoÙee~ 1 peveJejer (1903) keâes yesuetÌ[ neF&mketâue ceW ngS Gvekesâ JÙeeKÙeeve keâe efJe<eÙe Lee – ‘jepeYeefòeâ leLee efMe#ekeâ-Úe$e’~ GodyeesOeve heef$ekeâe kesâ met$e47 mes %eele neslee nw efkeâ ‘mJeeceer meejoevevo Fme meceÙe keâuekeâòes ceW mehleen ceW leerve efove Úe$eeW kesâ efueS ‘YeieJeodieerlee’ hej JÙeeKÙeeve os jns nQ~ efJeJejCe – keâuekeâòee efJeJeskeâevevo meefceefle, DeefOeJesMeve keâe mLeeve

cesš^eshee@efuešve cesve efJeÅeeueÙe, meceÙe – MeefveJeej keâes DehejeÖ ceW 5 yepes; yeeieyeepeej efJeJeskeâevevo meefceefle, DeefOeJesMeve keâe mLeeve – 50 veb. yeesmeheeje uesve, yeeieyeepeej, meceÙe

cebieueJeej keâes mebOÙee kesâ 7 yepes; GodyeesOeve ceW henues efpeme ‘efJeJeskeâevevo mce=efle-ceeqvoj’ veecekeâ efJeÅeeueÙe kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW efueKee pee Ûegkeâe nw, Gmekesâ 27 Úe$eeW kesâ DeeJesove hej Gmeer ceeqvoj kesâ Úe$eeW keâer megefJeOee kesâ efueS Øeefle jefJeJeej keâes 4 yepes mJeeceer meejoevevo GvnW ieerlee

132 mJeeceer meejoevevo

heÌ{e jns nQ~’’ Fmekesâ Deefleefjòeâ GodyeesOeve keâer hegjeveer HeâeFueeW mes helee Ûeuelee nw efkeâ GvneWves yeeueer leLee keâesVeiej keâer nefjmeYeeDeeW ceW JÙeeKÙeeve efoÙes Les~ ce" keâer [eÙejer mes Ùen Yeer %eele neslee nw efkeâ kegâÚ keâeue lekeâ Jes keâuekeâòes kesâ SCšeueer ceW Øeefle MeefveJeej keâes leLee DevÙe$e Yeer efkeâmeer efkeâmeer ie=ner Yeòeâ kesâ Iej efveÙeefcele ¤he mes ieerlee hej keâ#eeSB ues jns Les~

14 ceeÛe& 1905 keâes ßeerjeceke=â<CeosJe kesâ pevceeslmeJe kesâ Gheue#Ùe ceW ‘ßeerjeceke=â<Ce keâe ceeveJe-YeeJe’48 Meer<e&keâ Skeâ ceewefuekeâ efJeÛeejesòespekeâ ØeyevOe keâe hee" keâjkesâ GvneWves mevemeveer Hewâuee oer Leer~

1926 F&. ceW DeeÙeesefpele nesvesJeeues ce" leLee efceMeve kesâ ØeLece cenemeccesueve ceW mJeeiele-meefceefle kesâ DeOÙe#e kesâ ¤he ceW Øeoòe Gvekeâe Yee<eCe mebIe kesâ YeeJeer Ûeueve-heLe kesâ efoMee-efveoxMe kesâ ¤he ceW Deepe Yeer meceeÂle nw~ 3 DeØewue keâes DehejeÖ ceW Øeoòe cenejepe keâe ‘Ideas, Ideals and Activities of the Ramakrishna Mission’ (jeceke=â<Ce efceMeve kesâ YeeJeeoMe& leLee ef›eâÙee-keâueehe) Meer<e&keâ DeefYeYee<eCe meyekesâ efueS DelÙevle ØesjCeeoeÙekeâ leLee efØeÙe efmeæ ngDee Lee~

JÙeeKÙeeve, keâ#eeSB leLee ØeMveesòej keâer yew"keâeW kesâ Deefleefjòeâ, Gvekesâ Éeje jefÛele meeefnlÙe Yeer jeceke=â<Ce-YeeJeOeeje kesâ ØeÛeej-#es$e ceW Skeâ MeefòeâMeeueer Gheeoeve kesâ ¤he ceW meyekesâ Éeje meceeÂle ngDee nw, efpeme hej nce Skeâ Deueie ner DeOÙeeÙe ceW ÛeÛee& keâjWies~ FmeceW keâesF& mevosn veneR efkeâ Fvekeâer ØesjCeeMeefòeâ YeefJe<Ùe ceW Yeer ÙeLeeJeled yeveer jnsieer~ Fmekesâ Deefleefjòeâ Yeefieveer efveJesefolee Deeefo ØeefleYeeMeeueer JÙeefòeâÙeeW kesâ ceeOÙece mes YeeJeOeeje-ØeÛeej kesâ efueS Gvekeâe ØeÙeeme Yeer efJeMes<e ¤he mes mcejCeerÙe nw~49

48. yewkegâC"veeLe meevÙeeue Éeje efueefKele ‘ßeerjeceke=â<Ce-efJe<eÙekeâ cesjs DevegYeJe’, ßeer ‘ce’ efueefKele ‘ßeerjeceke=â<Ce Deewj heeqC[le F&ÕejÛevõ efJeÅeemeeiej’ leLee efiejerMeÛevõ Iees<e Éeje efueefKele ‘ßeerjeceke=â<Ce keâe efMe<Ùe-Øesce’ Meer<e&keâ efveyevOeeW kesâ hee" Deewj jeceueeue oòe Éeje Yepeve ieeÙes peeves kesâ yeeo meYeeheefle mJeeceer meejoevevo ves ‘ßeerjeceke=â<Ce keâer peerJeveÛeÛee&’ hej Skeâ ØeyevOe keâe hee" efkeâÙee~ (GodyeesOeve, Je<e& 7, mebKÙee 5, he=. 160)

49. efveJesefolee Éeje efueefKele ‘The Master as I saw Him’ «evLe keâer Yetefcekeâe ceW GvneWves efueKee Lee, ‘‘In Sending out into the world this book – the tribute of her love and gratitude

to her Guru – Nivedita has the blessings and good wishes of all his brothers.’’ (Belur Math, February 1st, 1910.)

Ghejesòeâ ÛeÛee& mes Ùen yeele mhe° nes G"leer nw efkeâ mJeeceer meejoevevo jeceke=â<Ce mebIe kesâ Skeâ meceLe& ØeÛeejkeâ Les~ legueveelcekeâ Âef° mes efJeÛeej keâjkesâ Ùen keâne pee mekeâlee nw efkeâ mebIe kesâ Fefleneme ceW efveŠmevosn Jes Fmekesâ ßes‰ ØeÛeejkeâeW ceW mes Skeâ Les~ hee§eelÙe osMeeW mes mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo kesâ henueer yeej ueewšves hej Skeâ efove mJeeceer Øesceevevo ves Gvemes hetÚe Lee, ‘‘kewâmes Skeâ DeÛÚe ØeÛeejkeâ ngDee pee mekeâlee nw?’’ mJeeceerpeer Éeje Øeoòe Gòej keâe mJeeceer Øesceevevo ves Deheves Skeâ he$e ceW GuuesKe keâjles ngS efueKee Lee, ‘‘mJeeceerpeer ves Dehevee neLe efmej mes ueskeâj eEueie lekeâ ueeles ngS keâne – ‘ÙeneB lekeâ pe¤jle nw’~ DeLee&led meJe&ØeLece lees Ketye cesOeeJeer nesvee ÛeeefnS~ Fmekesâ yeeo Ûesnjs hej neLe jKekeâj yeesues, ‘ßeer ÛeeefnS – DevÙeLee veneR nesiee~’ efHeâj nes"eW hej neLe jKekeâj yeesues, ‘ceOegjYee<eer nesves keâer DeeJeMÙekeâlee nw’~ Fmekesâ yeeo meerves hej neLe jKekeâj yeesues, ‘ùoÙe ÛeeefnS, ùoÙe! ùoÙe efJeMeeue leLee Goej ve nesves hej legcnW keâesF& veneR megvesiee~ cesjs ceeqmle<keâ kesâ Éeje efpelevee ngDee nw, ùoÙe kesâ Éeje Gmemes keâneR DeefOekeâ ngDee nw~ "ekegâj keâe Yeer Ssmee ner Lee~ Deewj ÛeeefnS mebÙece, Ùener ØeÛeejkeâ keâe ØeOeeve mecyeue nesvee ÛeeefnS’~’’50 mJeeceerpeer kesâ ceeheoC[ mes Yeer mJeeceer meejoevevo jeceke=â<Ce-YeeJeOeeje kesâ Skeâ Meer<e&mLeeveerÙe ØeÛeejkeâ efmeæ nesles nQ~

Thej Ûee|Ûele efJe<eÙeeW kesâ Deefleefjòeâ Skeâ DevÙe efJe<eÙe Yeer ÙeneB efJeMes<e ¤he mes efJeÛeejCeerÙe nw~ mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo kesâ celeevegmeej ßeerjeceke=â<Ce-YeeJeeoMe& ceW ieef"le peerJeve ner ßeerjeceke=â<CeJesoevle-ØeÛeej keâe meJee&efOekeâ GheÙeesieer ceeOÙece nw~ Fme Âef° mes efJeÛeej keâjves hej nce osKeles nQ efkeâ mJeeceer meejoevevo keâe Ûeefj$e jeceke=â<Ce-meeBÛes ceW "erkeâ "erkeâ {uee Lee Deewj Jes ßeerjeceke=â<Ce-Jesoevle-ØeÛeej kesâ Skeâ mepeerJe efJe«en nes G"s Les~ Gvekesâ meejs keâce&, Jeelee&ueehe Deeefo kesâ yeerÛe Gvekeâe ‘keâÛÛee ceQ’ ueieYeie efJeueghle-mee nes ieÙee Lee~ Gvekeâer efoveÛeÙee& henues Ûee|Ûele leerveeW JÙeefòeâlJeeW keâer ceefncee keâes ner metefÛele keâjleer Leer~ Gvekesâ DeelcelÙeeieÙegòeâ YeeJeØeÛeej keâe mcejCe keâje oslee nw jJeervõveeLe keâer Skeâ keâefJelee keâe efvecveefueefKele DebMe –

Hegâuue Meleoue : mebIe¤heer ßeerjeceke=â<Ce kesâ ‘YeejJeenkeâ’ (ØeLece heJe&)

veslee mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo kesâ DeeosMe keâes efMejesOeeÙe& keâjkesâ mJeeceer meejoevevo Deheveer oesueeÙeceeve DeeMebkeâe-¤heer IeCšs keâes Úeleer mes yeeBOekeâj hee§eelÙe osMeeW ceW ØeÛeejkeâeÙe& ceW Glejs Les~ efHeâj, meHeâuelee kesâ heg<heekeâerCe& heLe hej LeesÌ[er otj De«emej nessles ner, veslee kesâ veÙes DeeosMeevegmeej Jes mJeosMe ueewš DeeÙes Les~ Deeles ner GvnW veslee keâe Deieuee DeeosMe efceuee – Deye GvnW mebIe¤heer ßeerjeceke=â<Ce1 keâer mesJee keâjveer nesieer; mJeeceerpeer kesâ vesle=lJe ceW ßeerjeceke=â<Ce kesâ efJeÕeheeJeve YeeJeeoMe& keâes meebie"efvekeâ ¤he osvee nesiee2 Deewj Fme GösMÙe mes GvnW ‘ceveg<Ùe-ieÌ{ves’ keâe GòejoeefÙelJe Deheves keâvOeeW hej G"evee nesiee~

Fme yeerÛe mJeeceer meejoevevo keâer DevegheeqmLeefle kesâ oewjeve Fme osMe ceW keâF& cenòJehetCe& IešveeSB nes Ûegkeâer LeeR~ ØeLecele: lees peye mJeosMe ueewšs mJeeceerpeer keâes ueskeâj meeje osMe celeJeeuee nes G"e Lee, leye yebieeue kesâ keâójhevLeer efnvotieCe, yebieJeemeer heef$ekeâe, oef#eCesÕej-ceeqvoj kesâ Skeâ š^mšer $ewueeskeäÙeveeLe efJeÕeeme leLee kegâÚ mJeeLeea ueesie ‘mJesÛÚeÛeejer’ efJeJeskeâevevo kesâ efJe®æ DeeJeepe G"e jns Les~ oef#eCesÕej kesâ keâeueer-ceeqvoj ceW mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo keâe ØeJesMe efveef<eæ nes Ûegkeâe Lee Deewj otmeje keâesF& GheeÙe ve osKe mJeeceer Ùeesieevevo, mJeeceer ef$eiegCeeleerleevevo Deeefo mebvÙeeefmeÙeeW ves ßeerjeceke=â<Ce keâe Deieuee pevceeslmeJe iebiee kesâ heef§eceer leš hej oeB-ueesieeW keâer "ekegâjyeeÌ[er ceW DeeÙeesefpele keâjves keâer JÙeJemLee keâer Leer~ efÉleerÙelele:, jeceke=â<Ce mebIe kesâ efueS DeefveJeeÙe& keâle&JÙe kesâ ¤he ceW mJeeceerpeer ves ßeerjeceke=â<Ce Éeje ØeÛeeefjle leLee mJeÙeb DeeÛeefjle ‘efMeJe%eeve mes peerJemesJee’ keâe ›ele DeejcYe efkeâÙee Lee~ ßeerjeceke=â<Ce-peerJeve ceW mJeerke=âle Fme ceneved YeeJeeoMe& keâes JÙeeJeneefjkeâ ¤he osves kesâ efueS mJeeceerpeer ves ‘jeceke=â<Ce efceMeve meefceefle’ keâer mLeehevee keâer Leer~ hejvleg ßeerjeceke=â<Ce keâe DevegmejCe keâjles ngS ner mJeeceerpeer ves Fme

1. jesceeB jesueeB ves efueKee nw efkeâ ßeerjeceke=â<Ce kesâ efMe<ÙeeW keâes Skeâ$e keâjves hej nceW mechetCe&-jeceke=â<Ce efceue peeles nQ~ mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo kesâ jeceke=â<Ce-mebIe ¤heer YeeJe ceW ceevees Ùener efJeÛeej ÙelvehetJe&keâ «enCe efkeâÙee ieÙee Lee~ Gvekeâer Âef° ceW jeceke=â<Ce mebIe ßeerjeceke=â<Ce kesâ mLetue Mejerj mes efYeVe veneR Lee~ Gvekeâe efJeÕeeme Lee efkeâ peye lekeâ mebIe Ûeuesiee, leye lekeâ ßeerjeceke=â<Ce Fmeer ceW efJeÅeceeve jnWies; Deewj ‘mebIe ner Gvekeâe meceef° Mejerj nw’~

2. kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ ves Deheves 23/9/1897 kesâ he$e ceW efueKee Lee, ‘‘Swami Saradananda thinks of going in November to help the Prophet organize his work..’’

heefjkeâuhevee keâe ØeJele&ve efkeâÙee nw – Fmekeâer OeejCee keâjves ceW Deveskeâ ueesieeW keâes keâef"veeF& nes jner Leer~ Ghejesòeâ meefceefle keâer mLeehevee kesâ yeeo mJeeceer Ùeesieevevo leLee DevÙe kegâÚ ieg®YeeF& Deewj ßeer ‘ce’ Deeefo kegâÚ ie=ner YeòeâeW kesâ yeerÛe Fmekesâ ØeefleJeeo keâer YegveYegveenš Yeer megveeF& oer Leer~ le=leerÙele:, Fmeer yeerÛe 13 HeâjJejer keâes ce" Deeueceyeepeej mes mLeeveevleefjle neskeâj yesuetÌ[ «eece ceW veerueecyej cegkeâpeea kesâ GÅeeve-YeJeve ceW Dee ieÙee Lee~ "ekegâj-mJeeceerpeer kesâ YeeJeeoMe& mes DevegØeeefCele kegâÚ veÙes ÙegJekeâeW ves Yeer mebIe ceW ØeJesMe efueÙee Lee~ veJeerve keâeÙe&metÛeer kesâ ef›eâÙeevJeve kesâ ØeÙeeme mes ce"-peerJeve mheeqvole nes G"e Lee~ ÛelegLe&le:, ce" kesâ veerueecyej yeeyet kesâ GÅeeve ceW mLeeveevleefjle nesves kesâ meeLe-ner-meeLe Gmekesâ meceerhe ner iebieeleš hej mLeeÙeer ¤he mes ce" keâer mLeehevee kesâ efueS peceerve Kejeroves keâer JÙeJemLee ngF& Leer~ veÙeer Yetefce ceW ce"-YeJeve, ßeerjeceke=â<Ce-ceeqvoj Deeefo kesâ efvecee&Ce keâer Ùeespevee Deewj meeLe ner Gmekesâ ¤heeÙeve keâer keâuhevee mes ce"Jeemeer Gòesefpele, GefÉie> leLee GlHegâuue efoKeeF& os jns Les~ hebÛecele:, Fmekesâ hetJe& mJeeceer jeceke=â<Ceevevo ves ceõeme peekeâj JeneB Skeâ ce" keâer mLeehevee keâjves keâe GòejoeefÙelJe efueÙee Lee Deewj mJeeceer DeKeC[evevo ves Dekeâeue-heerefÌ[leeW keâer mesJee keâe keâeÙe& meceehle keâjves kesâ yeeo cege|Meoeyeeo kesâ cenguee «eece ceW Skeâ DeveeLeeßece DeejcYe efkeâÙee Lee~

mJeeceer meejoevevo ves osKee efkeâ mJeeceerpeer Deheves Ùegieevlejkeâejer ÙeespeveeDeeW keâes keâeÙe& ¤he ceW heefjCele keâjves keâes JÙe«e nQ~ FOej mJeeceerpeer keâe Yeie> mJeemLÙe, ce" Ûeueeves kesâ efueS Oeve Deewj ÙeesiÙe keâe|ceÙeeW keâe DeYeeJe mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo Deeefo vesleeDeeW keâer GefÉie>lee keâe keâejCe nes jne Lee~ Fmeer yeerÛe 22 HeâjJejer keâes ce" ceW OetceOeece kesâ meeLe "ekegâj keâer pevceefleefLehetpee DeeÙeesefpele ngF&~ Gmeer efove ØeLece Yeesie-Deejleer kesâ meceÙe mJeeceerpeer Éeje jefÛele Deejef$ekeâ-Yepeve henueer yeej ieeÙee ieÙee~3 hejJeleea jefJeJeej, 27 HeâjJejer keâes oeB-ueesieeW keâer "ekegâjyeeÌ[er kesâ ØeebieCe ceW yeÌ[s meceejesnhetJe&keâ "ekegâj keâe meeJe&peefvekeâ ceneslmeJe DeeÙeesefpele ngDee~ Gmeer efove mJeeceerpeer ves ‘ßeerpeer’ veece mes heefjefÛele ßeerjeceke=â<Ce kesâ hetleeeqmLe keâe keâueMe Deheves keâvOes hej jKekeâj ce" kesâ efueÙes neue ner ceW Kejeroer ieÙeer Yetefce hej mLeeefhele4 keâjkesâ hetpee leLee nesce efkeâÙee~ hetpee kesâ yeeo mJeeceerpeer ves GheeqmLele meYeer ueesieeW keâes mecyeesefOele keâjles ngS keâne, ‘‘Deehe ueesie Deepe keâeÙe-ceve-JeeCeer mes "ekegâj kesâ ÛejCeeW ceW ØeeLe&vee keâjW efkeâ ÙegieeJeleej ßeerjeceke=â<Ce Deepe mes uecyes keâeue lekeâ ‘yengpeveefnleeÙe yengpevemegKeeÙe’ Fme hegCÙe#es$e ceW efJejepeceeve jnkeâj Fmes meJe&OeceeX keâe Skeâ DehetJe& mecevJeÙe-kesâvõ yeveeÙes jnW~’’

  1. mJeeceer Øesceevevo kesâ 6 ceeÛe& 1898 keâes efueefKele he$e keâe DebMe – ‘‘Gme efove meew mes Yeer DeefOekeâ ueesieeW ves Øemeeo heeÙee Lee~ vejsvõveeLe ves Skeâ megvoj Deejleer-Yepeve keâer jÛevee keâer nw – ‘KeC[ve-YeJeyevOeve’ ... Deeefo~ cemlekeâ hej peše, keâeveeW ceW kegâC[ue leLee Mejerj hej efJeYetefle OeejCe keâjkesâ vejsvõ DehetJe& ¤he mes MeesYeeÙeceeve nes jne Lee~ nce ueesieeW ceW mes Yeer Deveskeâ ueesie Gmeer Øekeâej mepes Les~’’
  2. õ°JÙe – uesKekeâ keâe ‘yeÇÿeevevo-Ûeefjle’ (yeBieuee «ebLe), ØeLece meb., he==. 156-57

136 mJeeceer meejoevevo

veÙeer Yetefce kesâ Gòejer Yeeie ceW iebieeleš hej keâF& keâcejeW mes Ùegòeâ Skeâ Skeâcebpeuee cekeâeve Lee~ mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ meeLe DeeÙeeR ßeerceleer yegue leLee kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ Gmeer cekeâeve keâes meeqppele keâjkesâ GmeceW efveJeeme keâjves ueieeR~ kegâÚ efoveeW yeeo FbiuewC[ mes kegâceejer veesyeue (yeeo ceW Yeefieveer efveJesefolee) Yeer Deekeâj GvneR ceW meeqcceefuele nes ieÙeeR~ mJeeceerpeer Deheves Yeie> mJeemLÙe ceW megOeej nsleg 30 ceeÛe& keâes oee|peeEueie Ûeues ieÙes~ Fmekesâ hetJe& Jes Øeefleefove JeneB peekeâj Ghejesòeâ leerve efJeosMeer YeefòeâveeW keâer Keespe-Keyej efueÙee keâjles Les~ Gvekesâ Ûeues peeves kesâ yeeo Fmekeâe GòejoeefÙelJe mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ Thej Dee heÌ[e~

ce" keâer osKeYeeue leLee Gmekeâe efnmeeye-efkeâleeye jKevee, veÙeer peceerve keâes meceleue keâjevee, YeJeve kesâ hetJe& keâer Deesj iebiee kesâ efkeâveejs lešyevOe keâe efvecee&Ce Deeefo yeÇÿeevevo peer kesâ GòejoeefÙelJe Les~ Fmekesâ Deefleefjòeâ Yeer cekeâeve leLee Yetefce mes mecyeeqvOele ceeceueeW ceW GvnW JÙemle jnvee heÌ[lee Lee~ FOej Øesceevevo peer ves 4 DeØewue (1898) keâes kesâoejveeLe keâer Deesj ØemLeeve efkeâÙee~ kegâÚ leerLeeX keâe oMe&ve keâjves kesâ yeeo GvneWves kegâÚ efove Je=voeJeve ceW efveJeeme efkeâÙee Deewj 10 efomecyej (1898) keâes Jes ce" ueewšs~ mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ Thej ce"-mebÛeeueve leLee DevÙe efJeefYeVe keâeÙeeX keâe, efJeMes<ekeâj veJeeiele meeOeg-yeÇÿeÛeeefjÙeeW keâer osKejsKe keâe GòejoeefÙelJe meeQhee ieÙee Lee~ ›eâceMe: Gvekesâ keâeÙeeX keâer heefjefOe ceW efJemleej neslee jne~5 Fve mecemle IešveeDeeW kesâ ØeejeqcYekeâ oewj ceW kegâ. cewkeäueeG[ Deeefo efJeosMeer Yeòeâ-ceefnueeDeeW ves osKee efkeâ mJeeceerpeer DeefOekeâebMele: mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ Thej ner efveYe&j keâjles nQ~ FmeerefueS Jes Deehemeer Jeelee&ueehe leLee he$e-JÙeJenej ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo keâe oes vecyej kesâ mebvÙeemeer (Swami II) kesâ ¤he ceW GuuesKe efkeâÙee keâjleer LeeR~

jepeOeeveer keâuekeâòes hej menmee Skeâ efJeYeeref<ekeâe Glej DeeÙeer~ huesie kesâ DeeefJeYee&Je mes oue-kesâ-oue vej-veejer leLee yeÛÛes veiej ÚesÌ[keâj heueeÙeve keâjves ueies~ mJeeceerpeer Gme meceÙe oee|peeEueie ceW Les~ 29 DeØewue (1898) keâes GvneWves kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ keâes Skeâ he$e ceW efueKee, ‘‘ceQves efpeme Menj ceW pevce efueÙee nw, JeneB hej Ùeefo huesie keâe ØeeogYee&Je nes, lees Gmekesâ Øeeflekeâej kesâ efueS ceQves Deelceeslmeie& keâjvee efveef§ele keâj efueÙee nw~’’ keâuekeâòes ceW huesie kesâ Deeieceve keâe meceeÛeej heeles ner Jes lelkeâeue JeneB Dee hengBÛes~ yeBieuee leLee efnvoer ceW Skeâ metÛevee-he$e keâes cegefõle keâjekeâj Gmekeâe Deelebefkeâle veiejJeeefmeÙeeW kesâ yeerÛe efJeleefjle efkeâÙee ieÙee~ efceMeve kesâ keâceeaieCe yeeqmleÙeeW keâer meHeâeF& kesâ keâeÙe& ceW pegš ieÙes~ meeOegDeeW kesâ Fme mesJeekeâeÙe& ves veiejJeeefmeÙeeW kesâ yeerÛe Skeâ nueÛeue hewoe keâj oer~ meewYeeiÙe keâer yeele Ùen nw efkeâ huesie kesâ ceneceejer keâe ¤he OeejCe keâjves kesâ hetJe& ner, LeesÌ[s ØeÙeeme mes ner eqmLeefle efveÙeb$eCe ceW Dee ieÙeer~ mJeeceerpeer ves efveef§evlelee keâer meeBme ueer~

5. mJeeceerpeer kesâ 25 HeâjJejer 1898 kesâ Skeâ he$e keâe DebMe — ‘‘Mejled ... Deheveer Deeole kesâ Deveg¤he keâ"esj heefjßece keâj jne nw~’’

ieg®YeeF& legjerÙeevevo, efMe<Ùe meoevevo leLee mJe¤heevevo Deewj ßeerceleer yegue, kegâ. cewkeäueeG[, Yeefieveer efveJesefolee leLee ßeerceleer hewšme&ve Deeefo efJeosMeer Yeòeâ ceefnueeDeeW keâes meeLe ueskeâj 12 ceF& keâes mJeeceerpeer keâuekeâòes mes efnceeueÙe keâer Deesj jJeevee ngS~ DeuceesÌ[e ceW kegâÚ efove "njves kesâ yeeo mJeeceerpeer Deheveer šesueer kesâ meeLe YetmJeie& keâeMceerj ieÙes~ FOej mJeeceer meejoevevo ce" kesâ meeOeg-yeÇÿeÛeeefjÙeeW kesâ ØeefMe#eCe kesâ Deefleefjòeâ Yeer keâuekeâòes ceW jeceke=â<Ce efceMeve kesâ meehleeefnkeâ DeefOeJesMeve leLee DevÙe$e Yeer JÙeeKÙeeve Deeefo ceW JÙemle jns~ leYeer ßeerveiej mes leej DeeÙee efkeâ mJeeceerpeer DelÙevle yeerceej nQ~ 27 efmelecyej keâes meejoevevo peer ves keâeMceerj kesâ efueS ØemLeeve efkeâÙee~ JeneB efÛeefkeâlmee leLee mesJee-Megßet<ee kesâ HeâuemJe¤he mJeeceerpeer kesâ mJeemLÙe ceW kegâÚ megOeej ngDee~ mJeeceer meoevevo GvnW meeLe ueskeâj 18 Deòetâyej keâes yesuetÌ[ ce" ueewš DeeÙes~ Deewj meejoevevo peer efJeosMeer DeefleefLeÙeeW keâes meeLe ueskeâj efouueer, Deeieje, kegâ¤#es$e leLee JeejeCemeer keâe YeüceCe keâjves ieÙes~ Ùes ueesie 6 veJecyej keâes Jeeheme keâuekeâòee ueewšs~

ce"-YeJeve keâe efvecee&Ce nesles ner ßeerceeB Deheves efvelÙehetefpele "ekegâj keâe efÛe$e ueskeâj veerueecyej yeeyet kesâ GÅeeve-YeJeve ceW Deekeâj "njeR~ GvneWves Deheves neLe mes veÙes ce"YeJeve ceW ßeerjeceke=â<Ce keâer hetpee keâer~ 12 veJecyej keâes Ùen mcejCeerÙe Iešvee ngF& Leer~ Deieues efove (keâeueerhetpee kesâ efove) ßeerceeB ves 16 veb. yeesmeheeÌ[e uesve ceW eqmLele efveJesefolee kesâ DeeJeeme hej "ekegâj keâer hetpee keâjkesâ Gvekeâer veejer-efMe#ee keâer Ùeespevee keâe ßeerieCesMe efkeâÙee~ Fme Øekeâej Meefòeâ¤efheCeer ßeerceeB keâe DeeMeerJee&o ueskeâj ‘efveJesefolee yeeefuekeâe efJeÅeeueÙe’ keâer Meg®Deele ngF&~

Fme yeerÛe ce" keâer TyeÌ[-KeeyeÌ[ peceerve keâe keâeHeâer DebMe meceleue efkeâÙee pee Ûegkeâe Lee~ veerÛes jmeesF&Iej leLee Thejer cebefpeue hej ceeqvoj keâe keâeÙe& meceeeqhle hej Lee~ 9 efomecyej keâes ‘Deelceejece keâe keâueMe’ leLee efvelÙe hetefpele nesvesJeeuee "ekegâj keâe efÛe$e veÙes ceeqvoj ceW ueeÙee ieÙee~ efJeMes<e hetpee Deeefo Deveg‰eve kesâ ceeOÙece mes Fme veÙes ce" keâe Glmeie& efkeâÙee ieÙee~6 Fmekesâ yeeo ner mJeeceerpeer leLee yeÇÿeevevo peer ves veÙes ce"-YeJeve ceW kegâÚ efove efveJeeme efkeâÙee~

efÛeefkeâlmekeâeW keâer meueen hej peueJeeÙeg-heefjJele&ve kesâ nsleg 19 efomecyej keâes mJeeceerpeer osJeIej kesâ efueS jJeevee ngS~ JeneB GvneWves efØeÙeveeLe cegkeâpeea keâe DeeefleLÙe mJeerkeâej efkeâÙee~ FOej ce" keâer oes MegYeekeâebef#eefCeÙeeB ßeerceleer yegue leLee kegâ. cewkeäueeG[ mJeosMe ueewšves keâes Øemlegle ngFË~ 30 efomecyej (1899) keâer Meece keâes Skeâ Úesšs mes DeveewheÛeeefjkeâ meYee keâe DeeÙeespeve keâjkesâ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves GvnW efJeoeF& oer~ efJeefMe° DeefleefLeÙeeW ceW Yeefieveer efveJesefolee leLee ceesefnveer ceesnve Ûešpeea Yeer Fme DeJemej hej GheeqmLele Les~ oesveeW Decesefjkeâer ceefnueeDeeW ves ceeqvoj

6. ce" keâer [eÙejer ceW efueKee nw : Thakur was taken to the New Math and the new Math was consecrated.

138 mJeeceer meejoevevo

ceW peekeâj ØeCeece keâjves kesâ yeeo ce" mes ØemLeeve efkeâÙee~

meceeÛeej DeeÙee efkeâ mJeeceerpeer osJeIej ceW DelÙevle yeerceej nQ~ mJeeceer meoevevo keâes meeLe ueskeâj 16 peveJejer (1899) keâes meejoevevo peer osJeIej kesâ efueS jJeevee ngS~ Jes ueesie mJeeceerpeer keâes meeLe efueS 22 peveJejer keâes ce" ueewš DeeÙes~ Fmeer yeerÛe 2 peveJejer keâes ce" veerueecyej yeeyet kesâ GÅeeve mes mLeeveevleefjle neskeâj veJeefvee|cele Deheves mJeÙeb kesâ YeJeve ceW Dee Ûegkeâe Lee~ 14 peveJejer keâes yeBieuee heeef#ekeâ7 ‘GodyeesOeve’ keâe ØekeâeMeve Yeer Fme keâeue keâer Skeâ DevÙe GuuesKeveerÙe Iešvee nw~

veJeefvee|cele ceeqvoj ceW 13 ceeÛe&, meesceJeej keâes henueer yeej ßeerjeceke=â<Ce keâer pevceefleefLe keâe Deveg‰eve ngDee~ Fme Gheue#Ùe ceW efnvot Oece& kesâ mecemle osJeer-osJeleeDeeW, DeJeleejeW leLee Oecee&ÛeeÙeeX keâer hetpee ngF& Deewj YeòeâeW ves ‘meYeer Oece& melÙe nQ’ – "ekegâj kesâ Fme meeJe&Yeewefcekeâ YeeJe keâe mcejCe efkeâÙee~ Deeieeceer jefJeJeej, 19 ceeÛe& keâes ce" keâer Deheveer Yetefce hej "ekegâj kesâ henues meeJe&peefvekeâ ceneslmeJe mes ce"-ØeebieCe Deevevo ceW lejbieeefÙele nesves ueiee~ mJeeceerpeer keâer GheeqmLeefle ceW Yeefieveer efveJesefolee keâe JÙeeKÙeeve meebOÙe-meYee keâe efJeMes<e Deekeâ<e&Ce Lee~8 Deewj "ekegâj keâer pevceefleefLe kesâ efove DeuceesÌ[e efpeues kesâ hetJeea DebÛeue ceW 6,500 Hegâš TBÛes heneÌ[ kesâ Thej ceeÙeeJeleer ceW ‘DeÉwle Deeßece’ keâer mLeehevee ngF& Deewj Deb«espeer ceeefmekeâ heef$ekeâe ‘Øeyegæ Yeejle’ keâe ØekeâeMekeâerÙe keâeÙee&ueÙe DeuceesÌ[e mes G"keâj JeneR Ûeuee DeeÙee~

osJeIej mes ueewškeâj mJeeceerpeer ves Skeâ yeej efHeâj hetjs osMe ceW nueÛeue ceÛeeves keâer Skeâ Ùeespevee yeveeÙeer~9 Gve efoveeW ceW Oeve keâe keâeHeâer DeYeeJe Lee~ ce" kesâ efueS DeLe&meb«en leLee Jesoevle-ØeÛeej nsleg 7 HeâjJejer keâes mJeeceer meejoevevo leLee mJeeceer legjerÙeevevo ves jepemLeeve keâer Deesj ØemLeeve efkeâÙee~ Fme Ùee$ee kesâ oewjeve mJeeceer meejoevevo ves Jele&ceeve jepemLeeve, iegpejele leLee keâeef"ÙeeJeeÌ[ kesâ efJeefYeVe veiejeW ceW JÙeeKÙeeve efoÙes~ DeefOekeâebMe JÙeeKÙeeve efnvoer ceW ner ngS Les~ kegâue 1500 ®heÙeeW keâer jeefMe Skeâ$e ngF&~ ce" kesâ «evLeeueÙe kesâ efueS 150 ®heÙeeW keâer hegmlekeWâ Yeer Øeehle ngFË~ Gmeer meceÙe mJeeceerpeer keâe leej heekeâj oesveeW mebvÙeemeer 3 ceF& (1899) keâes ce" ueewš DeeÙes~ FOej mJeeceerpeer ves ØeÛeej kesâ efveefceòe mJeeceer efJejpeevevo leLee mJeeceer ØekeâeMeevevo keâes {ekeâe Yespee~

  1. ome Je<e& yeeo Ùen heef$ekeâe ceeefmekeâ ceW heefjCele ngF&~
  2. GodyeesOeve, Je<e& 1, mebKÙee 6, he=. 289 ceW Úheer metÛevee kesâ Devegmeej mJeeceerpeer keâer GheeqmLeefle ceW ner mJeeceer DeYeÙeevevo leLee heeBÛekeâewÌ[er yevÅeesheeOÙeeÙe ves JÙeeKÙeeve efoÙes Les~
  3. mJeeceerpeer ves 2 HeâjJejer 1899 kesâ efove kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ keâes efueKee, ‘‘JewÅeveeLe kesâ JeeÙeg-heefjJele&ve mes keâesF& ueeYe veneR ngDee~ ... cegPes ce=leØeeÙe DeJemLee ceW ner keâuekeâòes ueeÙee ieÙee~ [e@. mejkeâej cesjer efÛeefkeâlmee keâj jns nQ~ ... ceQ efHeâj mes keâece ceW pegš ieÙee ntB~ neueeBefkeâ mJeÙeb kegâÚ veneR keâjlee~ meejs Yeejle ceW Skeâ nueÛeue ceÛeeves kesâ efueS ueÌ[keâeW keâes Yespe jne ntB~’’

Fmeer yeerÛe Skeâ yeÌ[er ogKeo Iešvee nes ieÙeer~ 28 ceeÛe& keâes mJeeceer Ùeesieevevo10 ves cenemeceeefOe ueer~ cecee&nle neskeâj ßeerceeB DeeBmet yeneleer jneR~ Fme Meeskeâ mes Gyejves ceW ceeB keâes Deveskeâ efove ueies Les~

1899 F&. ceW keâuekeâòes ceW Øeyeue ¤he mes huesie kesâ DeeefJeYee&Je mes meYeer ueesie Deelebefkeâle nes ieÙes Les~ 31 ceeÛe& (1899) keâes ieg[-øeâeF[s kesâ efove efceMeve keâe mesJeekeâeÙe& DeejcYe ngDee~ yeeqmleÙeeW keâer meHeâeF& leLee jesefieÙeeW keâer mesJee kesâ efueS Skeâ keâcesšer keâe ie"ve ngDee~ Yeefieveer efveJesefolee Gmekeâer meefÛeJe leLee mJeeceer meoevevo Gmekesâ ØeOeeve keâeÙee&OÙe#e ngS~ 22 DeØewue keâes mJeeceerpeer keâer DeOÙe#elee ceW Skeâ meYee yegueeF& ieÙeer~ efveJesefolee ves ÙegJekeâeW keâe memvesn Dee£eve efkeâÙee~ kegâÚ ÙegJekeâeW ves mJeÙebmesJekeâ kesâ ¤he ceW Ùeesieoeve efkeâÙee~ jeceke=â<Ce efceMeve keâe Ùen mesJeekeâeÙe& osMe keâer efJeefYeVe he$e-heef$ekeâeDeeW ceW Ûee|Ûele neslee jne~ Gme meceÙe mJeeceer meejoevevo iegpejele ceW ØeÛeej-keâeÙe& ceW ueies Les~11

1900 F&. ceW huesie kesâ Øeyeue Dee›eâceCe mes keâuekeâòeeJeemeer hegve: Deeheoe«emle ngS Les~ mebkeâš ceW heÌ[s ueesieeW keâer meneÙelee keâjves kesâ efueS jeceke=â<Ce efceMeve kesâ mesJekeâeW ves Deheves ØeeCeeW keâes oeBJe hej ueieekeâj mJeeceer meoevevo kesâ vesle=lJe ceW mesJeekeâeÙe& keâe mebÛeeueve efkeâÙee Lee~ 5 DeØewue keâes mJeeceer meejoevevo ves ßeerceleer yegue keâes efueKee, ‘‘The plague is making a great havoc here, but the authorities have been more considerate in their dealings. Our sanitation work has been started from April 1st. We had a sad loss in the death of a dear friend. He was a disciple of Swami Brahmananda, and was loved by all for his sweet nature. His name is S. C. Sircar.’’

Fvekeâe hetje veece MejÛÛevõ mejkeâej Lee~ Ùes ‘jeceke=â<Ce ØeÛeej meefceefle’ kesâ oes menmeefÛeJeeW ceW mes Skeâ leLee efveJesefolee keâes yeBieuee Yee<ee heÌ{eles Les~ mJeeceer meoevevo ves keâF& keâe|ceÙeeW keâer meneÙelee mes heeBÛe mehleen kesâ Yeerlej 1300 kegâšerjeW leLee 40 hekeäkesâ cekeâeveeW kesâ meeLe ner Gme DebÛeue keâer veeefueÙeeW Deeefo keâer meHeâeF& keâjkesâ kegâue 160 ieeÌ[er keâÛeje nšeÙee Lee~12

10. mJeeceer Megæevevo kesâ 7 petve 1934 kesâ he$e ceW nw : ‘‘jeceke=â<Ce mebIe ceW mJeeceer Ùeesieevevo keâe Skeâ yeÌ[s GÛÛe meeOekeâ kesâ ¤he ceW ceeve Lee~ cenejepe (yeÇÿeevevo peer) kesâ yeeo meYeer GvneR keâe mecceeve keâjles Les~

11. mJeeceer meejoevevo ves iegpejele mes ueewšves kesâ yeeo 19 ceF& 1899 kesâ efove kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ keâes Skeâ he$e ceW efueKee Lee, ‘‘Margot is growing so fast ... She has grown thinner than before and I think a little over-zealous (at least she was so when I was away) about working for the plague. There is no necessity of lending as nurses in plague cases as yet – but the ‘dear girl’ did beyond her life twice that way. Thank God, she has been spared and we will have her for many more years to come. The plague has gone down for the present.’’

12. yeÇÿeJeeefoved heef$ekeâe kesâ efmelecyej 1900 keâe Debkeâ 140 mJeeceer meejoevevo

efceMeve keâe mesJeekeâeÙe& osKekeâj keâuekeâòeeJeeefmeÙeeW keâes mJeeceerpeer kesâ mesJee-oMe&ve keâe mee#eeled heefjÛeÙe efceuee Lee~ lelkeâeueerve YeejleJe<e& ceW Hewâues huesie kesâ Deelebkeâ keâer OeejCee keâjves kesâ efueS nceW mcejCe jKevee nesiee efkeâ mejkeâejer DeeBkeâÌ[eW kesâ Devegmeej 1896 mes 1907 lekeâ kesâ iÙeejn Je<eeX kesâ oewjeve kesâJeue Fmeer jesie mes 54 ueeKe mes Yeer DeefOekeâ ueesie ce=lÙeg kesâ efMekeâej ngS ngS Les~

Fmekesâ yeeo jeceke=â<Ce efceMeve Éeje keâuekeâòes ceW huesie-efveJeejCe nsleg yeÌ[s mlej hej efkeâmeer mesJee-keâeÙe& keâer DeeJeMÙekeâlee veneR ngF&~13 hejvleg efceMeve kesâ mJeÙebmesJekeâeW ves Yeeieuehegj ceW 1904, 1905 leLee 1906 F&. kesâ oewjeve huesie ceneceejer ceW mesJeekeâeÙe& efkeâÙee Lee~14

kegâceejer nsveefjÙesše cetuej keâer n"Jeeefolee leLee ogYee&iÙehetCe& DeeÛejCe Fme keâeue keâer Skeâ DevÙe og:Keo Iešvee nw~ Ùes ceefnuee YeejleJe<e& ceW mJeeceerpeer kesâ keâeÙe& ceW meneÙelee keâjves keâe mebkeâuhe ueskeâj Fme osMe ceW DeeÙeer LeeR~ ce" kesâ efueS yesuetÌ[ «eece ceW peceerve Kejeroves kesâ efueS DeefOekeâebMe Oeve GvneR ves efoÙee Lee~ hejvleg JÙeJenej ceW Jes LeeR – ‘#eCes ®°e #eCes leg°e, ®°e leg°e #eCes #eCes’~ ceeÛe& (1897) ceW Gvekesâ keâuekeâòes hengBÛeles ner Gvekesâ DeeÛejCe mes #egyOe neskeâj keâhleeve mesefJeÙej yebieueesj Ûeues ieÙes~ Gvekesâ JÙeJenej mes mJeeceerpeer leLee DevÙe ce"Jeemeer Yeer hejsMeeve nes G"s Les~ 9 veJecyej 1898 keâes Jes Deeqvlece yeej ce" ceW DeeÙeer LeeR~ mJeeceerpeer leLee ce" kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW Gvekeâer Ûeej efMekeâeÙeleW Leer15 – (keâ) mJeeceerpeer Skeâ mebIe kesâ mebie"ve leLee kegâÚ Deueewefkeâkeâ MeefòeâÙeeW keâer GheueeqyOe kesâ efueS ØeÙeeme keâjkesâ Yeer DemeHeâue ngS Les Deewj Fmekesâ HeâuemJe¤he metKekeâj PeÌ[ Ûegkesâ heg<he kesâ meceeve mJeeceerpeer kesâ Øeefle Gvekeâer ßeæe Yebie nes Ûegkeâer Leer~ (Ke) YeejleJeemeer peeot-šesvee peeveles nQ~ mebvÙeeefmeÙeeW ves peeot mes ßeerceleer yegue leLee kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ keâes JeMe ceW keâj efueÙee nw~ (ie) Deheveer Fme Keespe keâe FbiuewC[ leLee DevÙe osMeeW ceW peekeâj ØeÛeej keâjvee Gvekesâ efueS pe¤jer nw~ Deewj (Ie) F&meeF& Oece& mJeerkeâej efkeâÙes efyevee mJeeceerpeer leLee DevÙe mebvÙeeefmeÙeeW keâer cegefòeâ veneR nesieer~ Fve ceefnuee keâes meBYeeueves ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo keâes ner De«emej nesvee heÌ[e Lee~ hejvleg Jes Yeer Fvekeâes Meevle veneR keâj mekesâ~ Ùes ceefnuee ce"-efceMeve kesâ meeLe Dehevee mecheke&â efJeeqÛÚVe keâjves kesâ yeeo he$e-heef$ekeâeDeeW ceW Deewj efJeMes<ekeâj oef#eCe YeejleerÙe F&meeFÙeeW ceW mJeeceerpeer leLee ce" kesâ efJe®æ efJe<eJeceve keâjleer jneR~

  1. mJeeceer meejoevevo peer Éeje 2 DeØewue 1903 keâes efueKes ieÙes Skeâ he$e keâe DebMe – ‘‘The plague is raging hard in Calcutta and this time among the better classes. Many are dying at Baghbazar. The Vivekananda Society headed by Harimohan and guided by us has taken up disinfection work with success.’’
  2. History of Ramakrishna Math & Mission, 2nd Edn. p. 139

15. osJeIej mes 19 peveJejer 1899 kesâ Deheves he$e ceW mJeeceer meejoevevo ves Fme efJe<eÙe ceW kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ keâes efueKee Lee~

kegâceejer cetuej kesâ Oekeäkesâ mes Gyejles-ve-Gyejles ner mJeeceer DeYeÙeevevo veece keâer Skeâ mebvÙeeefmeveer Yeer Dee hengBÛeeR~ Fve øeâebmeermeer ceefnuee keâe hetJe&veece Lee – ceeoece cesjer uegF& Deewj Jes Decesefjkeâe keâer veeieefjkeâ LeeR~ henues Jes Skeâ jepeveweflekeâ keâceea LeeR~ GvneWves Decesefjkeâe ceW mJeeceerpeer mes mebvÙeeme-›ele keâer oer#ee ueer Leer~ Decesefjkeâe ceW mJeeceerpeer keâer DevegheeqmLeefle kesâ oewjeve Jes mJeÙeb ner Jesoevle-ØeÛeej ceW Glej heÌ[er LeeR~ Fme osMe ceW Deekeâj GvneWves cegcyeF&, ceõeme, keâuekeâòee leLee {ekeâe ceW JÙeeKÙeeve efoÙes~ DeYeÙeevevo kesâ Denbkeâej leLee Deke=âle%e-YeeJe mes mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo leLee DevÙe ce"Jeemeer hejsMeeve nes G"s~ keâuekeâòes ceW GvnW vejsvõveeLe efce$e kesâ Iej jKee ieÙee Lee~ Jes mebvÙeemeer leLee ie=ner YeòeâeW keâes lejn lejn mes lebie keâjleer jneR~ yengle mecePeevesyegPeeves keâe Yeer keâesF& Heâue veneR ngDee~ efveJesefolee ves 8 ceF& 1899 keâes kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ kesâ veece Skeâ he$e ceW efueKee Lee, ‘‘GvnW Ùeefo keâesF& meBYeeue mekeâlee nw, lees Jes legcnejs oesvecyejJeeues mJeeceerpeer ner nw~’’16 mJeeceer meejoevevo lejn lejn mes GvnW Meevle keâjves keâe ØeÙeeme keâjkesâ Yeer efJeHeâue ngS Les~ DeeefKejkeâej efJe#egyOe DeYeÙeevevo 7 petve 1899 keâes keâuekeâòee ÚesÌ[keâj Decesefjkeâe Ûeueer ieÙeeR Deewj JeneB mJeeceerpeer leLee ce" kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW lejn lejn mes keâheesue-keâequhele efvevoe keâjves ueieer~ Deewj Yeer kegâÚ Je<e& yeeo Jes YeejleJe<e& ueewškeâj ieewjebie meceepe ceW meeqcceefuele nes ieÙeer LeeR~ mJeeceerpeer kesâ 14 petve 1902 kesâ he$e mes %eele neslee nw, ‘‘cesjer uegF& ÙeneB ßeer ÛewlevÙe kesâ Yeòeâ kesâ ¤he ceW DeeÙeer ngF& nw~’’ hejvleg efÛej-#eceeMeerue mJeeceerpeer kesâ cegKe mes keâYeer efkeâmeer keâes cesjer uegF& kesâ efJe®æ keâesF& DeefYeMeehe megveves ceW veneR DeeÙee~

mJeeceer meejoevevo leLee mJeeceer legjerÙeevevo kesâ iegpejele leLee jepemLeeve ceW ØeÛeej-keâeÙe& meceehle keâjkesâ ueewšles ner mJeeceerpeer efÛeefkeâlmekeâeW keâer meueen hej otmejer yeej hee§eelÙe osMeeW keâer Ùee$ee hej peeves kesâ efueS Øemlegle ngS~17 YeejleJe<e& ceW Deheves DeejyOe keâeÙe& kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW mJeeceerpeer ves efJeefYeVe JÙeefòeâÙeeW kesâ meeLe ÛeÛee& keâer~ ce" keâer [eÙejer mes helee Ûeuelee nw efkeâ Skeâ efove18 GvneWves YeejleJe<e& ceW ce"-efceMeve kesâ keâeÙe& nsleg efpeme veerefle keâe DevegmejCe keâjvee nesiee, Fme efJe<eÙe ceW meejoevevo peer kesâ meeLe efJemleej mes ÛeÛee& keâer~ cetue yeele Ùen efkeâ osMe ceW ceveg<ÙeeW keâe efvecee&Ce keâjvee nesiee, ceveg<ÙeeW ceW keâeÙe&Meeruelee keâer Meefòeâ keâe efJekeâeme keâjvee nesiee~ mJeeceerpeer ves keâne, ‘‘Skeâ oue keâce&" mewefvekeâeW keâer DeeJeMÙekeâlee nw~ Fme lejn

16. efveJesefolee ves 4 ceF& 1899 kesâ efove kegâ. cewkeäueeG[ keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘Yesterday Swami II turned up at last. So we shall soon hear the king's marching order.’’

17. Fme efJe<eÙe ceW keâesF& mevosn veneR efkeâ mJeeceerpeer ›eâceMe: meejoevevo peer kesâ Thej efveYe&jMeerue nes ieÙes Les~ efveJesefolee ves 9 DeØewue 1899 kesâ efove kegâ. cewkeäueeG[ keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘About going (to Europe) the king said he would not think of it till Saradananda returns

– with no one else could he trust the men. That will please you I know.’’

18. 4 ceF& (1899) keâer Meece keâes~ 142 mJeeceer meejoevevo

kesâ ope&ve Yej eEmen hetjs peieled hej efJepeÙe Øeehle keâj mekeâles nQ, ueeKeeW YesÌ[eW mes Ùen keâece veneR nesiee~’’ mJeeceerpeer ves meeJeOeeve keâjles ngS keâne, ‘‘keâesF& JÙeefòeâiele DeeoMe&, Ûeens efpelevee Yeer yeÌ[e keäÙeeW ve nes, hejvleg efyevee efJeÛeejs Gmekeâe DevegmejCe keâjvee cele efmeKeevee~’’

mJeeceerpeer hegve: efJeosMeÙee$ee hej peevesJeeues Les Deewj efveef§ele ngDee efkeâ mJeeceer legjerÙeevevo leLee Yeefieveer efveJesefolee Yeer Gvekesâ meeLe peeÙeWies~ Ùee$ee keâer lewÙeeefjÙeeB Ûeue jner LeeR~ Gvekeâe DeefYevevove keâjves kesâ efueS 19 petve keâer mebOÙee keâes ce" ceW Skeâ DeveewheÛeeefjkeâ meYee keâe DeeÙeespeve efkeâÙee ieÙee~ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves Skeâ meceÙeesheÙeesieer mJeeiele-Yee<eCe efoÙee~ mJeeceer legjerÙeevevo ves DeeJesiehetCe& Yee<ee ceW JÙeeKÙeeve efoÙee~ mJeeceer DeKeC[evevo leLee DevÙe kegâÚ ueesieeW kesâ mebef#ehle Yee<eCe ngS~ DeefYevevove kesâ Gòej ceW mJeeceerpeer ves keâne, ‘‘meebmeeefjkeâ ueesie peerJeve mes Øesce keâjles nQ, hejvleg mebvÙeemeer keâes ce=lÙeg mes Øesce keâjvee nesiee~ ... nce meYeer keâe keâle&JÙe nw efkeâ Deenej-efJenej-DeOÙeÙeve Deeefo nce pees kegâÚ Yeer keâjles nQ, meye kegâÚ nceW DeelcelÙeeie keâer Deesj ues peeÙeW~’’ meYee kesâ Devle ceW, yeÇÿeÛeejer nefjØemeVe Éeje Deuhe DeJeefOe ceW ner ce" keâe efvecee&Ce-keâeÙe& megmecheVe keâjves kesâ efueS meyeves leerve yeej leeefueÙeeB yepeekeâj Gvekeâe DeefYevevove efkeâÙee~ Deieues efove mJeeceerpeer Deheveer efJeosMeÙee$ee hej efvekeâue heÌ[s~

nce henues yelee DeeÙes nQ efkeâ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves veÙes GÅece kesâ meeLe meeOeg-yeÇÿeÛeeefjÙeeW kesâ ØeefMe#eCe keâe keâeÙe& Meg¤ efkeâÙee Lee~ Fmekesâ HeâuemJe¤he veJeerve mebvÙeemeer leLee yeÇÿeÛeeefjÙeeW ceW pehe-OÙeeve-hee" leLee mesJeekeâeÙe& kesâ Øeefle Glmeen efoKeeF& os jne Lee~ Gmeer meceÙe Skeâ mecemÙee G" KeÌ[er ngF&~ yeeueer keâer veiejheeefuekeâe ves yesuetÌ[ ce" keâes efJeJeskeâevevo keâe GÅeeve yeleekeâj Gme hej uecyee-ÛeewÌ[e šwkeäme ueiee efoÙee Lee~ meejs DevegjesOeeW kesâ DemJeerke=âle nes peeves hej ce" kesâ mebÛeeuekeâeW ves cegkeâocee oeÙej efkeâÙee~ veiejheeefuekeâe kesâ efveoxMe hej YebefieÙeeW ves MeewÛeeueÙe keâer meHeâeF& yevo keâj oer~ ogie&vOe mes JeneB keâer JeeÙeg lekeâ otef<ele nes ieÙeer Leer~ Skeâ efove oeshenj kesâ meceÙe mJeeceer yeesOeevevo leLee Skeâ DevÙe JÙeefòeâ ves ÛegheÛeehe cesnlej keâe keâeÙe& hetje keâj efoÙee~ ce" kesâ jmeesFÙes ves Ùen Keyej yeeyetjece cenejepe kesâ keâeveeW lekeâ hengBÛee oer~ GvneWves Gve ueesieeW keâes yegueekeâj keâne, ‘‘pee pee, iebiee ceW pee! legce ueesie ievos nes, Deye keâYeer "ekegâj keâe keâece cele keâjvee~’’ Meesj-iegue megvekeâj Mejled cenejepe keâcejs mes yeenj efvekeâue DeeÙes~ GvneWves hetÚe, ‘‘keäÙee ngDee nw?’’ yeeyetjece cenejepe yeesues, ‘‘osKees ve, Ùes meejs heeKeeves meeHeâ keâj DeeÙes nQ~’’ Mejled cenejepe ves meye megvee~ DehejeÖ ceW ÛeeÙe kesâ meceÙe GvneWves keâes"ejer keâes yegueekeâj keâne, ‘‘Deepe jele meyekesâ efueS nuegDee-hetjer yeveeDees, KeÛe& ceQ otBiee~’’ jele ceW Keeves kesâ meceÙe Mejled cenejepe yeesues, ‘‘Fve ueesieeW kesâ mecceeve ceW ner Deepe Ùen oeJele oer pee jner nw~’’19

19. ßeer ßeermeejoevevo-Øemebie, he=. 108

mJeeceer mJe¤heevevo leLee mJeeceer keâuÙeeCeevevo ves Gmeer meceÙe jepehegleevee kesâ efkeâMeveieÌ{ ceW efceMeve keâe Dekeâeue-jenlekeâeÙe& DeejcYe efkeâÙee Lee~ kegâÚ efoveeW yeeo mJeeceer mJe¤heevevo keâes ‘Øeyegæ Yeejle’ kesâ keâeÙe& nsleg ceeÙeeJeleer Ûeues peevee heÌ[e~ mJeeceer keâuÙeeCeevevo ves mJeÙebmesJekeâeW keâes meeLe ueskeâj Dekesâues ner mesJeekeâeÙe& keâe mebÛeeueve efkeâÙee~ Ùen keâeÙe& Skeâ Je<e& mes Yeer DeefOekeâ keâeue lekeâ Ûeuee Lee~ mJeeceer keâuÙeeCeevevo yeerceej nes ieÙes nw – Ùen mebJeeo efceueles ner ce" mes mJeeceer efvece&ueevevo leLee mJeeceer Deelceevevo keâes JeneB Yespee ieÙee~ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves 29 ceeÛe& 1900 kesâ efove ßeerceleer yegue keâes Skeâ he$e ceW efueKee, ‘‘The famine work is getting on well. Some hundred boys and girls are there now. We shall try to secure a place at Cawnpur to remove these orphans from Rajasthan.’’

ome cenerveeW lekeâ 444 yeeuekeâ-yeeefuekeâeDeeW kesâ efueS Skeâ DeveeLeeueÙe ÛeueeÙee ieÙee Lee~20 1900 kesâ veJecyej lekeâ FmeceW 50 yeeuekeâ leLee 20 yeeefuekeâeSB ner jn ieÙeer LeeR~21 Devlele: Gve DeveeLe yeÛÛeeW keâes Gvekesâ meies-mecyeeqvOeÙeeW kesâ heeme Yespeves leLee DevÙe Øekeâej mes Gvekeâer meneÙelee keâjves kesâ yeeo DeveeLeeßece keâes yevo keâj efoÙee ieÙee~

22. mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo keâer [eÙejer~ 144 mJeeceer meejoevevo

mJeeceer meejoevevo leLee DevÙe ce"Jeemeer Deelebefkeâle nes G"s~ DeeÙegJexefokeâ efÛeefkeâlmee leLee mesJee-Megßet<ee kesâ HeâuemJe¤he jesie ceW LeesÌ[e megOeej ngDee~ jesie mes ogye&ue nes peeves ceeÙeeJeleer mes ueewšves kesâ yeeo mJeeceerpeer ves Skeâ cenòJehetCe& meebie"efvekeâ keâeÙe& ceW neLe ueieeÙee~ Fmekesâ hetJe& yesuetÌ[ keâer peceerve leLee veJeefvee|cele YeJeve hej veiejheeefuekeâe Éeje šwkeäme ueieeves keâer mecemÙee G"er Leer~ Fmekesâ Deefleefjòeâ mJeeceerpeer keâes Deheveer Fnueeruee keâer meceeeqhle keâe Yeer mebkesâle efceue jne Lee~ Dele: Jes Deheves veece hej Kejeros ieÙes YetKeC[ leLee YeJeveeW keâer

23. Deheves 16 petve kesâ he$e ceW mJeeceerpeer ves efueKee nw, ‘‘efMeueebie ceW cegPes pJej nesves ueiee Lee leLee Õeeme keâer yeerceejer Deewj ‘Sueyegefceve’ keâer efMekeâeÙele yeÌ{ ieÙeer Leer~’’

keâevetveer JÙeJemLee keâj peeves kesâ efueS efÛeeqvlele nes G"s~ 12 Deòetâyej 1897 keâes yeÇÿeevevo peer kesâ veece efueKes Gvekesâ Skeâ he$e mes Fme efJe<eÙe ceW Gvekeâer efJeefYeVe efÛevleeDeeW keâe heefjÛeÙe Øeehle neslee nw~ GvneWves efueKee Lee, ‘‘legjvle Skeâ Jekeâerue kesâ heeme peekeâj Gmekeâer jeÙe mes Ùen JemeerÙeleveecee efueKe oes efkeâ cesjs leLee legcnejs cejCeeshejevle nefj SJeb Mejled ce" keâer mecheefòe kesâ DeefOekeâejer neWies~’’ DeeefKejkeâej GvneWves efveef§ele efkeâÙee efkeâ Jes ßeerjeceke=â<Ce kesâ veece hej Skeâ osJeesòej vÙeeme yeveekeâj, Dehevee mJelJeeefOekeâej lÙeeie keâjles ngS, kegâÚ ieg®YeeFÙeeW keâes meeje GòejoeefÙelJe meeQhe oWies~ Fmeer efveefceòe GvneWves hesefjme ceW jnles meceÙe Skeâ Ùeespevee yeveeÙeer~ JeneR mes 25 Deiemle (1900) keâes efveJesefolee kesâ veece Skeâ he$e ceW GvneWves efueKee, ‘‘FOej š^mš kesâ omleeJespe omleKele kesâ efueS heÌ[s ngS Les; Dele: efyeÇefšMe keâeQefmeue kesâ DeeefHeâme ceW peekeâj ceQves Gve hej nmlee#ej keâj efoÙes nQ~ Deye Jes keâeiepe-he$e Yeejle kesâ ceeie& ceW nQ~ ... jeceke=â<Ce efceMeve kesâ DeOÙe#e keâe heo Yeer ceQves lÙeeie efoÙee nw~ Deye ce" Deeefo meye kegâÚ keâe GòejoeefÙelJe cegPes ÚesÌ[keâj ßeerjeceke=â<CeosJe kesâ DevÙe mee#eeled efMe<ÙeeW hej nw~ Fme meceÙe yeÇÿeevevo DeOÙe#e efveJee&efÛele ngS nQ, Gvekesâ yeeo ›eâceMe: Øesceevevo FlÙeeefo hej Gmekeâe GòejoeefÙelJe nesiee~ Deye Ùen meesÛekeâj cegPes yeÌ[s Deevevo keâe DevegYeJe nes jne nw efkeâ cesjs cemlekeâ mes Skeâ Yeejer yeesPe Glej ieÙee!’’ Fme keâevetveer JÙeJemLee keâes hekeäkeâe keâjves kesâ efueS Yeejle ueewšves kesâ yeeo 30 peveJejer 1901 keâes mJeeceerpeer ves Deewj Yeer Skeâ omleeJespe hej nmlee#ej efkeâÙee~ 6 HeâjJejer keâes Fme omleeJespe keâe hebpeerkeâjCe ngDee~ Fmemes mJeeceerpeer keâes ÚesÌ[keâj ßeerjeceke=â<Ce kesâ iÙeejn efMe<Ùe š^mšer efveÙegòeâ ngS Les~ mJeeceerpeer kesâ efkeâmeer Yeer efMe<Ùe keâes FmeceW Meeefceue veneR efkeâÙee ieÙee Lee~ mJeeceerpeer keâer GheeqmLeefle ceW 10 HeâjJejer keâes vÙeemeer ceC[ue keâer henueer meYee Devegeq‰le ngF&~ mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo Fmekesâ ØeLece DeOÙe#e leLee mJeeceer meejoevevo henues meefÛeJe efveÙegòeâ ngS~ Fmeer meceÙe veiejheeefuekeâe kesâ efJe®æ pees cegkeâocee Ûeue jne Lee, Gme hej 23 HeâjJejer keâes GÛÛe vÙeeÙeeueÙe keâe Hewâmeuee ngDee~ FmeceW ce" kesâ mebÛeeuekeâeW keâer efJepeÙe ngF& Leer~

FvneR efoveeW mJeeceer meejoevevo Ùeke=âle kesâ jesie mes keâ° hee jns Les~ efÛeefkeâlmekeâeW keâes DeeMebkeâe Leer efkeâ Gvekesâ Ùeke=âle ceW HeâesÌ[e nes ieÙee nw~ mJeeceerpeer ves GefÉie> neskeâj ®õeefYe<eskeâ-Ùeeie keâjeÙee Deewj mveeve keâe peue meejoevevo peer kesâ efueS Yespe efoÙee~ [e@keäšj censvõveeLe cepetceoej keâer efÛeefkeâlmee mes meejoevevo peer MeerIeÇ ner keâeHeâer-kegâÚ mJemLe nes G"s~24 hejvleg mJeeYeeefJekeâ mJeemLÙe kesâ ueewšves ceW Deewj Yeer meceÙe ueiee Lee~ mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo keâer [eÙejer mes helee Ûeuelee nw efkeâ 15 DeØewue (1901) keâes mJeeceer meejoevevo peueJeeÙeg-heefjJele&ve kesâ efueS oee|peeEueie ieÙes Les~ meevÙeeue ceneMeÙe leLee yeÇÿeÛeejer vevoueeue Gvekesâ menÙee$eer ngS

24. õ°JÙe – mJeeceer meejoevevo, he=. 140-41~ mJeeceerpeer ves 29 ceeÛe& 1901 keâes {ekeâe mes ßeerceleer yegue keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘meejoevevo ves DeejesiÙeueeYe keâj efueÙee nw Deewj ce" ceW nw~’’

146 mJeeceer meejoevevo

Les~ Fmeer [eÙejer keâes heÌ{keâj Ssmee ueielee nw efkeâ Jes mJeeceerpeer kesâ yegueeJes hej efkeâmeer efJeMes<e keâeÙe& nsleg petve kesâ ceOÙe Yeeie ceW Skeâ yeej ce" DeeÙes Les~ 3 petve keâes mJeeceer jeceke=â<Ceevevo kesâ veece efueefKele mJeeceerpeer kesâ he$e ceW nw, ‘‘Mejled keâue oee|peeEueie mes ce" Dee hengBÛee nw

– Gmekeâe Mejerj Yeer Deye henues mes yengle-kegâÚ DeÛÚe nw~’’ JeneB keâe keâeÙe& meceehle keâjves kesâ yeeo Jes hegve: oee|peeEueie ueewš ieÙes Deewj hetjer leewj mes mJemLe neskeâj 15 pegueeF& (1901) keâes ce" Jeeheme DeeÙes Les~

yesuetÌ[ ce" ceW Øeeflecee ceW ogiee&hetpee keâe Deveg‰eve 1901 F&. keâer Skeâ mcejCeerÙe Iešvee nw~ ßeerceeB leLee Yeòeâ-ceefnueeDeeW keâes "njeves kesâ efueS veerueecyej-GÅeeve keâes Skeâ ceen kesâ efueS efkeâjeÙes hej efueÙee ieÙee Lee~ hetpee keâe mebkeâuhe ßeerceeB kesâ veece hej ngDee Lee~ yeÇÿeÛeejer ke=â<Ceueeue ves hetpee keâer leLee leb$eceb$e-keâesefJeo F&ÕejÛevõ Ûe›eâJeleea ves leb$eOeejkeâ keâe GòejoeefÙelJe meBYeeuee Lee~ Fmekesâ yeeo Øeeflecee ceW ner ue#ceerhetpee leLee keâeueerhetpee keâe Yeer Deveg‰eve ngDee~ hetjs Skeâ ceen lekeâ ce"JeeefmeÙeeW kesâ peerJeve ceW Deevevo keâer yeeÌ{ Dee ieÙeer Leer~ ce" ceW efJeefOehetJe&keâ hetpeeDeveg‰eve nesles osKekeâj JeneB kesâ keâójhevLeer yeÇeÿeCe heeqC[leeW kesâ ceve keâe efJeÉs<eYeeJe LeesÌ[e keâce ngDee Lee~

1902 F&. keâer 6 peveJejer keâes peeheeve kesâ efJeÉeved yeewæ-hegjesefnle šekegâvees Dees[e25 leLee efÛe$ekeâej Deeskeâekegâje mJeeceerpeer mes efceueves ce" ceW DeeÙes~26 Jes ueesie ‘hewve-SefMeÙee jsefuepeme keâebøeWâme’ ceW Yeeie uesves kesâ efueS mJeeceerpeer keâes Deecebef$ele keâjves DeeÙes Les~ Jewmes Fmekesâ hetJe& ner mJeeceerpeer keâes he$e kesâ ceeOÙece mes Ùen Deeceb$eCe Øeehle nes Ûegkeâe Lee~ kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ keâer efJeMes<e FÛÚe Leer efkeâ mJeeceerpeer Fmes mJeerkeâej keâj ueW~ 14 petve 1901 keâes Gvekesâ veece efueKes mJeeceerpeer kesâ Skeâ he$e keâe DebMe Fme Øekeâej nw – ‘‘peeheeve leLee Yeejle kesâ yeerÛe mecyevOe mLeeefhele nesvee efveleevle JeebÚveerÙe nw~ ... efØeÙe ‘pees’, Ùeefo cegPes peeheeve peevee heÌ[s, lees keâeÙe& kesâ mebÛeeueve kesâ efueS Deyekeâer yeej meejoevevo keâes Deheves meeLe ues peevee DeeJeMÙekeâ nw~ ... leLeeefhe ceeB ner meye peeveleer nQ, ceQves DeYeer lekeâ kegâÚ leÙe veneR efkeâÙee nw~’’ Fve oesveeW DeefleefLeÙeeW kesâ meeLe veJepee«ele peeheeve leLee JeneB kesâ yeewæ Oece& kesâ efJe<eÙe ceW mJeeceerpeer keâer mejme ÛeÛee& ngF&~ kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ leLee Deeskeâekegâje kesâ Dee«en hej mJeeceerpeer 27 peveJejer keâes Gvekesâ meeLe yeeBkeâerhegj (hešvee) nesles ngS yeesOeieÙee ieÙes~ mJeeceerpeer kesâ mesJekeâ kesâ ¤he ceW mJeeceer efveYe&Ùeevevo Yeer ieÙes Les~ yeesOeieÙee ceW Skeâ mehleen efyeleeves kesâ yeeo mJeeceerpeer JeejeCemeer Ûeues

25. ‘‘In Tokyo Joe lived with a Japanese family, the head of which was a learned Buddhist priest, Takuno Oda, Reverend Oda lived in the ancient Shounji temple, a Shiva temple at Asakusa.’’ (The Life of Josephine Mcleod, ibid, p. 121)

26. jsJejsC[ Deeskeâekegâje leLee Gvekesâ yeeuemesJekeâ nesjer, kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ kesâ meeLe Gmeer efove keâuekeâòes hengBÛes Les~ (õ°JÙe – Pravrajika Prabudhaprana : The Life of Josephine Mcleod, p. 123)

ieÙes~ Fmekesâ kegâÚ efoveeW he§eeled ner kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ Yeer uevove jJeevee nes ieÙeeR~27

FOej vesheeue kesâ jepee keâe he$e heekeâj mJeeceer meejoevevo ves 20 HeâjJejer keâes mšsMeve peekeâj Gvekeâe mJeeiele efkeâÙee~ jepee mJeeceerpeer keâes Deecebef$ele keâjves DeeÙes Les~ meceeÛeej DeeÙee efkeâ mJeeceerpeer efHeâj mes yeerceej Deewj efyemlej hekeâÌ[s nQ~ Jes DeefJeuecye mJeeceer efMeJeevevo leLee mJeeceer efvejbpeveevevo keâes meeLe efueS 8 ceeÛe& (1902) keâes ce" ueewš DeeÙes~ ce"Jeemeer mJeeceerpeer keâe peerCe&-MeerCe& Mejerj osKekeâj DeeMebefkeâle nes G"s~ JewÅekeâer oJee nesleer jner ›eâceMe: Gvekeâer DeJemLee ceW LeesÌ[e megOeej Yeer ngDee~ FOej mJeeceerpeer kesâ DeeosMe hej mJeeceer meejoevevo mJeeceer efveYe&Ùeevevo keâes meeLe ueskeâj vesheeue ieÙes~ mecYeJele: JeneB Gvekesâ JÙeeKÙeeve Deeefo Yeer ngS~ yeesOeieÙee nesles ngS 28 DeØewue keâes Jes ueesie ce" ueewšs~ jsJejsC[ Dees[e Yeer leye yeesOeieÙee ceW ner efveJeeme keâj jns Les~ Jes Yeer meejoevevo peer kesâ meeLe ce" DeeÙes~

mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ he$e ceW Ssmee GuuesKe efceuelee nw efkeâ mJeeceerpeer Gve efoveeW meJe&oe keâne keâjles Les, ‘‘cesje keâeÙe& nes Ûegkeâe nw, Deye legcneR ueesie meye osKeYeeue keâjes Deewj cegPes Úgóer oes~’’28 keâecekeâepe ceW keâesF& Yetue Ùee efJeuecye osKeves hej, ‘‘keâeÙe& De«emej veneR nes jne nw’’ – Ssmee meesÛekeâj yeerÛe yeerÛe ceW DeOeerj nes G"les~ JÙeeefOe keâer heerÌ[e mes ›eâceMe: Gvekeâe efcepeepe Yeer ®#e nes ieÙee Lee~ kegâÚ keâeue hetJe& ner GvneWves mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘cesjer ¤Ì{lee kesâ efueS ogKeer cele nesvee~ cegKe ceW Ûeens pees Yeer jns – legce cesje ùoÙe lees peeveles ner nes~’’ kesâJeue mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo ner veneR, Gvekesâ meYeer ieg®YeeF& mJeeceerpeer kesâ ùoÙe keâer iecYeerj Øeerefle mes megheefjefÛele Les~ veejepeieer Ùee Gòespevee kesâ HeâuemJe¤he Gvekeâe mJeemLÙe keâneR Deewj ve efyeieÌ[ peeÙe – Fme efJe<eÙe ceW meYeer ueesie efJeMes<e ¤he mes meeJeOeeveer yejleles Les~ Jewmes mJeeceerpeer keâer [eBš-Heâškeâej hej mJeeceer meejoevevo keâer Øeefleef›eâÙee hetCe&le: ceewefuekeâ Leer Deewj Jen kesâJeue GvneR kesâ Éeje ner mecYeJe Leer~ Skeâ GoenjCe osKeW~

Skeâ efove mJeeceerpeer ves efkeâmeer keâeÙe& keâe GòejoeefÙelJe oskeâj mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo leLee mJeeceer meejoevevo keâes keâuekeâòes Yespee Lee~ ce" ceW ueewšves kesâ yeeo meejoevevo peer ves mJeeceerpeer keâes metefÛele efkeâÙee efkeâ Jen keâeÙe& nes veneR mekeâe nw~ Gvekesâ efveoxMe keâe DevegmejCe ve keâjkesâ, mecYeJele: Deheveer yegefæ ueieeves kesâ keâejCe ner Ùen efJeHeâuelee ngF& nw – Ssmee Devegceeve ueieekeâj mJeeceerpeer ves leer#Ce keâC" mes keâne, ‘‘jKe os Deheveer ÚšeBkeâ Yej yegefæ, meto-cetue yeÌ{s, Gmekesâ yeeo keâece ceW ueieevee~’’ Ssmeer Yelme&vee megvekeâj Yeer meejoevevo peer ceW keâesF& Øeefleef›eâÙee veneR Âef°ieesÛej ngF&~ LeesÌ[er osj yeeo mesJekeâ efveYe&Ùeevevo oesveeW keâes ÛeeÙe os ieÙes~ meejoevevo peer

  1. Fmekesâ Ûeewon Je<e& yeeo ner, ßeer leLee ßeerceleer ies[sme kesâ meeLe kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ efHeâj Yeejle DeeÙeer LeeR~
  2. Gvekeâe 7 Deiemle 1902 keâe he$e~ kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ kesâ 10 Deiemle 1902 kesâ he$e ceW nw : ‘‘He (Swamiji) always said He would die at 40.’’

148 mJeeceer meejoevevo

efvee|Jekeâej efÛeòe mes ÛeeÙe heerles jns~ mJeeceerpeer ceevees LeesÌ[s nleeMe neskeâj ner yeesue G"s, ‘‘Fmekeâe ceevees ‘yesues’ ceÚueer keâe Ketve nw, kewâmes Yeer iejce ner veneR neslee~’’ ÛeeÙe heervee DeYeer Ûeue ner jne Lee efkeâ mJeeceerpeer ves Skeâ DevÙe Øemebie ÚsÌ[e~ keâF& lejn keâer yeeleeW kesâ yeeo GvneWves hetÚe, ‘‘legcneje keäÙee cele nw, Mejled?’’ meejoevevo peer ves Meevle keâC" mes keâne, ‘‘YeeF&, legcneR ves lees yeleeÙee efkeâ ÚšeBkeâ Yej yegefæ nw~’’ mJeeceerpeer nBme heÌ[s Deewj Mejled cenejepe Yeer nBmeves ueies~

4 pegueeF& keâes mJeeceerpeer ves cenemeceeefOe ceW osnlÙeeie efkeâÙee~ ce" keâe peerJeve ceevees mleyOe jn ieÙee~ ÛeejeW Deesj nleeMee keâe DevOekeâej Úe ieÙee~ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves 7 Deiemle kesâ he$e ceW mJeeceer DeYesoevevo keâes efueKee, ‘‘ueieYeie oes ceen hetJe& Jes JeejeCemeer ieÙes Les, JeneB mes yengle ner Kejeye mJeemLÙe ueskeâj Jeeheme ueewšs~ ce" ueewškeâj GvneWves JewÅekeâer efÛeefkeâlmee keâjeÙeer~ Fmemes keâeHeâer megOeej ngDee Lee~ Skeâ cenerves oJee uesves mes neLeheeBJe keâe metpeve otj nes ieÙee; hesš ceW Yeer heeveer veneR jne~ Mejerj keâe ueeJeCÙe ueewš DeeÙee Deewj yeue ceW Yeer DeÛÚer Je=efæ ngF& Leer~’’ 20 Deiemle keâes mJeeceer Øesceevevo ves GvneR keâes efueKee, ‘‘Fme meceÙe nce ueesie ceevees peerJevce=le nes ieÙes nQ~ ... kegâÚ efoveeW mes GveceW JewjeiÙe keâe YeeJe Ketye Øeyeue efoKeeF& os jne Lee~ Jes ØeeÙe: efkeâceLeË keâmÙe keâeceeÙe Mejerjb Devegmebpejsled – efkeâme keâejCe, efkeâme keâecevee keâer hete|le kesâ efueS Mejerj mes pegÌ[s jne peeÙe’

– Ùener Mueeskeâ ognjeÙee keâjles Les~ Deewj hetÚe keâjles, ‘keäÙeeW js, "ekegâj Deheves Deeqvlece efoveeW ceW keâewve-mes oes Yepeve megvevee hemevo keâjles Les?’ Flevee keânkeâj Jes ‘YegJeve YegueeFueer ceeB YeJeceesefnveer – (YeeJeeLe&) ns efMeJe keâes ceesnvesJeeueer ceeB, legceves hetjs peieled keâes Yeguee jKee nw’ leLee ‘keâyes meceeefOe nyes MÙeeceeÛejCes – (YeeJeeLe&) keâye ceeB keâeueer kesâ ÛejCeeW ceW cesje ceve leuueerve nes peeÙesiee’ – Ùes Yepeve ieeves ueieles~ ... keâecekeâepe kesâ efveefceòe Mejled leLee jeKeeue oes-Ûeej efoveeW kesâ efueS keâuekeâòes ceW Les~ hegjeves ueesieeW ceW ieesheeue oeoe leLee ceQ ner Gme efove ce" ceW Les~’’ Gme efove ceeqvoj kesâ Éej yevo keâjkesâ "ekegâj keâes Jes ner oes Yepeve megveeves kesâ yeeo nBmeles ngS ‘DeKeC[ kesâ Iej kesâ $e+ef<e’ mebmeej kesâ neš mes Ûeues ieÙes~’’29

Meeskeâele& yeÇÿeevevo kesâ cegKe mes megvee ieÙee, ‘‘meeceves mes ceevees efnceeueÙe heneÌ[ DeÂMÙe nes ieÙee~’’ kegâÚ efoveeW lekeâ ce"Jeemeer eEkeâkeâle&JÙeefJecetÌ{ neLe-heeBJe mecesškeâj yew"s jns Deewj osMe ceW meJe&$e he$e-heef$ekeâeDeeW kesâ ceeOÙece mes mJeeceerpeer hej ÛeÛee& nesleer jner~ Dee§eÙe& keâer yeele Ùen osKeves ceW DeeÙeer efkeâ mJeeceerpeer kesâ menmee eflejesOeeve mes pevemeeOeejCe ceW Deewj efJeMes<ekeâj le®CeeW ceW ceevees Ûeslevee ueewš DeeÙeer nw~ Fme Meesjiegue kesâ yeerÛe kegâÚ efJejesOeer šesefueÙeeW keâer kegâeqlmele Øeefleef›eâÙee keâer OJeefve Yeer megveeF& heÌ[er~

29. mJeeceer meejoevevo ves 5 Deiemle 1902 keâes kegâceejer cesjer nsue kesâ veece Deheves he$e ceW efueKee Lee : ‘‘His death has been as glorious as his life had been. He passed away while meditating in his own room in Samadhi ... .’’

FOej ieg®YeeF& DeKeC[evevo DeeÙes ngS Les~ Gvekesâ ves$e MetvÙe Les~ mJeeceerpeer kesâ keâcejs ceW ØeefJe° neskeâj Jes ienjs OÙeeve ceW [tye ieÙes~ GvnW osKekeâj ieg®YeeFÙeeW keâes efÛevlee ngF&~ keâF& efoveeW lekeâ ØeÙeeme keâjves kesâ yeeo GvnW mJeeYeeefJekeâ DeJemLee ceW ueeÙee ieÙee~ megveves ceW DeeÙee efkeâ mJeeceerpeer ves GvnW oMe&ve oskeâj Meevle efkeâÙee nw~ mJeeceer legjerÙeevevo Decesefjkeâe mes ueewšles meceÙe jbietve ceW mJeeceerpeer keâer cenemeceeefOe keâe meceeÛeej heekeâj efyeukegâue štš ieÙes~ Jes 29 pegueeF& keâes ce" ceW hengBÛes~ GvneWves mebkeâuhe efkeâÙee efkeâ Jes Dehevee yeekeâer peerJeve lehemÙee ceW ner efyeleeSBies~ Jes Je=voeJeve keâer Deesj Ûeue heÌ[s~ yeÇÿeÛeejer ke=â<Ceueeue keâes Yeer Gvekesâ meeLe Yespee ieÙee~ mJeeceer jeceke=â<Ceevevo ceõeme mes Ûeuekeâj 19 Deòetâyej keâes ce" ceW hengBÛes~ ce"JeeefmeÙeeW ves Gvekesâ cegKe mes Skeâ Deueewefkeâkeâ oMe&ve keâer yeele megveer~ osnlÙeeie kesâ yeeo mJeeceerpeer ves Gvekesâ meccegKe Øekeâš neskeâj keâne Lee, ‘‘MeMeer, ceQves Mejerj keâes Letkeâ kesâ meceeve HeWâkeâ efoÙee nw~’’ kegâÚ efoveeW yeeo jeceke=â<Ceevevo peer Deheves keâce&#es$e keâes ueewš ieÙes~ mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo, mJeeceer Øesceevevo leLee mJeeceer meejoevevo keâes ner Deheves MeeskeâefJe£ue ieg®YeeFÙeeW keâes meBYeeuevee heÌ[e Lee~

mJeeceerpeer kesâ eflejesOeeve kesâ kegâÚ keâeue yeeo ner keâF& mecemÙeeSB Øekeâš ngFË~ mJeeceerpeer keâer ceevemekeâvÙee efveJesefolee efÉleerÙe yeej YeejleJe<e& ceW Deeves kesâ yeeo mes, henues lees ieesheveerÙeleehetJe&keâ leLee yeeo ceW Kegues ¤he mes osMe kesâ jepeveweflekeâ ef›eâÙee-keâueeheeW mes pegÌ[ ieÙeer LeeR~ mJeeceerpeer keâe mhe° efveoxMe Lee efkeâ ce" leLee efceMeve keâes jepeveerefle mes cegòeâ jKevee nesiee~ efÛeeqvlele neskeâj mJeeceer yeÇÿeevevo leLee mJeeceer meejoevevo ves Fme efJe<eÙe hej efveJesefolee kesâ meeLe keâF& yeej ÛeÛee& keâer~ efveJesefolee Deheves keâce&heLe ceW efkeâmeer Yeer Øekeâej keâe heefjJele&ve keâjves keâes jepeer veneR ngFË~ Gvekeâe efJeÕeeme Lee efkeâ Gvekeâe keâce&#es$e kesâJeue Oece& leLee veejer-efMe#ee lekeâ meerefcele ve neskeâj, keâeHeâer efJemle=le nw~ FmeerefueS Devlele: GvneWves jeceke=â<Ce mebIe keâes ÚesÌ[ves keâe ogKeo efveCe&Ùe efueÙee~ 19 pegueeF& (1902) keâes ‘Dece=leyeepeej heef$ekeâe’ ves Iees<eCee keâer efkeâ Deye mes Yeefieveer efveJesefolee kesâ ef›eâÙee-keâueeheeW kesâ efueS ce"-efceMeve kesâ mebÛeeuekeâieCe GòejoeÙeer veneR neWies~ Fme meceeÛeej hej veJepeele jeceke=â<Ce mebIe kesâ Me$egieCe Guueefmele nes G"s~ Gve ueesieeW ves Yeefieveer keâe he#e ueskeâj Deheveer uesKeveer¤heer leueJeej mes ce" kesâ efJe®æ ÙeLeemeeOÙe keâuee-keâewMeue keâe ØeoMe&ve efkeâÙee~ Jewmes, keâevetveer leewj hej mecyevOe-efJeÛÚso kesâ yeeJepeto ce" kesâ hegjeves mebvÙeeefmeÙeeW keâe Yeefieveer kesâ meeLe ceOegj mecheke&â efvejvlej yevee jne~ mJeeceer meejoevevo ves efveJesefolee keâes ‘My Western friend’30 keâne nw~ mJeeceerpeer keâer ceevemekeâvÙee efveJesefolee kesâ meeLe mJeeceer meejoevevo keâe Deevleefjkeâ ueieeJe Lee~ keâce& kesâ #es$e ceW GvneR kesâ meeLe efveJesefolee keâe Ieefve‰lej mecheke&â Lee~ efveJesefolee keâer Yeer mJeeceer meejoevevo kesâ Øeefle DeieeOe ßeæe leLee efveYe&jlee Leer~

30. ‘cesjer hee§eelÙe efce$e’~ efveJesefolee kesâ 5/1/1899 kesâ he$e ceW GodOe=le~

150 mJeeceer meejoevevo

FOej Øeleehe Ûevõ cepetceoej, Deveeieefjkeâ Oece&heeue, kegâceejer cetuej, mJeeceer DeYeÙeevevo Deeefo ves mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo kesâ Øeefle Dehevee Dee›eâesMe leLee Dee›eâceCe peejer jKee~ otmejer Deesj yeÇeÿemeceepe kesâ efkeâmeer efkeâmeer oue, veJeyeewæ Deevoesueve, veJe-Jew<CeJe Deevoesueve leLee F&meeF& efceMevejer Deheves meejs nefLeÙeejeW mes mJeeceer efJeJeskeâevevo leLee Gvekesâ Éeje mLeeefhele ce" leLee efceMeve hej ueieeleej Øenej keâjles jns~ keâYeer keâYeer Fme lejn keâe Dee›eâceCe DelÙevle leer›e nes G"lee Lee~31 keânvee ve nesiee efkeâ ce"-efceMeve kesâ mebÛeeuekeâeW kesâ efueS Ùes meejer efJejesOeer Øeefleef›eâÙeeSB efveleevle DeØelÙeeefMele LeeR~

Jewmes, Jesoveeefleòeâ Fve meejer Øeefleef›eâÙeeDeeW – Yeefieveer efveJesefolee Éeje jeceke=â<Ce efceMeve mes mecyevOe-efJeÛÚso keâer Iees<eCee, Skeâ efJeefÛe$e efJeJeskeâevevo DevegjeefieÙeeW keâer šesueer Éeje ‘yesuetÌ[ ce" nceejs ieg® keâe ce" nw’ keâer DeeJeepe G"ekeâj keâesueenue keâjvee32, leLee ce" kesâ meeOeg-yeÇÿeÛeeefjÙeeW keâe keâce&-JewjeiÙe – ce" kesâ mebÛeeuekeâeW keâes efÛevlee ceW [euekeâj Yeer GvnW efJeÛeefuele veneR keâj mekeâe Lee~ Gvekeâer eqmLej yegefæ, efJeÕeeme leLee OewÙe& ves GvnW mecemle yeeOee-efJeheefòeÙeeW keâes heej keâjves ceW meneÙelee keâer Leer~ ‘‘yeÌ[s Je=#e keâer ÚeÙee leues Úesšs Je=#eeW keâe efJekeâeme veneR nes mekeâlee’’ – ceevees mJeeceerpeer keâer Fmeer Gefòeâ keâer melÙelee ØeceeefCele keâjves keâes meejoevevo peer Deeefo vesleeDeeW ceW Deefcele lespe leLee DeelceefJeÕeeme keâe mHegâjCe ngDee Lee Deewj mJeeceerpeer kesâ Øeefle Gvekeâer DeieeOe efve‰e Deewj Yeer mhe° nes ieÙeer Leer~ meejoevevo peer kesâ JÙeefòeâlJe leLee Gvekeâer ØeMeemeveerÙe #ecelee ceW DekeâuheveerÙe efJekeâeme keâes osKekeâj efveJesefolee ves mJeeceerpeer kesâ ceneØeÙeeCe kesâ oes ceen yeeo ner kegâceejer cewkeäueeG[ keâes efueKee Lee, ‘‘You do not know how Swami Saradananda grows in strength. Now how strong they all seem.’’33 mJeeceerpeer keâer YeeJeeefie> mes Göerhle mebvÙeemeerieCe Gvekeâer heleekeâe keâes G"ekeâj Deeies yeÌ{ Ûeues~ Gvekeâer DeocÙe ieefle leLee DeefveJeeÙe& meHeâuelee osKekeâj meYeer ueesie "ies-mes jn ieÙes~ cenekeâeue ves efJejesOe kesâ meÌ[sieues keâeiepeeW keâes G"ekeâj HeWâkeâ efoÙee Deewj mJeeceerpeer Éeje ØeJee|lele YeeJeevoesueve kesâ cemlekeâ keâes efJepeÙe keâer šerkeâe mes Deuebke=âle efkeâÙee~

mJeeceerpeer kesâ ceneØeÙeeCe mes JÙeefLele mebvÙeeefmeÙeeW ceW mes keâesF& keâesF& efve®lmeeefnle nes ieÙes Les, Ùee efHeâj efkeâmeer efkeâmeer ves efvepe&ve ceW jnkeâj peerJeve efyeleeves keâe mebkeâuhe efkeâÙee Lee~ meejoevevo ves mebvÙeeefmeÙeeW keâer Skeâ meYee yegueeF&~ GvneWves Gve ueesieeW keâes mecePeeles ngS keâne efkeâ mebIe
